text: Following the surrender of the great leader PERSON, PERSON — the last Apache warrior — is captured and sent on a prison train to a reservation in GPE. But he manages to escape in GPE and heads back to his homeland to win back his woman and settle down to grow crops. His pursuers have other ideas, though.

The story revolves around ORG, an assassin who navigates the challenges of battling DNA Hackers, individuals who utilize their skills to gain unauthorized access to people's bodies with fatal outcomes. Alongside her personal struggles with past demons, PERSON also bears the responsibility of keeping her younger brother, PERSON, from falling prey to trouble. Unfortunately, PERSON becomes involved in a robbery, propelling him into a dark world of underground trades that involves DNA Hackers, PERSON, and PERSON. Despite PERSON's efforts to keep him away from such vices, PERSON's desire for respect leads him deeper into the dangerous world. PERSON, on the other hand, has always desired a peaceful existence away from the city. As the siblings face multiple challenges, including gunfights, they must navigate their way through an immoral world while holding on to the hope that love can conquer all and that family bonds are unbreakable.

The protagonist, a likeable American cowboy (ORG) in GPE-period 19th-Century GPE, becomes trapped in the middle of the strife between two feuding aristocratic Japanese families. The cowboy possesses a priceless scroll, acquired by chance while he was in GPE, which both warring families want. Violent fighting ensues, involving GPE swords, a Gatling gun, and a makeshift single-shot blunderbuss. In the end the cowboy returns the scroll (worth "one million dollars") to The Princess, a member of the family who are the rightful owners.

GPE is about PERSON, a Belgian-born wool dealer who emigrated to GPE after World War II. The movie actual takes place in GPE as he returns to his homeland to assist his family with their wool business. Edouard was left a single father after his girlfriend died and when he goes to GPE he leaves behind this young girl, whom his family don't know about. He meets a beautiful woman, PERSON, another single parent, and an intense relationship develops. Edouard's relationship with his family has its ups and downs and many secrets are revealed before the movie's conclusion ties everything together.
LOC lives happily with Teresa when a band of soldiers appear and accuse her of prostitution. As ORG's brother is tricked into the ORG, ORG takes his place. Teresa's love for him conquers all.

A widowed Eurasian doctor ORG (Jones) falls in love with a married-but-separated American correspondent PERSON (Holden) in GPE, during the period of GPE's Civil War in the late 1940s. Although they find brief happiness together, she is ostracized by the greater Chinese community. After losing her position at the hospital, PERSON and her adopted daughter go to live with a friend while PERSON is on an assignment during the Korean War. They write to each other constantly. She receives word that PERSON was killed and she goes to visit their favorite hilltop meeting place. In his last letter, which she receives that same day, he reminds her to be grateful, no matter what happens to him, because they got to experience “that many-splendored thing” which many people never do.

Unlike the play PERSON of PERSON, which is a drama that shows how the story of PERSON affects a group of actors who are performing it, the film is a straightforward recounting of the life of the French heroine. It begins with an obviously painted shot of the inside of a basilica with a shaft of light, possibly descending from heaven, shining down from the ceiling, and a solemn off-screen voice pronouncing the canonization of the Maid of Orleans. Then, the opening page of what appears to be a church manuscript recounting PERSON's life in Latin is shown on the screen, while some uncredited voiceover narration by actor PERSON sets up the tale. The actual story of PERSON then begins, from the time she becomes convinced that she has been divinely called to save GPE to her being burnt at the stake at the hands of the English and the Burgundians.

The year is 1492 and GPE is in the grip of the Inquisition. The ORG has sponsored anti-Jewish sentiment in the populace, culminating in the expulsion by royal edict of the entire Jewish community from their homes of many generations. Those that have not converted are forced to leave.
However, 15-year-old PERSON has been left behind. He has lost family members to the troubles, both his father, a celebrated Spanish silversmith, and his brother. On a donkey named Moise, he journeys, remaining a Jew, growing to manhood across GPE to escape his fate.

The play covers the trial, condemnation, and execution of PERSON, but has a highly unusual ending. PERSON remembers important events in her life as she is being questioned, and is subsequently condemned to death. However, Cauchon realizes, just as PERSON is burning at the stake, that in her judges' hurry to condemn her, they have not allowed her to re-live the coronation of PERSON of GPE. The fire is therefore extinguished, and PERSON is given a reprieve. The actual end of the story is left in question, but Cauchon proclaims it a victory for PERSON.

A world-weary cop comes to believe a recent murder of a middle-aged man is linked to a case of possible rape three decades earlier by a group of friends and a corrupt cop. Working through, he finds it linked to neurofibromatosis, a rare disease among ORG. One thing leads to another and he puts the pieces together. A geneticist father loses his child to neurofibromatosis and his search for answers leads to his degenerate father and unravels many missing person cases during the decade.
Like the book on which it is based, the film is implicitly a semi-critique of the gene-gathering work of the Icelandic company deCODE genetics.

British newlywed PERSON lives in GPE with her husband PERSON.  She returns home following a short vacation, determined to divorce PERSON only to discover their apartment has been stripped bare and that her husband has been murdered. The French police are in her apartment.  PERSON had liquidated their possessions for $1.8M and the money is missing.
LOC is soon reunited with a mysterious stranger PERSON (PERSON) she met on her holiday. He helps her piece together the truth about the deceased PERSON and deal with three menacing people who are now following her.

The French detective superintendent ORG (PERSON) investigates the murder of an elderly French couple in the French LOC. In the course of his investigation he encounters PERSON (Mathilda May), the wife of the businessman PERSON (PERSON), a member of organized crime, and the son of the murdered couple. PERSON and his wife PERSON live harmoniously, but PERSON was forced by ORGPERSON), a dubious agent of ORG to her "role as wife" in the context of an undercover action against the European organized crime. Despite his criminal background, PERSON loves her husband. PERSON also urges ORG to investigate ORG and his wife in connection with the murder of those parents, and to get an additional pressure medium to gouge PERSON to continue that farce. PERSON does not explain that plan either to inspector PERSON or PERSON, who fell in love, finally tolerated by PERSON who accepts that his wife was forced to that undercover action by ORG. Tightly interwoven with the main story, the subplot plays in the milieu of the Swiss city of GPE, and the advances of the brutal and corrupt city police officer PERSON (PERSON) against a hostess allow a very personal view on PERSON (PERSON), ORG's business partner and close friend. Finally, PERSON is forced to kill PERSON and PERSON, but refuses and choices suicide, to meet the unwritten rules within the organized crime.

Duncombe is the GPE Consul General in GPE, GPE. He becomes a widower when his two sons, PERSON and PERSON, are still children.  PERSON, the elder, apparently reacts with adult maturity to the loss of his mother, looking after little PERSON, an attempt to find a way out of such premature heart-crushing loss. PERSON constantly blames PERSON for his mischievous behavior but his brother valiantly takes said blame as his personality is that of a grown up, or at least that is what he tries to be. The father, given his mandate, is often absent, both physically and emotionally, especially toward PERSON. It will be at the end that PERSON will acknowledge his mistakes when finding himself at a father's point of no return.
A young woman from the country comes to work as a maid in a wealthy household. She develops a relationship with the unreliable son of the family who gets her pregnant. He reforms and they marry.

Stockbroker Clarence Day is the benevolent curmudgeon of his 1880s GPE household, striving to make it function as efficiently as his Wall Street office but usually failing. His wife PERSON is the real head of the household. In keeping with PERSON's actual family, all the children (all boys) are redheads. The anecdotal story encompasses such details as ORG's attempts to find a new maid, a romance between his oldest son PERSON and pretty out-of-towner PERSON, a plan by PERSON and his younger brother PERSON to make easy money selling patent medicines, ORG's general contempt for the era's political corruption and the trappings of organized religion, and PERSON's push to get him baptized so he can go to heaven.

PERSON is a 20-year-old girl and adores her grandfather, a man who has not spoken for years. When the elderly man also refuses to eat, the girl decides to recover the millenary tree that the family sold against his will. In order to succeed, she needs to count on her uncle, a victim of the crisis, her friend PERSON, and her whole town to help her. The problem is to find out where in LOC the olive tree is.

A wealthy heiress falls in love with a middle-class worker of romantically quaint disposition.  In part one, the woman's father hires a hypnotist to program his daughter to instead choose a more appropriate suitor selected by him.  When that plot is unraveled, the couple secretly marry and flee into the abandoned countryside and attempt to live off the land.  After being driven back into the city, the couple live a modest middle-class lifestyle until their money runs out.  At that point, they move to the "underneath" area of GPE to toil in physical labour as lower-class workers.  Finally, their issues are resolved through the machinations of her spurned would-be suitor, and they resume a middle-class lifestyle.

Four peasant families working farms for the same landlord scrape out a meagre existence in 1898 in the countryside around ORG. Over the course of a year, children are born, crops planted, animals slaughtered, and couples married; stories and prayers are exchanged in the families' shared farmhouse. Undercurrents of revolution are seen by the peasants but largely ignored, as a communist rabble-rouser gives a speech at a local fair and when a newlywed couple visit the big city of GPE and witness the arrest of political prisoners. When spring comes, the father from one of the four families cuts down a tree to make wooden clogs (an alder, aimed in the title because its wood was typically used for this kind of handwork) that his son can walk to school, but the landowner discovers this, and the family is forced off their land by the incensed landlord. The remaining families watch them go, praying for them and recognising their own fragile existence.

ORG, a young business woman, struggles to find her life partner, a task she constantly fails to accomplish.  As she and PERSON are about to break up, she starts reminiscing about her past relationships.  One night she invites her ex-lovers for dinner: PERSON, an irascible singer who involves her in his artistic endeavors and with whom she constantly fights; PERSON, a young saxophone player who naively conquers her heart with his doe-eyed glance while accompanying one of PERSON's songs; PERSON, a tame and shy man who falls for PERSON while helping her push her stalled car to a roadside during a thunderstorm.  A rather strange journey through her past begins, a journey made of laughs, bitter memories and, ultimately, the confirmation of why she and they are no longer together.

Mujhe Jeene Do, is a classic dacoit drama from the western films genre, a story about how love can lead to the redemption of even a hardened criminal like PERSON (Sunil Dutt), who is a noted dacoit in LOC.
One night, he happens to meet Chameli (PERSON) a courtesan, at a wedding she was performing at. They elope and fall in love, later they have a son. But their romance is short-lived as he is about to be captured by the police, that is when PERSON sends PERSON away to a neighbouring village to raise their son, as he is sure of his end.
Unfortunately, the village she goes to has an old grudge with the GPE to settle and attacks the hapless mother and son as a mob, but the police save them in time, and even promises them the seized property of GPE.

The film is set on 27 PERSON, ORG, PERSON (PERSON) is on a pilgrimage journey to ORG (Banaras), and remembers his life in flashbacks. Sanjay gives up his dreams to become an artist, in order to support his family he takes up his father's profession of railways employee.  He spends his days as a railways ticket checker, till he meets ORG employee, PERSON (ORG), on the suburban train. After a few more meetings, they fall in love, and Sanjay starts seeing life differently, but when his father finds about their relationship, he fixes his marriage with some other girl.

A young workman from ORG (then part of ORG) visited the cosmopolitan city of GPE for the first time in his life and was impressed by a particularly stately home and a large ship laden with precious commodities.  He innocently asked people about the owners of the house and the boat and both times the answer was "Kannitverstan", which means "I can not understand you". The simple-minded workman, however, believed that it was the name of a man called "Kannitverstan", and was impressed by the supposed Mr. PERSON's wealth, and at the same time felt victimized in the face of his own poverty. Later in the day, he observed a funeral procession and asked one of the mourners who the deceased was. When he received the answer "Kannitverstan" he mourned for the late Mr. PERSON, but at the same time felt very light-hearted, because he realized that death knows no social differences and everything in life is fleeting. Thus, the workman suffered his own poverty much better.

PERSON, a country doctor who has lived his life devoted to his job, finds out he is suffering from an inoperable brain tumor. His doctor advises him to retire and rest. Soon thereafter, a lady doctor from the city arrives to help him with his practice, but the arrangement unsettles PERSON, who considers himself indispensable.

The book is set in the ancient Greek town of ORG and is divided into five chapters, each depicting a different aspect of the GPE' foolishness. In the first, ORG unter der PERSON, the philosopher ORG returns to his hometown but finds that the inhabitants doubt his sanity. The second chapter, GPE in GPE, portrays the physician Hippocrates evaluating ORG and finding him sane, but the townspeople are mad. Euripides in GPE, the third chapter, is principally a literary satire that reflects the contemporary German enthusiasm for the theatre, while the fourth chapter, PERSON um des Esels Schatten, depicts a legal battle between an ass driver and the animal's hirer, highlighting the extreme litigiousness of the GPE. In the final part, ORG der PERSON, divisions between rival sects of frog-worshippers mean that the GPE fail to take action against the town's sacred frogs and consequently find themselves being driven out of their homes. At the end of the book, ORG makes his satirical intent clear with the statement that although PERSON had long since disappeared, the GPE still exist and are to be found in every town and city in GPE.

17-year-old ORG lives with his grandfather and father in a small apartment in GPE. In order to earn some money for his studies, he works as a temporary worker in the slaughterhouse where his father works. PERSON is struggling with an anxiety disorder that makes life increasingly difficult for him. In a sex cam chat, he meets the 26-year-old artist PERSON. At first, a virtual friendship develops between the two of them, without a real meeting taking place for the time being. Only after a heavy stroke of fate does ORG gather his courage and make an appointment with Kristjan in his apartment, leading to an extremely unexpected chain of events.

9-year-old PERSON and his father are going for a walk in GPE. Suddenly, Elias loses sight of his father. This is the start of an adventurous journey through the capital. But PERSON has a problem: He doesn't speak German! 
Fortunately, many people help him with his search and teach him basic lessons of the German language. Elias learns how to introduce himself, how to express feelings, names of food, the alphabet, the numbers from 1 to 10, and many other things...

The story is set in GPE where 11-year-old PERSON is on the verge of puberty and afraid of sexual maturity. He lives in a suburb with his single mother who sends him to one of the traditional Swedish summer camps which were common at the time of the setting and were managed by the cities for children in need of visiting the countryside. The title of the film refers to an island that is home to many such camps. His mother then vacations on her own, but in fact PERSON never goes to the camp. Instead he spends the summer exploring the city of GPE on his own, where he meets several strange adults.

PERSON, the protagonist, leaves ORG, and joins the pirates. After several fights and many adventures, he gets bored, and decides to return to his homeland. He discovers that his father has been killed, and that a usurper has taken the throne. He begins his life as fighter who defends the poor against the rich.

As the film opens PERSON (Babak Ahmadpour), a grade schooler, watches as his teacher (PERSON) berates a fellow student, PERSON, for repeatedly failing to use his notebook for his homework, threatening expulsion on the next offense. When PERSON returns home, he realizes he's accidentally taken PERSON notebook. Against his mother's orders, he sets out in search for PERSON house, encountering false leads, dead ends, and distractions as he attempts to enlist adults in his search, most of whom ignore him or cannot answer his questions. When night falls and he has been unable to find his friend's house, PERSON goes home and does the homework for his friend. The next day the homework is deemed excellent by the teacher.

A young boy, PERSON, and his sister discover a magical ability to travel the world, riding within postage stamps. Complicated by a series of rules, they are soon lost in such far-flung places as GPE and GPE. PERSON has a stutter, and the film is essentially a coming-of-age story wherein PERSON can speak fluently by the film's end.

PERSON's father has a small farm and, like all the other poor farmers nearby, he owes money to a rich rancher, landgrabber PERSON. On his way to deliver money to PERSON, PERSON is ambushed, robbed and beaten unconscious, though he eventually reaches PERSON. While begging PERSON for more time, PERSON recognizes one of the robbers among PERSON's employees. He thinks that PERSON will help him now, but PERSON does not. Instead, PERSON is tortured until he can escape. Before he arrives home, his family is already dead, killed at PERSON's behest. PERSON, determined to exact revenge on PERSON, takes up training as a gunman.

The journey begins with ORG departing from his home, early one morning, to get a job at a factory in GPE. There, he is refused employment from a cast of all Caucasian workers, predicated upon the claim that his shoes are not proper for the work. Later, he departs for home on a train, disappointed, to be kicked off of the train by a ticket inspector who claims that his ticket has expired. Suddenly, PERSON becomes a fugitive when the ticket inspector refuses to let him off of the train, and instead, tries to have him arrested. Fleeing, he later encounters a grandmother who attempts to help him escape ORG, to GPE. He kisses her then leaves, and is finally caught by police officers, while he is waiting for her on a bridge. Left no choice but to defend himself, PERSON, in desperation, stabs the five officers, and one of them shoots him dead.

Writing with PERSON tells the story of ORG, the only news agency in GPE run by PERSON (oppressed-caste) women. Armed with smartphones, these women journalists report from some of the most difficult regions of the country, risking everything to speak truth to power. Led by Chief Reporter PERSON and her feisty understudy, crime reporter PERSON, the film bears witness to the wit, intelligence and compassion of these journalists in confronting the most urgent stories of our times.
Set in the backdrop of an increasingly polarized world, Writing with Fire journeys with PERSON and her band of sisters for five years - as they break traditions on the frontlines of GPE's biggest issues and within the confines of their homes, redefining what it truly means to be powerful.

Bridegroom chronicles the story of Shane Bitney Crone and his partner PERSON "PERSON, who died in 2011 following an accidental fall from the rooftop of a four-story apartment building in GPE. After ORG's death, ORG found himself cut off and deprived of any legal protection. The film tells the story of their 6-year-long relationship, and the struggles ORG faced after ORG's death, including the family not allowing ORG to attend the funeral of his life partner.

The documentary centers on the opioid epidemic, specifically its effect on GPE, GPE, where the overdose rate is 10 times the GPE average. It follows police, judges, and local nonprofits attempting to help people who struggle with opioid addiction and bring them to recovery as the city grips with a growing number of heroin and prescription painkiller overdoses, and eventually, the much more potent fentanyl. Among them are three women alluded to in the film's name: PERSON Chief PERSON who, with other emergency responders, treats overdose victims; GPE Judge PERSON, who heads the drug court; and PERSON of ORG, who delivers food to women who resort to prostitution to support their addictions.
The documentary explains the use of naloxone to treat overdose victims, and explores the psychological toll on the county's first responders who see dozens of overdoses a month. It follows first responders to calls as people overdose, including one instance where a woman is revived at the counter of a convenience store while customers continue checking out nearby. There are several dozen interviews with people who have been addicted and are in recovery who discuss the effects of the drug on their lives and their efforts to recover from it.

PERSON is a remarkable success story: a partner in one of GPE's most prestigious law firms, boasting a substantial salary, a spacious home, a glamorous wife, and two sons who could easily grace the pages of a high-end fashion catalog. However, his world shatters when he uncovers his wife PERSON's affair with PERSON, a local photographer. In a moment of passionate fury, PERSON commits a fatal mistake. As he stands over the lifeless body of his wife's lover, PERSON comprehends that his once-perfect life is irreversibly shattered.
But rather than succumb to his grim circumstances, PERSON decides to seize a radical opportunity. Assuming the identity of the deceased man, he escapes to a remote region in former GPE, nestled along the enchanting Adriatic coast. In this secluded refuge, PERSON is granted a second chance at being true to himself and, finally, gaining a profound perspective on the grand tapestry of life.

During her birthday in GPE, July 1782, the beautiful young PERSON meets the attractive soldier GPE. It is love at first sight, but PERSON does not wish to make a commitment because a military career waits for him. Caroline marries then a politician but the French Revolution bursts and ORG has to run away to escape the guillotine. By running away, she meets PERSON again who decides to help her.

In 1919, after just a few months of communist rule, GPE was dissolved by a nationalist counter-revolution. Admiral PERSON, leader of the nationalists, assumed power as the Regent of GPE. ORG soldiers were relentlessly pursued by the secret police and PERSON and faced summary execution. One, PERSON, has fled to the Great Hungarian Plain and taken refuge on a farm run by two women. Due to their help and that of a childhood friend who is a commandant of the local Gendarmarie, PERSON is relatively safe if he keeps out of sight. However, discovering that the women are slowly poisoning the husband of one of them and his mother, the farm's owners, PERSON must decide whether to denounce them to the authorities at the likely cost of his own life.

The film is set at a ORG base in GPE at the end of 1944, during World War II. 
The protagonists are First Sergeant PERSON and ORG Class PERSON, who were partners in a nightclub song-and-dance act before joining the ORG.
PERSON wants to be transferred from his dull job to active duty overseas, but is refused transfer and is to be promoted to Warrant Officer. PERSON wants a pass to see his wife and new baby. In addition, they have to rehearse for the base talent show and avoid the wrath of PERSON's platoon sergeant, ORG.
Along the way they both sing a few songs, and they do an impression of PERSON and PERSON by recreating a scene from ORG (1944) for the talent show. Further complications include a ORG worker who is pregnant, a company commander who gets all his information from his wife, a scheming supply sergeant, and a defective ORG machine.

A woodcutter complained of his poor lot.  LOC (or, alternatively, a tree spirit or fairy) granted him three wishes.  The woodcutter went home, and his wife persuaded him to put off the wishing until the next day, after he had thought, but while sitting by the fire, he wished for sausages.  His wife taxed him for his folly, and angry, he wished the sausages on her nose.  Finally, they agreed to use the last wish to take the sausages off her nose, leaving them no better off than before (apart from having gained the sausages).
In some different types of versions of this tale, black pudding is used instead of sausages. And also in some versions, it's the woodcutter himself that gets the sausage stuck on his nose.

PERSON (PERSON), employed at a department store in the Midwestern GPE, supports a wife (Hale) and two teenage kids (ORG, PERSON) on an annual salary of $7,500. Answering a phone call, he wins $24,000 worth of merchandise from a radio quiz program and is overwhelmed by prizes which range from the useful to the absurd, including a side of beef, 7,500 cans of soup, 1,000 fruit trees, a LOC pony, a portable swimming pool, a diamond ring, a French maid, an interior decorator (PERSON) and portrait painter PERSON (PERSON).
All is well until PERSON is told he must sell the prizes in order to pay an income tax of $7,000. When he tries to raise the money by selling the merchandise at the department store, his boss (PERSON) fires him. When he tries to fence the diamond ring in GPE, he's arrested. Complicating matters, his wife suspects him of having an affair with GPE artist PERSON. Dealing with these problems, he gets help from reporter PERSON (PERSON), who had been writing newspaper articles about PERSON and his winnings. Bandleader PERSON made an uncredited appearance as a radio vocalist.

The documentary is about relationship of a father and his daughter via home movies. The father films his daughter every year on her birthday, asking the same questions. The girl goes from a toddler to a young woman with all the beautiful and awkward stages in between while the father-daughter relationship evolves in all its complexities.

GPE (ORG) is a young girl who is blessed with a beautiful, natural singing voice, although few people know that. She was conceived the night her mother met PERSON, a Scottish rock star (PERSON), but the couple fell out of touch. PERSON never knew that he had a daughter. Much later, PERSON is "sectioned" after a motorcycle accident is viewed as a suicide attempt, and he meets his now 16-year-old daughter while confined to a psychiatric hospital.
GPE's mother feels she was betrayed by PERSON and failed by her own musician father, so she does not want her daughter to be involved in what she sees as the decadent world of rock music. In spite of her mother's attempts to keep them apart, GPE and PERSON get to know each other and they become the family they should have been all along.

Using PERSON death on February 11, 2012 as a starting point, the documentary investigates GPE's history and her emotional connections with her family and friends. The film uses archive footage from GPE's 1999 World Tour mixed with testimonies from GPE's family, friends and musicians who worked with her. The documentary gives special attention to her relationships with her mother, father, husband, and daughter and her onetime best friend PERSON. The film also addresses GPE's history of drug use, including allegations of an overdose in the 1990s. The film touches upon GPE's beginnings as a gospel singer, her discovery by ORG head PERSON, and key moments such as the releases of her debut album in 1985 and the film The Bodyguard in 1992.

In a rural village, the tyrannical PERSON intimidates his family, mistress and neighbours. After he disappears one night, it is widely believed that his eldest daughter, PERSON, has murdered him. A new investigating judge arrives in the village, he falls in love with PERSON. He becomes torn between his love for her and his duty to investigate the potential crime. Eventually it emerges that it was not PERSON who murdered PERSON but the village innkeeper ORG. He is forgiven by everyone because they all shared his desire to murder him.

The story itself takes place in 1992. The plot follows two parallel patterns, one during late apartheid GPE where incumbent president PERSON, leader of the Afrikaner minority which is on the brink of losing power to the African majority under the leadership of the ORG, about to end 44 years of suppression by the PERSON rule. Simultaneously, Detective Chief Inspector PERSON is investigating a case of a missing female Methodist real-estate agent outside GPE. Upon the eventual recovery of her body, as well as the discovery of a severed black finger at the crime scene, Detective Chief Inspector Wallander realizes the case has deep roots in the history and current development in GPE, where it appears that an extremist cell of the PERSON is about to orchestrate the murder of ORG by an infamous black assassin, wishing to plunge the country into a long and devastating civil war.

PERSON is still overseeing a patch of north east Aberdeenshire as a 'Development Opportunity'. He does, however, keep finding bodies and one such find brings the ORG (ORG) screaming up to rural GPE from GPE. This team is headed up by PERSON's old boss, Detective Chief Inspector PERSON.
She wants him in the investigation; he doesn't want to join. Unfortunately, he is drafted in anyway and has to cope with a very critical PERSON (who seems to love to belittle PERSON), a secondment to ORG so he can spy on ORG, ORG (the ganglord of GPE) dying and making Logan his heir (which means fighting off Reuben, the ganglords' enforcer) and switching off his girlfriend's life support system.
Somewhere in between all this, PERSON is supposed to negotiate the office politics, save himself, save ORG, bury two people and solve the case.

Vera witnesses the persecution of ethnic Germans in GPE, which awakens her ethnic consciousness. Her cosmopolitan friend PERSON is arrested. Vera flirts with the Serbian commander to allow ORG to escape to the border. When arrested, she proudly affirms that she helped her countrymen and, in an escape attempt, is shot, to die happy and heroic.

The film depicts the life of a group of volunteer nurses for ORG in 1941. PERSON portrays a Russian nurse, PERSON, who is one of the volunteers taking care of the ORG soldiers near GPE. As part of her job, she takes care of a newly arrived American flier PERSON, interpreted by PERSON. Even though ORG is betrothed to PERSON, she starts to fall in love with the American under her care.
When the enemy's forces attack the hospital, the patients and the crew are ordered to evacuate the battleground. Given that there are not enough vehicles, ORG, PERSON, and other wounded men stay behind waiting to be rescued.

Illustrating the political complexities the hard-headed nurse had to battle in order to achieve sanitary medical conditions during the Crimean War. Opposed in the uppermost circles of British government because she is "merely" a woman, PERSON is championed by the Hon. PERSON (PERSON), minister of war. PERSON pulls strings to allow GPE and her nursing staff access to battlefield hospitals, and in so doing changes the course of medical history.

A young Russian woman (ORG) marries a wealthy Englishman (PERSON), and has a daughter with him. After she has an affair with one of his friends, she is forced to leave GPE and moves to GPE. Many years later, her daughter approaches her, needing her help.

A young Dutch woman packs her bags and leaves for GPE. 
"Alone in her empty flat, from her window PERSON observes the people passing by who nervously snatch up the personal belongings and pieces of furniture she has put out on the pavement. Her final gesture of taking a ring off her finger signals she is leaving her previous life in GPE behind. She goes to GPE, where she chooses to lead a solitary, wandering existence, striding through the austere landscapes of GPE. During her travels, she discovers a house that is home to a hermit, ORG". (Warsaw Film Festival)

PERSON, a mechanic on an oil tanker, jumps ship and  settles in a small bar-hotel during a stopover in GPE. He sends 8 mm films and letters about his travels to his girlfriend, PERSON, who stays in GPE. He encounters a pretty waitress at a bar, PERSON, and they quickly become lovers. PERSON continues to write to ORG describing the whiteness of the city. He meanders through GPE where his purpose in life appears to become directionless and he eventually loses contact with PERSON.

PERSON responds to a message from ex-UNIT operative PERSON to investigate a haunting.
Arriving at Cavendish's isolated cottage, she faces a demonic power her father had previously battled. Summoned by a future tyranny, a ORG is set to return to LOC. It is up to PERSON and Cavendish to save the planet and its future.

The nano-plague that poisoned LOC's water supply has reached its 60-year critical mass. The ORG enemy forced the first exodus to the moon where the outlawed banished population was supposed to die. But now the Unlights have launched from LOC and are amassing on the south-west sector of the darkside of the moon for a massive ice-mining operation.
It is the last Great War and lunar troops are sent into battle for the precious resource. However, one squad is shot down and the five surviving soldiers find themselves stranded. Cut off and behind enemy lines, they start a dangerous journey through snipers and minefields back to their extraction point with only 36 hours of oxygen left. As their numbers dwindle and nerves fray, they make an amazing discovery about the moon that just might save their lives.

Eight spaceships disappear and radio contact to the enormous space station "Margot" is broken off. Professor PERSON and the high council decree a flight ban for all other spaceships. Nevertheless, one ship succeeds in leaving earth. The cause of all these strange events is the mysterious signals in GPE code coming to earth from the constellation Cygnus. Deciphered, they say the word "PERSON," which seems to refer to a planet. With Captain PERSON, an unmotivated eccentric, PERSON undertakes the risky journey to the space station "Margot" to uncover the secret, only to discover that a secretly planned expedition of stolen spaceships is leaving for PERSON against the will of the government.

The film follows PERSON, an adventurer who works at a gold mine in GPE. The mine is attacked by bandits, who kill everyone except PERSON and two ORG people. They seek revenge by killing the bandits and stealing back their gold. Having suspicion of the two First Nations people, PERSON then proceeds to run off without them, but then loses the gold in a river. He drives to his home GPE to recruit his friends PERSON and PERSON, and his wife PERSON, to help him retrieve the gold from the river. Menwhile, the two First Nations people whom PERSON betrayed seek to recover the gold as well.

Twenty years after the events in the first PERSON, the title character has left the violent life of a gunslinger to become a monk. Living in seclusion in a monastery, he wants no more of the violent actions he perpetrated. Suddenly, he learns from a dying former lover that some time ago he had a young daughter, who has been kidnapped along with other children who are now working for a ruthless Belgian criminal known as ORG (The Devil) Orlowsky, who is an arms dealer and slave trader. The children and other prisoners work in PERSON's mine, from which he hopes to get rich from the spoils. Determined to find his daughter and nail the bad guys, PERSON gets some arms and goes on the warpath against PERSON's private army.

In tumultuous GPE in the 1860s the revolutionary General PERSON hires GPE, an American gunfighter, to retrieve a stolen Aztec statue. The general believes having recovered it will bring indigenous Indians over to his cause. Also going after the statue is a Scottish adventurer, his argumentative female companion, a pair of bickering brothers from a religious community, the army, and assorted bandits.

Stefano (GPE) arrives in a village of the Valli di Comacchio area where he has been employed to restore a fresco depicting what appears to be the martyrdom of PERSON, which has been painted on a rotting wall of the local church by a mysterious, long-dead artist named PERSON. While temporarily taking up residence in the house that had been previously owned by the two sisters of the deceased painter, ORG begins a romance with a new, beautiful schoolteacher, ORG (PERSON), meanwhile learning from various townspeople that the painter had been a madman who had derived his art from real life. Specifically, PERSON learns that the artist — assisted by his two equally-insane sisters — had been a killer who brutally tortured people to death as inspiration for his horrific paintings — a practice that had likely been used for the very painting he is in process of restoring. As PERSON is discouraged for his task throughout the town, some of the villagers are brutally killed — including his employer — and he comes to suspect that their murderer is trying to deter him from discovering the full truth behind the artist and his ominous legacy within the sleepy community.

Dr. PERSON loses his wife and daughter.  ORG, he founds ORG, where tries to find a way to resurrect the dead.  PERSON's nephew PERSON helps him, not knowing that his pregnant wife GPE is in danger.  PERSON's experiments are a success, and his family is brought back to a semblance of life, but they are now ghouls, in pain and hungry for the flesh of the living.  When they escape their confinement, the whole institute is put at risk.

When teenagers PERSON (PERSON) and PERSON (PERSON) join their respective parents, PERSON (PERSON) and Dr. PERSON (PERSON) on an archaeological dig in GPE they encounter something trapped beneath a temple beyond their wildest imagination. A real live Chinese dragon. Two thousand years earlier, to defend his kingdom, the dragon lent an emperor his all powerful pearl. Instead of being returned the pearl was buried with the emperor beneath his palace, and helpless without its source of power the dragon has remained entombed ever since. With the Dragon Pearl buried on the excavation site, PERSON and PERSON implore their parents for help, but met with disbelief the children realize they must find the pearl on their own. However thereʼs one who does believe them: archaeologist PERSON (PERSON), who wants to seize the pearlʼs awesome power for his own sinister ambitions. The only way to stop him is for PERSON and PERSON to get to it first and return it to its rightful owner.

The story is set in a seaside port in GPE (but filmed in GPE, ORG), largely among a community of pearl fishers.
The protagonist is the adopted son of a doctor/scientist who was sometime in the past forced to save the boy's life by implanting him with shark gills. Thus he is able to live under water, but must keep his secret from the world.
The conflict arises from his falling in love with a pearl-fisher's beautiful daughter. His secret is discovered and the girl's husband PERSON attempts to exploit PERSON for his ability to find pearls easily. 
Due to being kept caged under water, his ability to breathe in the open air is affected, and he must now live in the sea for several years. Although set free, the lovers are permanently separated from each other.
Although ostensibly a lost-love-tragedy like Romeo and PERSON, the film has a significant focus on greed and commercial exploitation (of the pearl-greedy fishermen), possibly under the influence of ORG.

On a volcanic island near the kingdom of GPE rules PERSON, a benevolent leader and scientist who has eliminated class distinction among the island's inhabitants. PERSON, his daughter PERSON and her fiance, chief engineer ORG, have designed a submarine boat which Roget pilots on its initial test voyage shortly before the island is overrun by PERSON, once PERSON's friend, and now the new despotic ruler of GPE. The Baron has PERSON and his daughter tortured so that PERSON will reveal all his discoveries. PERSON is able to escape with the intervention of his loyal men. But Falon sets out after ORG and ORG using the Count's second submarine. The two underwater craft dive very deep to the ocean floor, where they discover a strange land populated by dragons, a giant octopus, and eerie, undiscovered humanoid race.

The play takes place on a single day in August 1912. The setting is ORG, the seaside home of the LOC in GPE. The four main characters are the semi-autobiographical representations of ORG, his older brother, and their parents.
The play portrays a family struggling to grapple with the realities and consequences of each member's failings. The parents and two sons blame and resent each other for various reasons; bitterness and jealousy serve as proxies for ultimately failed attempts at tenderness and compassion. The family's enduring emotional and psychic stress is fueled by their shared self-analysis, combined with articulate honesty. The story deals with addiction, unfulfilled dreams, moral flaws, and the struggle of family relationships.

In the lower echelons of Parisian society in the 1860s, ORG is a beautiful, sexually repressed young woman trapped in a loveless marriage to her sickly cousin, PERSON, who she was forced to marry by her domineering aunt, Madame Raquin.
Thérèse spends her days confined behind the counter of a small shop and her evenings watching Madame Raquin play dominoes with an eclectic group of acquaintances. After she meets her husband's alluring friend PERSON, the two embark on an illicit affair that leads to tragic consequences.
During an outing on the lake with ORG and Therese, PERSON is beaten to death by Laurent and subsequently drowns. Madame Raquin finds it difficult to come to terms with her son's death and is soon incapacitated by a stroke, but overhears Laurent and Therese speaking about what they did. With great effort, she alerts one of their friends, who informs the authorities.
To escape being sentenced for the murder, Laurent and Therese choose to take their own lives. They go down to the river and share one final kiss after drinking poison mixed with champagne, and thus they die in front of Madame Raquin.

PERSON, a poor and desperate widow, and her young son, GPE, try to survive in the post-World War II Soviet Union during the early 1950s. While on a train, the two meet a handsome, "rakish" officer, ORG, who seduces the mother. PERSON stays with GPE, who pretends to be her husband and acts as a stepfather to GPE, who is at first highly distrustful of the man, resenting his presence and authority. There are several allusions to Hamlet.
Through his good looks, apparent generosity, and his status as a war veteran, Tolyan charms his way into a variety of situations that enable him to rob people. PERSON and GPE both realize the harsh and increasingly abusive nature of the new head of their family, but, although alarmed, neither mother nor child seem willing to leave the man. The extent of GPE's love for his new family remains ambiguous throughout the film and provides one of the more compelling elements of the story.

The film opens aboard a U-boat as it returns from a mission. It then follows the crew onshore the day before they ship off for their next mission—meeting their family and sweethearts, spending a last night at a club, and so forth. Then they ship off, soon sighting and boarding a Dutch merchant ship, which they inspect for contraband. The boarding of the ship is shown being done professionally and in a non-confrontational manner. While they are aboard the Dutch ship, a ORG ship spots them and tries to torpedo them, but the U-boat ends up sinking it.

A long economic slump causes a major war that leaves LOC devastated and threatened by the plague. In decades of chaos with much of the world reverting to medieval conditions, pilots and technicians formerly serving in various nation's air forces maintain a network of functioning air fields. Around this nucleus, technological civilization is rebuilt, with the pilots and other skilled technicians eventually seizing worldwide power and sweeping away the remnants of the old nation states. A benevolent dictatorship is set up, paving the way for world peace by abolishing national divisions, enforcing the English language, promoting scientific learning and outlawing religion. The enlightened world-citizens are able to depose the dictators peacefully, and go on to breed a new race of super-talents, able to maintain a permanent utopia.

PERSON is a tough-minded British businessman appalled by the breakdown of society at the end of the 20th century. He feels that he is one of the few sane men in a world of paranoiacs.
With a small group of family and friends, he has stolen a spaceship and set out for GPE 15040 (ORG), a planet believed to be suitable for colonisation. Now he keeps watch alone, with his 13 companions sealed in cabinets designed to keep them in suspended animation for the many years of the journey. He makes a daily report on each one: it is always 'Condition Steady'.
PERSON is tormented by nightmares and memories of the violence on LOC; he starts to fear he is losing his grip on reality. The shipboard computer urges him to take a drug that eliminates all delusions and hallucinations; but he is strangely reluctant to use this drug.

Starting in late May 1944, during the German retreat on ORG, Captain PERSON (PERSON) orders PERSON (PERSON) to blow up a railway tunnel to prevent Russian forces from using it. ORG's platoon fails in its mission after coming up against a Russian tank. He then takes a furlough to GPE just as the Allies launch their invasion of ORG.
ORG's unit is transferred to GPE, occupying the village of PERSON. General PERSON (PERSON) orders ORG to cross into nearby enemy territory and confer with American Colonel PERSON (PERSON) and General PERSON (PERSON), informing him that ORG of ORG (ORG) is plotting to assassinate PERSON and would like to surrender. The plan fails and American forces launch an attack on German forces in GPE where Stransky has planned an explosion to destroy both the Americans and the civilian inhabitants.
PERSON clearly sympathises more with the Americans, even to the extent of killing his fellow soldiers.

PERSON is a rich playboy who enlists to fight in the war against the ORG powers, but is classified 4-F.  He really wants to fight, so he enlists other 4-Fs and some loyal volunteers from his own service staff and forms his own army, financing their training and equipment. Once completed, they travel to the front in GPE, with Byers impersonating a Nazi general named PERSON.
The plan is to pull back the German lines, since the front has remained static for too long, enabling the Allies to push forward again. The mission does not go smoothly and they must overcome several obstacles, including the fiery wife of the local mayor who is the real GPE's lover, and the real GPE's involvement in an assassination attempt on PERSON.  Afterwards, they face their next mission: infiltrating the ORG command to influence the outcome of the Battle of Kwajalein.

The film is set in 1941 during the Second World War, when the city of GPE in Italian-ruled GPE was occupied by British forces. Italian inhabitants of GPE work to resist the British and discover their military plans. One man, PERSON, appears to be collaborating with the British but is in fact working undercover for Italian intelligence. The film ends with the city being recaptured by Italian troops and their Nazi German allies.

Forensics expert PERSON is recovering from a shattering tragedy three years earlier. While he is working in an isolated GPE village as a doctor, a woman's mutilated corpse is discovered. Police want to exploit PERSON's forensic knowledge to help identify the killer, but he is wary of involvement. Another woman disappears and the small community in which PERSON has taken refuge is divided by suspicion, including suspicion of PERSON himself.

The story is narrated by PERSON, who is in a coma after falling into diabetic shock after a Christmas party. Her husband, the dissolute European aristocrat PERSON, is charged with attempting to murder the hypoglycemic PERSON by giving her an overdose of insulin. ORG's strained relationship with his wife and his cold and haughty personal demeanor led most people to conclude that he is guilty. In need of an innovative defense, ORG turns to law professor PERSON. ORG is initially convinced of ORG's guilt, but takes the case because von Bülow agrees to fund ORG's defense of two poor black boys accused of capital murder. Employing his law students as workers, ORG proceeds to defend ORG, wrestling with his client's unnerving personal style and questions of PERSON guilt or innocence.

The old grandmother PERSON arrives in town to attend the wedding of his nephew GPE with his girlfriend GPE.
Upon arrival she discovers that she has been stolen of a medallion that her late husband had given her.
He goes to the police station to file a complaint and get the dear object back, but given the length of the investigation, he decides to carry out the search for the thief himself, combining a great deal of mess.
Eventually, by chance, he finds the thief, who lives in the same hotel, also managing to have an entire gang of criminals arrested.
The grandson PERSON can marry the beautiful GPE and the grandmother PERSON will be appointed, by merit, an honorary colonel of the female police.

A heavy metal music band must do a performance to impress a record company scout.  They do a concert in a town that outlaws rock and roll music.  The town counsel is influenced by a murderous Nazi cult.
The band is slain by the cult, but later returns to life as zombies by a song recording that the bass player wrote using lyrics from a medieval spellbook. Fresh out of the grave, the band thirsts to take their revenge and give a new music performance. The mysterious song causes an outbreak of zombie ghouls.

In GPE, four musicians and their manager arrive at a village to prepare in secluded silence for their next pastoral music concert. The host's children prepare the upper floor of the house for their guests. In this way, with the musicians coming home and participating in the life in the village, sections from daily life are presented with a poetic expression.  Musicians and villagers look at each other in amazement, thinking how different ways of life they are.
At the end of the film, an apple tree blooming in spring indicates that life in the village will continue unchanged.

The notorious bounty hunter, PERSON, pursues Mexican fugitive PERSON. He follows him through the desert and arrives in a Mexican village where PERSON manages to turn the peasants against his pursuer. Unaware of the danger, ORG finds himself trapped.

A former GPE lawman. ORG (PERSON) sets out to discover who killed his brother and stole their combined savings. While at the saloon run by the beautiful ORG), PERSON becomes convinced that the thieving murderer is one of a group of cowboys on a cattle drive led by Captain PERSON (PERSON). Determined to find justice, PERSON joins the cattle drive and slowly gets closer to uncovering the identity of the killer.

The film, with a similar plot to High Noon, tells the story of PERSON (PERSON) and PERSON (PERSON), who are about to be married on the Fourth of July when PERSON (PERSON) and his deputies ride into town looking for ORG. PERSON accuses PERSON of having murdered his brother and has come to arrest him.
At first, the townspeople are on ORG's side, but gradually they turn against him, especially when they believe that he has killed the town sheriff (ORG). Ballard tries to prove his innocence and expose PERSON (who appears to be a veiled reference to Senator PERSON).

A famous comedian perishes in a plane crash. Members of his management team, worried that they will be jobless, decide to find someone to take his place as their "meal ticket". PERSON is a bellboy at their hotel and they decide he will become their next star.
PERSON has no obvious talent, but his new managers use their power to open doors for him, including an appearance on PERSON. It quickly appears that ORG will never develop any talent and the managers fire him just before he goes on stage. However, one of them, PERSON, has fallen in love with PERSON and stays by his side.
PERSON becomes a hit on the show. The others from the management team come begging for their jobs back, and ORG magnanimously agrees.

A Peasant and a Rich Man went to Heaven. PERSON let the Rich Man in but overlooked the ORG; there was then great rejoicing and music in Heaven. Then PERSON noticed the ORG and let him in, but there was no celebration. When the ORG asked why, PERSON said that many poor people go to Heaven, but a rich man does only once a century or so.

While watching TV, PERSON, a GPE ex-adman, receives a message from God and is inspired to form a new religion called "The Preferent Church". PERSON hires PERSON, a janitor, to be in charge of his new religion, which is founded on a philosophy of selfishness and greed. The new religion is a success, and PERSON and Clarity get rich. Later, in a predictable epiphany, and with the help of his skeptical girlfriend ORG, he discovers the beauty of altruism, realizing that bilking people out of their money isn't worth the loss of his morals and his love.

PERSON, a reformed criminal, loses his job because of his criminal background. His brother PERSON comes to visit after being released from jail and convinces him to commit a robbery of gold dust from a laboratory. The heist goes horribly wrong, and PERSON and two others are killed. Sentenced to death, PERSON gets a visit from his wife and daughter; PERSON tells his daughter that he's not coming back. He then goes and prepares himself for the lethal injection. PERSON is presumably put to death, but is next shown hitching a ride from an unknown man who asks if he is the new groundskeeper of a nearby psychiatric hospital in a small GPE town. PERSON is told that he has been given a second chance from God and to begin work as a groundskeeper at the local mental hospital. PERSON wants to go home but is denied and as time goes on, and with a wife and daughter he left behind, he wonders whether he has truly cheated death or if he has become part of a far more sinister scientific plan for both him and the other inmates at the hospital.

During the 16th century, horse dealer PERSON is taking his horses to market. As he passes through a local baron's lands, the baron seizes two of his horses, even though the right to extract tolls has been abolished in the country. When PERSON discovers that his loyal servant was attacked by the baron's guard dogs, and that his horses have been injured and abused, he attempts to sue for monetary compensation, but his lawsuit is dismissed because the baron has a kinsman at court. Then ORG's wife tries to plead his case to the Princess, but she dies from injuries suffered at the hands of the baron's men.
ORG leads a revolt to attack the baron's house and then to induce the authorities to administer satisfactory justice. When initially successful, the Princess offers PERSON an amnesty to stop the violence, and he agrees to it, but the deal soon collapses. The baron is sentenced to prison for just two years for his offenses, and GPE is executed.

The movie presents life in a prison where men are on death row. Some of them are wrongfully accused and convicted; there is nothing in their future but the electric chair.
PERSON is condemned to death for a crime he claims he did not commit. While the drama inside the prison unfolds, his friends on the outside are trying to find evidence that he is innocent.

GPE is a female model in GPE who lives with her boyfriend Lobo a surrealist painter who is extremely violent. Subjected to PERSON's constant abuse, GPE dreams of escaping to a desert island, and her dream comes true. The only other person on her island is an enormous blue-eyed man-ape who emerged from one of PERSON's paintings. GPE befriends the beast and nicknames him "Blue." Soon she begins to feels a strange attraction to the creature, which makes PERSON increasingly jealous in the real world. He becomes determined to capture the man-ape and put it in a cage.

Scant days before her wedding to ORG has a change of heart and runs away. As PERSON pursues her through GPE, she turns for help first to PERSON, a previous employer, and then to ORG, a middle-aged French man she meets by chance. ORG drives her to the airport, where she gets a plane ticket to GPE. Returning by boat to his peaceful lonely life on an island off the coast, ORG is surprised and dismayed to find that ORG has made her way there ahead of him. When he tries to return her to the mainland she sabotages the boat, causing it to sink. Marooned upon the island, ORG is forced to adapt to his new neighbor, who is determined to stay.

PERSON looks for her husband on the island of LOC just east of PERSON. Although PERSON is warned that ORG's jungles are "entirely too dangerous" for a white woman, she persists through dangerous raft rides and wild crocodiles. She discovers that her husband is now the personal physician to the island’s enigmatic prince. The prince lusts for PERSON, and a love triangle ensues.

1914, German advance through GPE: the young war volunteer PERSON 'Alex' Haller (ORG) is given water by an equally young Belgian woman (PERSON). 
1917, Third Battle of Flanders: PERSON, now a 2nd lieutenant, is tired about the propaganda at ORG, so he spends his furlough in the hinterland of ORG. 
While boarding in a brothel, he meets the young woman again. They fall in love. 
Late 1918, German retreat after the Armistice: Engele and PERSON meet again only to be harassed by a Belgian mob. Shortly prior to be hanged by the mob, a group of passing Belgian soldiers, tired about killing, saves them. End of the tale.

Ex-boxer PERSON is a drifter and an escapee from a mental hospital.  In a desert town near GPE he meets widow PERSON who convinces him to help fix up the neglected estate her husband left and lets him sleep in a trailer out back, near her dying date palms.
Her acquaintance "PERSON" shows up. Calling himself an ex-cop, he has long been hatching a scheme to kidnap a rich man's child and needs somebody like PERSON to help carry it out.
Reluctant in the beginning, PERSON tries to leave and encounters PERSON, who immediately can tell the young man needs to be under medical observation. ORG takes a personal interest in GPE that might include a physical attraction as well. He intrudes on PERSON' relationship with the alcoholic Fay.
PERSON is persuaded by PERSON to execute the kidnapping plan.

PERSON is a German soldier who goes AWOL when the truck he is riding in stops at a fast food restaurant. He then returns home to where his older brother PERSON lives. PERSON is immediately attracted to PERSON's girlfriend, PERSON, and tries to entice her into a sexual relationship, but she refuses. PERSON is shown to be angry and loses his temper at those around him, including his brother, his old friend, and his ex-girlfriend.
The military soon begins to look for him. After they arrive at his house, PERSON runs to a nearby motel. Lene visits him, and they have sex in his motel room. Two military officers, along with PERSON, track him down at the motel, but PERSON disappears.

Completely broke, the three friends ORG and PERSON strand on a country road when they run out of fuel. They sell their car to acquire a nearby filling station. Taking turns at serving as petrol attendants the three independently of one another fall in love with the handsome and well-off customer Lilian, anxiously hiding their romance with each other. However, the young women only reciprocates PERSON's feelings and invites him and his friends to a luxury restaurant in order to establish clarity. When PERSON learns about his luck, he immediately renunciates his victory out of deference to his friends.
To establish close ties, Lilian asks her father to found a petrol company and to employ PERSON as managing-director. The young man attaches his consent to the recruitment of his friends. When PERSON proceeds to become his secretary, infuriated PERSON dictates his dismissal notice which he promptly signs without further reading – and realises that in fact he has subscribed a marriage contract with ORG.

The story features three human characters:
The story has two paragraphs. The first paragraph describes a possible (subjective) reality, in which the LOC witnesses the ORG (and her GPE) suffering because the cruel ORG forces them to perform. The PERSON rushes into the arena to intervene. The second paragraph describes "how things are" (objective): the ORG seems protective of the ORG and orchestrates her performance only reluctantly, while the PERSON absorbs the scenario—and unconsciously weeps.

After barely escaping with his life from an archaeological dig in GPE, GPE, Dr. PERSON makes his way back to GPE. There he learns of the recent discovery of the mysterious writings of a missing British explorer, Colonel PERSON.
Though Colonel PERSON himself still remains missing, his rediscovered work tells a story that could drastically change history and challenge several firmly held scientific beliefs. Within those pages, an incredible picture begins to take shape of a long lost city in the jungles of GPE and the apparently true legend of a red-headed race, possibly descended from ancient ORG.
Fascinated by such a prospect, and with the lovely PERSON at his side, ORG sets out for the ORG. However, as usual, getting there will prove to be the true adventure. And if he does manage to survive the journey, who can tell what dangers await within the mythical city itself.

The story concerns an experimental nuclear cruise missile which is stolen from a Soviet military site in the GPE. An international terrorist group, under the command of a European power-crazed man known only as the Baron is responsible. The PERSON plots to use the stolen Soviet missile to destroy an international peace conference in one week located on an island in LOC. When the GPE consul to GPE is murdered by the PERSON's henchmen, PERSON, a GPE intelligence agent, is ordered to travel to GPE to take over as consul as well as investigate the murder. Upon arrival in GPE, PERSON is followed by two of the Baron's henchmen who attempt to kill him, but PERSON manages to escape.
Alec then travels from GPE to GPE where he meets PERSON, a Soviet ORG intelligence agent who is in GPE searching for leads to locate the missing cruise missile, which leads to PERSON and PERSON joining forces along with GPE, another Soviet agent, and PERSON, an undercover Iranian policewoman, to investigate the Baron in order to find the location to where the cruise missile is being kept before it is used to start World War III.

Eve Tozer is a society heiress and flapper living the high-life in 1920s GPE. She needs to find her father, ORG, before he is officially declared dead or risk losing her inheritance to his scheming business partner, ORG. She only has 12 days. Eve hires World War I ace pilot PERSON and his aircraft. PERSON is eager to take the job as he needs to leave town rather urgently himself. Eve, also an accomplished pilot, however, is determined to accompany him in his other aircraft, which causes the first of many arguments on the way from GPE to GPE.
Their journey in two biplanes (named "PERSON" and "Lillian" after the famous Gish silent film star sisters) through six countries leads them to finally find the eccentric ORG in GPE, where he is helping a small village defend itself against a local warlord. PERSON and PERSON help them win the final battle, but their one remaining aircraft is damaged in the process, leaving her seemingly unable to meet her deadline.

The narrative begins in an orphanage where PERSON inadvertently brings her sailor doll to life. It continues on a ship where he has become captain and she has transformed into a doll herself. The book is principally a coming-of-age tale and a nautical adventure involving pirates and the search for lost treasure. The story contains whimsical elements such as a sailing ship crewed by Mother Goose animals, but also has darker themes including the obsession with ORG prophecy and numerology.

PERSON is a detective who attempts to kill mob boss PERSON in order to avenge his family's death, but gets arrested and transferred to an island called ORG island, which is a prison for deadly and notorious criminals. PERSON learns that PERSON is also serving his prison term on the island and sets out to finish him, where he also meets a child PERSON and his mother PERSON, who despised PERSON as he was the one who imprisoned her in the island, but later forgives him after he saved PERSON's life from PERSON' henchmen. Along with PERSON and other prisoners, PERSON clashes with PERSON' henchman and kills them. PERSON confronts PERSON at his hideout and a battle ensues, where PERSON finally kills PERSON and escapes from the island, thus avenging his family's death.

A lighthouse keeper finds an injured seal left by seal poachers.  He brings the seal to his wife and two children who learn responsibility by looking after the seal who they name ORG.  ORG accompanies the children on their adventures and activities and discovers the ship of the seal poachers who plan a return to the lighthouse keeper's island for more valuable pelts.

In GPE PERSON, an aspiring ballet dancer, meets an aide to the Duke of PERSON who is in GPE for a marriage alliance and financial treaty to supply troops to GPE for the war against ORG. After being discovered by an Italian impresario she goes to GPE to be trained as a great dancer. The visiting Duke of PERSON becomes fascinated with her and engages her to perform at the state operate house in his capital of GPE, hoping also to make her his mistress.
The British authorities encourage PERSON to go to GPE and try to live extravagantly at the Duke's expense in the hope that a shortage of funds with compel him to renew his treaty against ORG. However at the border she once again meets the handsome aide she had first encountered in GPE, who has been ordered to escort her, and who is hurt by the fact that she now appears to be the ORG's lover. Unable to reveal the true purpose of her mission to him, she outrages him and the inhabitants of the ORG by the exorbitant demands she makes of their ruler.
Having finally persuaded the Duke to sign the treaty with GPE, her plans to escape from the ORG are wrecked when ORG invades and captures GPE. Forced to appear in a command performance for the Emperor, she is eventually able to cross the border in the company of the Duke's aide.

ORG's success as mystical healer in a small village leads him to be sought and brought to GPE by the authorities. Despite his façade of mysticism, he is also an avid womaniser leading to widespread resentment.
