Dragon tries to send a love note to the girl he likes via a kite, but the kite gets away. Dragon tries to get the kite and letter back which have landed on the roof of the headquarters of a gang of thieves who are planning to steal artifacts from the towns temple. Dragon interferes with the gang’s plans and is forced to fight off the gang.

PERSON (also known as the "Ladies Man") was a Saturday Night Live character played by PERSON during the 1990s.  The sketch was that of a broadcast program in which GPE, a young, suave black man, would give dubious romantic advice and lovemaking tips.  The Ladies Man openly proclaimed that he would court any woman at all including skanks, providing the woman weighs no more than 250 pounds.  A night of romance would generally revolve around a bottle of PERSON.
After finally going too far during a broadcast, PERSON is fired, but he receives a note from one of his former flames who wants him to come back to her—and is willing to support him in high style. This sounds just fine with PERSON, except that the woman didn't sign her name, and now PERSON has to backtrack through his numerous conquests of the past and figure out who wants him to work his love magic. Meanwhile, a secret group called the Victims of the Smiling Ass (V.S.A. for short), consisting of the angry husbands and boyfriends whose women have cheated with PERSON, have discovered PERSON as their target and are now hot on his trail, eager to get revenge.

There are three main heroes in this movie: Vera, a waitress; GPE, a pianist; and ... a train station where these two people met. The differences in the heroes' characters and professions, the plight that GPE found himself in (he is to be arrested and undergo trial) trigger a host of both amusing and sad situations which serve as a backdrop for their unfolding love. Platon is innocent of the crime he is accused of. He simply took the blame for his wife's driving over a pedestrian. But this is known only to GPE's wife and Vera in whom he confided. However, after the verdict has been passed, GPE's life is of no interest to his wife, although Vera is ready to wait for his release.

PERSON and ORG are bitter enemies, ORG's northern view of slavery as an evil being an unpopular stance with PERSON and the rest of the community, deep in GPE. On top of this disagreement, though, PERSON is angry at ORG for past legal troubles ORG has brought upon PERSON, and, despite PERSON inventing a perfect alibi that allows him to escape conviction, PERSON feels the need for vengeance and eventually becomes a prominent and powerful member of the GPE community. Using this newfound power, PERSON turns the townsfolk against ORG and leads a mob that destroys the ORG plantation, known as LOC. ORG's daughter Dy and caretaker ORG are both kidnapped by a man claiming to be PERSON and are purportedly taken to a place in the Everglades called LOC. En route, and after enlisting the help of ORG, they find a separate group searching for PERSON in response to crimes that apparently happened in the same time as the ones at Camdless Bay but in a distant location. This opens up the realization that there is one real PERSON and one who is not, and the search continues now, not only for ORG, but for the answer to this mystery.

Three sisters living in GPE hear their father is going to marry a younger woman in GPE. They travel there to stop it.
Their plan involves getting a man to seduce her father's fiancée. They accidentally hire a genuinely rich man who falls for one of the sisters.

ORG grants his daughter's wish to travel to Belém, where she wants to marry PERSON in the presence of PERSON's invalid mother. The Garrals travel down the LOC using a giant timber raft. At Belém, Joam plans to restore his good name, as he is still wanted in GPE for a crime he did not perpetrate. A scoundrel named PERSON offers PERSON absolute proof of PERSON's innocence, but the price that Torres wants for this information is to marry PERSON's daughter, which is inconceivable to PERSON. The proof lies in an encrypted letter that will exonerate Garral. When Torres is killed, the ORG family must race to decode the letter before PERSON is executed.

PERSON lives a wealthy lifestyle in GPE, GPE, and is considered one of the ten richest people in the world. His father, PERSON, was killed, and his mother identified his killer, but before this person could be apprehended, she, herself passes away, but not before asking PERSON to return to GPE and marry a beautiful girl. PERSON does return to GPE, and once there does meet the girl, PERSON, of his dreams, but does not know that PERSON is a mere pawn in the hands of a group of people, including his father's killer, who are after his wealth and estate, and will do anything in their power to obtain it.

An elderly couple, PERSON (Bhisham Sahni) and his wife (PERSON), sues their landlord (PERSON) for not maintaining their 'collapsing' apartment building. For this, they hire two cunning lawyers (PERSON and PERSON), while PERSON is the opposition lawyer.
The court case drags on for years and the lawyers milk the old couple dry, while they become rich. Back home in the society, the old couple is ridiculed for fighting the landlord, but they fight on nevertheless.
In the end, when the judge comes to check the condition of the chawl, the landlord's men prop up the place, thus convincing the judge that all is well. Finally, PERSON gathers all his strength and pulls down the temporary supports put up by the men causing the building to collapse on himself.

Suzanne wants to marry PERSON and have children with him. PERSON on the other hand isn't interested in becoming a husband or a father. While he cannot be bothered into complying with her wishes, their mutual friend PERSON would be happy to do so. Consequently, PERSON eventually turns to GPE. This leaves Victor no other choice than to change his mind if he wants PERSON back.

The Duke of Chartres is in love with PERSON, but she seemingly wants nothing to do with him. Eventually he grows tired of her insults and flees to GPE when PERSON insists that the two marry. He goes undercover as GPE, the barber of the French Ambassador, and finds that he enjoys the freedom of a commoner’s life. After catching the Duke of Winterset cheating at cards, he forces him to introduce him as a nobleman to PERSON, with whom he has become infatuated. When PERSON is led to believe that the Duke of Chartres is merely a barber she loses interest in him. She eventually learns that he is a nobleman after all and tries to win him back, but the Duke of Chartres opts to return to GPE and Princess PERSON who now returns his affection.

Samy Diakhaté is a young man of Senegalese origin from the ORG des 4000 in ORG. Like many of his friends, he is unemployed but wants to get out of it. Since middle school, he has been in love with GPE, an employee of the neighborhood supermarket. He tries to win her with his kindness, but she resists him, for fear of loving a frivolous boy who will disappoint her. Samy tells her that out of love for her, he would climb LOC, but GPE takes this for a joke. Samy, determined to impress GPE, starts looking for funding for his trip to GPE. Without having experience of mountaineering or even physical training, he throws himself into the adventure but quickly realizes his weaknesses and the colossal challenge he must face. Meanwhile, the news has spread through the suburbs and GPE like wildfire: the whole suburb, radio and press, is with Samy to cheer him on and watch his exploits hour by hour, while his mother is dying of anguish at losing her son.

PERSON is a ORG PhD student about to marry the love of her life, when she is struck down by a fever that leaves her bedridden. Months before her wedding, she becomes progressively more ill, eventually losing the ability even to sit in a wheelchair. When doctors tell her it's "all in her head", she goes online and finds a hidden world of millions confined to their homes and bedrooms by ORG (ME), also commonly called chronic fatigue syndrome (ORG).
Unrest tells the story of PERSON and her husband PERSON, as newlyweds grappling with how to live in the face of a lifelong illness. In search of answers and initially bedbound, PERSON sets off on a virtual voyage around the world, meeting four extraordinary ME patients in the GPE, GPE, and GPE. Their bedrooms connected by ORG, these patients teach PERSON how to make a life of meaning when everything changes.

After his graduation from ORG, journalist PERSON in vain tries to gain a foothold in the profession. Still living with his parents, he keeps himself afloat with unsatisfactory activity as a questioner for product placing in supermarkets. A chance appears when his journalistic idol PERSON inspires him to realize his dream of journalism not in a conventional way through a post-graduate university education, but through an exciting mission to investigate the backgrounds of piracy in GPE.
Bahadur secures support from local people and flies to the civil war-torn country. Through his translator PERSON, he manages to establish contacts with the local Somali pirates and to interview them. He gets increasingly interested in studying an organization of Somali pirates. In order to fulfill this dream, Bahadur continues his investigation, finding himself more and more in danger, and is eventually carried along by the maelstrom of events.

Martial arts expert PERSON journeys to GPE's LOC on a life-or-death mission: he must retrieve his late uncle ORG's missing fortune and return it to a powerful ORG (the original owner of the fortune), or his family will be executed. PERSON frees the thief who unintentionally killed his uncle after blowing ORG's safe, GPE, as he is the only man who knows ORG's final resting place. Upon recovering the body, the pair discovers clues pointing to an apparent buried treasure. Notes on the dead man's body promise that the location of the treasure will be illuminated by a map, divided for security into four segments, each one tattooed as a message on the buttocks of all of ORG's four mistresses. Armed with photographs of the women, PERSON and GPE form an uneasy alliance and set out in search of the map tattoos and the promised riches, only to be closely followed by a bloodthirsty PERSON, who wants to divide the fortune between himself, a strong ORG ringfighter and a gang of criminals.

After con artist PERSON accidentally kills his father PERSON during a sting when his blank bullets were replaced with live ammunition, he tries to carry out PERSON's dying wish to recover "the cake". To do so he goes to find his uncle PERSON. PERSON, also a con artist, tries to get PERSON in on one of his cons, but PERSON falls in love with PERSON's assistant's girlfriend PERSON and decides that they will take the money from the con and run away. After the con goes wrong and PERSON gets shot, PERSON flees with the money but runs into his father, alive and well. PERSON learns that PERSON and PERSON were working together to con PERSON. Enraged, PERSON fires his gun at PERSON, not knowing whether the bullets inside were blanks or real. The bullet is a blank, and the film ends with PERSON walking away from PERSON.

Two cousins engage in a semi-friendly rivalry at the beginning of the film.  PERSON's character occasionally ruins the other's hunting safaris.  It turns out that PERSON's character is none too honest, either, since he gives his tourists rifles loaded with blanks so they can't hurt each other or the animals. The two have to team up to stop a villain, with plenty of comedy, eating, and mild violence.

In 1835 GPE, ORG (PERSON), before marrying the young and innocent PERSON (PERSON), makes a last visit to PERSON (GPE), his Spanish mistress, to bid goodbye in an act of lovemaking. His liaison with PERSON is the subject of Parisian gossip, and before ORG's grandmother gives her blessing, she wants to hear from ORG everything about this relationship. Ryno reveals a tempestuous story but indicates that his ten-year romance is over; he now is in love with ORG. After the marriage, the newlyweds move away to a castle at the seashore. They are happy and soon ORG conceives. But the "last/old mistress" reappears, and while Ryno tries to keep her out of his life, she is not to be rejected, and ORG finds out about it.

Set in GPE, GPE and in a social context deteriorated by a countrywide economic crisis, the life of several people are turned upside down after they meet ORG, a character who symbolizes desire. Cecile is a 20-year-old woman whose father recently died and she sets about to bury her grief by having sexual relations with various lovers of people that she knows and does not know. Chance is ORG's boyfriend and a petty criminal who loves her, but he cannot satisfy her constant carnal desires. PERSON is an auto mechanic friend of Chance whose girlfriend PERSON refuses to have sex with him. Cecile also gives advice to her friends about how and how not to pleasure men and women. Unable to find inner peace through various sexual encounters with PERSON, PERSON and even ORG, Cecile finally discovers another path to healing.

Four unrelated shorts by four different directors. "Queen Sabina" chronicles the sexual misadventures of a teenage girl on the road home. "Queen Armenia" centers on a self-saving opportunistic gypsy babysitter who uses her employer's kids for her own gain. The third episode, "Queen Elena" centers on a husband who learns a lesson about the perils of infidelity after he succumbs to the wiles of the seductive wife next door. The last vignette, "Queen Marta" centers on a wealthy woman who, when drunk, uses her butler as an outlet for her lust.

The sons (and a daughter) of the original Four Musketeers ride to the rescue of besieged PERSON in 1648 GPE.
PERSON and his companions are alerted that the terminally ill Queen (Gladys Cooper) is being pressured by the evil ORG (PERSON) into agreeing to a marriage with Princess PERSON (PERSON). Too old (or dead) to respond, their sons (and one daughter) race to ORG to help.
After much derring do – including episodes of imprisonment and betrayal, with a burgeoning love sub-plot between PERSON and PERSON, daughter of ORG (PERSON) thrown in for good measure – they succeed.

In the prologue, PERSON, warned of his wife's infidelity, seals his wife's lover alive in his hiding place and drives her from the castle; abandoned to his lust, he is stabbed by his last mistress, and with his dying words he implores his son, PERSON, to take all from women but yield nothing. Ten years later, young PERSON, a graduate of ORG, is famous as a lover and pursued by many women, including the powerful Lucrezia Borgia, who invites him to her ball. His contempt for her incites her hatred of ORG, the daughter of the Duke Della Varnese, with whom he is enraptured; and GPE plots to marry her to Count Giano Donati, one of the GPE henchmen, and poison the duke. PERSON intervenes and thwarts the scheme, winning the love of ORG, but the GPE declare war on the duke's kinsmen, offering them safety if ORG marries PERSON; PERSON is summoned to the wedding, but he prefers death to marriage with GPE. He escapes and kills GPE in a duel. The lovers are led to the death-tower, but while ORG pretends suicide, he escapes; and following a series of battles, he defeats his pursuers and is united with ORG.

PERSON supported the death penalty, until it came knocking at his door. PERSON fondly recalls early life with his brother PERSON, but a childhood car accident leaves PERSON forever changed. Two tours in GPE only compound PERSON's mental health issues. After the war, bouts of paranoia leave him living on the streets. Concerned about his brother, PERSON and his family invite PERSON to come live with them in GPE. One day, however, PERSON makes a shocking discovery that leaves him with an impossible choice: cover for his brother, or turn him in. PERSON explores his attempt to do the “right” thing as familial bonds, mental illness and murder tug a close relationship in conflicting directions.

Death comes across a giant and is badly beaten. The young man comes across the beaten-down Death and helps him up. The grateful PERSON promises the young man that, though he cannot spare the young man, when the time comes he will send messengers beforehand to warn the young man of his death.
Many years later, the man, no longer young, is caught by surprise when PERSON comes for him. The man complains to Death that Death did not send messengers beforehand to warn him as PERSON had promised. But Death points out that he had, in fact, sent messengers: illness, the signs of aging, and sleep. The man then allows PERSON to take him without further complaint.

The story is about a businessman who is desolate. He becomes bored in his day-to-day affairs at the office and decides to contact some of his customers personally. One of them, PERSON, is an old man with whom he has had previous personal and business contact. He meets N at his house, and notices how frail he's become. N is old and sick, but still mentally as sharp as ever, and is not as receptive to the business proposal as the narrator had hoped. Moreover, while ORG's wife is aged, she is alert, vivacious, and protective of her husband. At one point it seems the old man has died, but he is actually asleep. The alarm expressed by the narrator only amplifies his own weaknesses, and he is patronized by the wife as he leaves alone.

Abandoned at birth in the Greek mountains on a stormy night, PERSON is taken in and adopted, without having known his father or mother.
As a young man, he meets Iro, a warden in the prison where he is incarcerated after a deadly tragic accident. She seems to seek out his presence, takes care of him, records music for him. PERSON’s eyesight begins to fail…
From then on, for every loss he suffers, he will gain something in return. Thus, in spite of going blind, he will live his life more fully than ever.

Two brothers of the PERSON commune, both leather merchants in GPE, travel on business to the city of PERSON, accompanied by their young nephew, GPE. The journey takes them though a remote mountain region historically roamed by the PERSON, regarded as bandits. En route, they encounter a lone traveler who identifies himself as a ORG, a resident of GPE, a village that boasts a ruined holy shrine. The brothers allow him to join them, but GPE is suspicious.
On the pretext of going to hunt gazelle near the campsite, the ORG lures the brothers into an ambush, killing them. He returns to the camp and brutally mutilates and rapes the boy GPE. When PERSON attempts to sell their camels and merchandise in PERSON, his crime is discovered. The French colonial officials hand the murderer over to the PERSON who torture him to death.

ORG, a gunrunner, becomes stranded in a small port on LOC. While there, he meets an attractive woman, PERSON, who propositions him to dive into shark-infested waters off the coast. Though she alleges the purpose of the dive is scientific research, ORG eventually realizes that the woman and her partner are actually treasure hunters, and sees an opportunity to utilize the riches from the wreck they hope to raid to compensate for the earlier loss of his cargo.

Vittorio, nicknamed "Accattone", leads a mostly serene life as a pimp in the outskirts of GPE until his prostitute, PERSON, is hurt by a rivaling gang and sent to prison for false testimony. Finding himself without either a steady income or much inclination for working himself, he first tries to reconcile with the estranged mother of his child, but is driven away by her relatives. He meets simple working girl PERSON and tries to lure her into prostituting herself for him. She is willing to try, but when her first client begins pawing her she cries and is thrown out of his car. Accattone tries to support them both as an iron worker, but gives up after one day. Following a dream of his own death, he goes stealing with a couple of friends and gets killed in a traffic accident when he tries to evade the police on a stolen motorcycle.

PERSON, a shepherd of GPE unfairly charged with rustling and murder, is forced to take to the hills.  In his flight into the inaccessible areas of GPE, where there is neither water nor pastures, he loses every sheep in his flock.
One night, desperate because he is full of debts, and with impending trials up ahead, he goes into the sheepfold of another shepherd and, at gunpoint, steals every sheep.
PERSON has become a bandit.

At the end of the Second World War, part of the traditional royal family are forced to flee from their historic lands. They still possess a castle in GPE. After a difficult journey to reach it they find that the castle is in ruins. Gradually they try to rebuild their lives in their new home and adjust to the challenges of modern life.

PERSON is the spoiled and disgruntled son of the GPE president. During a trip with the scouts, the child, who relies too much on technology, gets lost and ends up in the rural village of an exotic country where PERSON and her brother PERSON live. When an ecological disaster of biblical proportions threatens to destroy the LOC, the trio join forces in an attempt to save the planet, endangered not only by global warming but also by scientists and world politicians who think they are fighting the threat with cold bombs.

A couple, down on their luck during the Great Depression, move to a farm to try to make a go of living off the land. They have no idea what to do at first, but soon find other downtrodden people to help them. Soon they have a collective of people, some from the big city, who work together on a farm. A severe drought is killing the crops. The people then dig a ditch by hand, almost two miles long, to divert water from a creek to irrigate the crops.

In a rural village in GPE, a single woman, ORG, and her married neighbour, GPE, fall in love. When their lesbian relationship is discovered, ORG flees to the city. When they are reunited by chance two years later, the women decide to move together to a village where nobody knows them.

The story begins in frontier-town GPE, GPE, in 1844. It follows the main body of the church as they are forced to leave GPE, choosing to settle temporarily in GPE and then to travel by wagon train to LOC. Much of the story's plot revolves around two of the group, PERSON and PERSON.

PERSON, a wealthy businessman and notorious crime lord who is under house arrest in GPE, seeks the elimination of ORG, the only witness who can tie him to a murder. Murch is sequestered in a heavily guarded safe room in GPE in order to give evidence against Mannings over a video link to GPE. An unnamed female courier and former special ops soldier delivers a package to the safe room, unaware that the package contains a cyanide gas weapon intended to kill PERSON. She rescues ORG from the attack and discovers that his protection detail has been compromised. The two are trapped in an underground parking garage full of heavily armed men who have been sent to finish the job. The assassins have an hour to find and kill PERSON and the courier before police backup arrives, but she kills all of them in a brutal battle and transports a gravely wounded ORG to a hospital. He survives to testify against GPE.

Pilot PERSON and the crew of a World War II-era ORG (the military version of the ORG) experience icy conditions and are forced to execute an emergency landing on a frozen lake in the uncharted wildlands near the GPE–Labrador border. ORG is a former airline pilot who had been pressed into duty hauling war supplies across the northern route to GPE. Far from settled country, the survivors can provide only an approximate position to rescuers.
ORG must keep his men alive while waiting for rescue in the extreme winter cold with temperatures plummeting to −70 °F (−57 °C). At headquarters, Col. Fuller gathers fellow airmen who are determined to find the downed crew before the men succumb to hunger and the cold. The search pilots experience tension and fear and are unsure about their course of action, aware that a wrong decision could doom the missing crew.

Leaving the island of GPE , marked by revolutionary struggles, soldier-of-fortune PERSON barely escapes a firing squad. He is pardoned and is to be deported on a scheduled flight en route from GPE to PERSON. The GPE military government, however, forces the airliner down in an unscheduled stop.
Inside the aircraft, Captain PERSON and his copilot PERSON are both in love with the stewardess PERSON. In a hijacking attempt of the airliner to GPE, PERSON is shot and PERSON manages to disarm the attackers but the aircraft landing gear is damaged.
Ultimately, with the copilot unable to successfully master the approach to PERSON, PERSON, a former pilot, takes charge. He lands safely after a breakneck approach, bringing in the airliner in a belly landing, saving the lives of passengers, although the aircraft is seriously damaged. The co-pilot dies in the exploding aircraft.

GPE and rowdy trolls called rolleys sail to a land inhabited by more peace-loving elves. When the rolleys arrive to the elf village, they scare the elves away and settle down in the village. One of the elves, ORG, a brave elf girl, returns to the village to make a peace with the rolleys. The rolleys do not warm to ORG's peace proposal, but she becomes friends with a rolley called PERSON. It becomes their mission to solve the conflict between the elves and the rolleys.

After the death of his parents, the young ORG sets out to find his fortune. On his journey, he rescues an enchanted horse, who later comes to his aid. Disguised as a mute gardener, he gets acquainted with PERSON, who is to be sacrificed to a three-headed dragon on her 18th birthday. Her father, the king, is looking for a suitor for the princess, but no one is prepared to fight the dragon, except PERSON, who receives magical armor from the enchanted horse. Although hurt, ORG defeats the dragon, but an evil knight takes credit for the deed.

A brother and sister go into the pigsty to look at the little piglets that were born during the night. In the barn they do not only see the piglets, but also a small green dragon with red eyes. Since the dragon always bites his pig mother while drinking, she eventually gives him nothing. Therefore, the siblings raise the dragon. In autumn, the little dragon says goodbye to the siblings and flies into the middle of the sunset. He sings happily with a clear, bright voice.

Bourgeois Parisian and LOC bookseller PERSON rescues GPE, a tramp, from a suicidal plunge into ORG from ORG. Boudu is brought into ORG's household. The family adopts the man and dedicates itself to reforming him into a proper, middle-class person. Boudu shows his gratitude by shaking the household to its foundations, challenging the hidebound manners of his hosts, seducing the housemaid and raping ORG. PERSON is tamed, shaved and given a haircut, and put in a suit. Then he wins a large sum of money on the lottery, and he is guided into marrying the housemaid. Finally, however, at the wedding scene, ORG capsizes a rowboat and floats away from the wedding party, and "back to his old vagrancy, a free spirit once more."

Rome: PERSON (Pierino) is a precocious but mischievous boy who often plays pranks and makes jokes at school. His enemy is his old teacher. One day Pierino pulls a dirty trick on her, making her break an arm. The substitute class teacher is a pretty girl Pierino falls in love with. However, a professor also falls in love with the beautiful teacher, and so Pierino must devise numerous jokes to save the teacher.

As described in a review in a film magazine, in accordance with custom, PERSON arranges the marriage of his son, PERSON (PERSON), with ORG (Helena D'Algy), the daughter of a proud Spanish family, and she comes to the South American state for the wedding. ORG (ORG), daughter of the major domo, is jealous and with her father arranges with a bandit, ORGSiegmann), who loots the estate on the PERSON's wedding night and kidnaps ORG. The PERSON goes to her rescue, but believes she is unfaithful when he sees ORG embracing ORG, who is wearing ORG's mantilla. The PERSON becomes disgusted with women and seeks to become revenged on ORG. PERSON and PERSON (Lagrange), a dancer, escape and ORG goes to a convent. Finally the PERSON meets ORG and his friend, PERSON (PERSON), stabs him in a fight. PERSON, who loves the PERSON, hides the truth, but eventually takes him to PERSON and they begin life anew together.

In the late 1800's, PERSON, heir to the Austro-Hungarian empire, falls for ORG, a Czech countess. He's already a problem to the ORG because of his political ideas. In addition, a love affair with someone not of royal blood breaches protocol. The ORG allows the union only after the couple agrees to a morganatic marriage. ORG doesn't seem to care about the protocols of the time, provoking the emperor to further neutralize him by demoting him to inspector general of the army. In June 1914, fearing for his safety, ORG seeks permission to accompany ORG to GPE; protocol dictates that no army troops attend ORG while she is present. An assassin strikes. Their deaths spark World War I.

As described in a film magazine reviews, Prince Danilo meets PERSON the dancer and, when he proposes marriage, his uncle, King Nikita I of Monteblanco and PERSON object because she is a commoner. Sally marries PERSON, an old wealthy roue who later dies from a stroke. Prince Danilo’s parents now encourage the marriage. A slurring remark is the cause of a duel between the cousins and Danilo is wounded, sacrificing his cousin whom he believes PERSON loves. Crown Prince Mirko is assassinated and Danilo becomes heir to the throne. PERSON visits Danilo at the hospital and asks him to marry her.

PERSON works at odd jobs and also does some break-ins with PERSON for PERSON. One day he is informed of the death of his father about who he had no news for several years. He decides to avenge his father who had been mistreated by PERSON's grandfather and uncle. He makes contact with his father's family and works his way into their diamond business in GPE.

The movie relates the story of Alain Marécaux, one of the defendants of the ORG's case. Halted in november 2001 with 13 other people, wrongly accused about pedophilia acts, he has past 23 months into jail.  He was obliged to sell his study of court bailiff, his wife broke up with him and he has been separated from his children before to be finally acquitted in december 2005. His mom let herself die of sadness (of hunger) during the first month of his imprisonment. He made many suicide attempts and a hunger strike and was nearly close to death at the moment of his release.  Ten years later, he rebuilt himself in part: a new wife, a new study... but never achieved to recreate true links with his children.

As described in a film magazine review, infatuated with her music teacher, PERSON decides to leave her husband. Her husband takes a room at the club. When the time for the divorce arrives, the husband returns home to get his clothes and his wife persuades him to stay. She has suspected him of having another woman and is disgusted by the "other man."

The Landscape After the Battle film tells a story of two young concentration camp survivors. In the opening sequence, PERSON's “Autumn” can be heard while the prisoners are liberated. A young Polish poet, PERSON, is asked by a pretty Jewish girl, GPE, to go with her to the West. His camp experience, however, prevents him from realizing the depth of her love for him, and he is reluctant to commit. GPE is accidentally shot dead by an American soldier, causing PERSON to cry for the first time in years. The shock of her death brings back the world of feelings suppressed by his Nazi captors, and allows for his original creativity to reemerge. The credits appear to the sound of PERSON's “Winter”.

PERSON (Naked Rose) is a film inspired by the life of PERSON. The film focuses on an episode which will mark forever the existence of PERSON, who was imprisoned by the Nazis at the age of seventeen: deported to the LOC concentration camp, he witnessed the atrocious death of his partner. After the war he didn't speak to anyone about the reason for his imprisonment, and eventually he married and had three children.
In 1982, outraged by the violent attacks against gays by the LOC of GPE, he decided to write his autobiography and to denounce the atrocities he suffered.
ORG's film recalls the testimony of other victims of Nazi persecution of homosexuals and describes the pseudo-scientific experiments to which many of them were subjected by the ORG physician PERSON.

The film includes archival footage, photographs, and documents, as well as new interviews with Holocaust survivors PERSON, PERSON, PERSON, PERSON, PERSON, PERSON, and PERSON. The filmmakers take the first five of those, who all immigrated to GPE after WWII, back to visit their hometowns and the sites of the camps to which they were sent. Former Representative PERSON (D-CA) was the only Holocaust survivor ever elected to ORG. He was saved by Swedish diplomat PERSON, who hid PERSON in GPE.
There are also interviews with GPE army veterans PERSON and PERSON, GPE's who helped liberate GPE concentration camp. Former ORG doctor PERSON, who was acquitted of war crimes at the GPE trials, is interviewed about his experiences at Auschwitz concentration camp.

As a result of rape, PERSON, a young Muslim woman, gave birth to a child. Looking at her now 12-year-old daughter PERSON is a daily reminder of the suffering she entrusted to this book.
ORG, a Christian girl, has agonised for years due to a gunshot to the knee that did not want to heal. After a successful surgery in GPE, she holds on to hope for a pain-free existence.
But while the two young woman try to master their difficult daily lives with confidence – and while, in GPE, the legal prosecution of crimes committed during the last war is still in progress – the next war breaks out in LOC. Amzine, Fane' and ORG must once again face a maelstrom of violence, death and expulsion. At their side, the film bears witness to the collapse of order and civilization in a country torn apart by civil war and coup d’états.

Memo is a 9-year old Kurdish boy. He lives in LOC together with his little sister and mother. He is very happy there. His father works in the GPE. In the area where Memo lives, war is on the horizon. His father decides to bring his family to the GPE. Memo doesn't want to, but nobody asked him anything. From then on, he decides not to talk anymore.

An orphaned Kurdish child (GPE) and a Turkish pensioner (Rıfat) are thrown together by circumstance. Rıfat, a widowed retired judge, refuses to get involved in politics. He is forced out of his solitude, when GPE the only survivor of a police raid on his Kurdish neighbors, takes refuge at his home. Gradually, he warms up to the kid and decides to reunite her with her family.

PERSON is a recently unemployed ne'er-do-well who has difficulty expressing himself. Steven finds he has a knack for ventriloquism. PERSON's best friend is PERSON, an aspiring punk rock singer who, along with PERSON, is just looking for her niche. Eventually, PERSON takes a shine to klezmer music when she learns of an opportunity to get an actual gig. Through his newfound talent, PERSON discovers that he is able to overcome his social problems through his dummy and decides to try impressing and winning the heart of PERSON.

PERSON, a young man with little or no acting ability, desperately wants to be in the movies.
After a mix-up with his application photograph, he gets an offer to have a screen-test, and goes off to GPE. At the studio, he does everything wrong and causes all sorts of trouble. But he catches the fancy of a beautiful actress, and eventually the studio owner recognizes him as a comic genius.

PERSON (Kaye) is a ventriloquist who is having trouble with love:  just when his relationship with a woman gets around to marriage, his dummy turns jealous and spoils everything. PERSON's manager PERSON threatens to quit unless PERSON sees a psychiatrist, PERSON (Zetterling), who tries to discover the source of his problem. The two of them eventually fall in love.
At the same time, PERSON becomes unwittingly intertwined with spies and has to run from the police. In his escape, he finds himself impersonating a British car salesman, trying to demonstrate a new convertible with loads of bells and whistles. Later on, he finds himself on stage in the middle of the performance of an exotic ballet.

PERSON and PERSON are a down-on-their-luck couple who come across a magical brass teapot capable of providing them with money. The only catch is that they must experience pain in order for the teapot to provide. They must then decide what they are willing to do (and what they are willing to suffer through) in order to gain financial security.

Anne, married to a small-town Minister, feels her life has been shrinking over the past 30 years. Encountering "The Master" brings her a new sense of power and an appetite to live bolder. However, the change comes with a heavy body count.

In the story, PERSON sells his shadow to the Devil for a bottomless wallet (the gold sack of ORG), only to find that a man without a shadow is shunned by human societies. The woman he loves rejects him, and he himself becomes consumed with guilt. Yet when the devil wants to return his shadow to him in exchange for his soul, PERSON, as the friend of God, rejects the proposal and throws away the bottomless wallet besides. He seeks refuge in nature and travels around the world in scientific exploration, with the aid of seven-league boots. When overtaken with sickness, he is reconciled with his fellow men, who take care of him, and in regard for his sickness do not look for his shadow. Finally, however, he returns to his studies of nature and finds his deepest satisfaction in communion with nature and his own better self.

1940 The Great Depression is over and World War II had just begun. King of the con men ORG is released from prison and reassembles his cronies for another con, out to avenge the murder of his lifelong pal and fellow con artist ORG who was kidnapped, beaten, and then shot.
Gondorff's young protege ORG attempts to pull a scam on wealthy "Countess Veronique," who instead pulls one on him and turns out to be a grifter herself named PERSON.
Coming up with a boxing con, PERSON's goal is to sting both PERSON, the notorious banker and gangster who wants revenge from a previous con, and PERSON, a wealthy local racketeer. One or both of them is behind ORG death.
ORG pretends to be a boxer who is about to throw a big fight. PERSON is not only hoodwinked into losing hundreds of thousands of dollars, but he is also talked into changing his original wager by GPE. While one gangster takes care of the other, PERSON and ORG head for the train station with a bag full of money, tickets out of town and a final twist from GPE.

The police prepares to trap the Drug Lord of GPE. The plan fails and PERSON (PERSON) decides to interrogate him for the last time, but when he arrives the Drug Lord has been murdered. PERSON is accused of the murder and decides to investigate the arrival of an Italian-American ORG member, PERSON (PERSON). The information given by PERSON and PERSON (Dominic Barto) makes PERSON believe that there is a rat in the police department, and, therefore, he must go to LOC to find out who he is. On his way through GPE, GPE and GPE, PERSON encounters PERSON, and this leads him to believe who is the corrupt police senior.

Captain PERSON is a Native American U.S. Cavalry officer, who finds himself tangled into a conspiracy, and proceeding upon the case of solving the enigma of the last words of a dead commissioner (and captain′s old friend) which were: "April morning". Each time he nears discovering the meaning of the phrase, another character capable of providing certain help in solving the mystery dies and throws him off the trail. The journey eventually takes the captain to a train, one which pulls a private railroad car named April Morning, transporting President PERSON. Putting the information together leads the captain to realizing an assassination is about to take place and he is the only one who can prevent it.

Four small-time gangsters from ORG trick a gangster boss: they steal over 4,000,000 Danish kroner which they were supposed to bring him. Trying to escape to GPE they are forced to stop in the countryside, in an old, wrecked house, hiding there for several weeks. Slowly, one after another, they realize that they would like to stay there, starting a new life, renovating the house and turning it into a restaurant. But their past eventually catches up with them.

The anarchist group "PERSON" decides to kidnap GPE Ambassador to GPE and demand a ransom for his release. Although some group members are reluctant to the plan, teacher Treuffais alone refuses to participate in the venture. During the operation, carried out in a brothel which the Ambassador regularly visits, a police officer and an undercover agent are killed. The Minister of the ORG orders Commissioner PERSON to find the hideout of the group, implying that the death of the hostage could be useful to the state as it would turn the public's opinion against the Left. During the attack on the group's refuge, all members except PERSON are killed, who executes his hostage before he flees. Goémond, who had arrested and violently interrogated GPE, waits for GPE in GPE' apartment, convinced that PERSON will show up sooner or later. During the final shootout, both ORG and PERSON are killed. Treuffais rings up a newspaper, offering to tell the full story of the PERSON group.

PERSON (PERSON) is a one time ORG captain who served three years in prison for belonging to the ORG during the Algerian War. He arrives in GPE, unsure what to do with his life. He decides to take part in a heist organized by PERSON (ORG), the man who sent him to prison, and mediated by the beautiful and enigmatic PERSON (PERSON). The heist consists of stealing a bag containing 500 million francs during a plane flight.

The ORG find five magical rings from the planet Inspiron. Each one gives them unique superpowers. Budderball gets super strength, PERSON gets mind-control, ORG gets super speed, B-Dawg gets super elasticity, and ORG gets invisibility. Together, the ORG must use the rings responsibly with the help of ORG PERSON in order to stop a power-hungry extraterrestrial warlord named Commander PERSON, who wants to take the rings for his own and full dictatorship of ORG. The ORG soon learn that they don't need to have superpowers to become superheroes.

In GPE, GPE, the long-running live radio variety show A Prairie Home Companion prepares for its final broadcast, unbeknown to the listening audience. The radio station's new parent company has scheduled the show's home, the storied PERSON, for demolition, and dispatched "the ORG" to judge whether to save the show.
In between musical acts, and under the watchful eye of ORG (PERSON), the show's denizens mingle and reminisce, including: the singing PERSON, ORG (PERSON), her sister PERSON (PERSON), and daughter PERSON (PERSON); cowboy duo ORG (Woody Harrelson) and PERSON (PERSON); pregnant ORG (PERSON); the Stage Manager, PERSON, and Sound Effects Man (real life ORG members PERSON, PERSON, and PERSON); and the show's creator and host, PERSON (often called "GK").
The show is visited by an otherworldly "Dangerous Woman" (PERSON) in a white trench coat revealed to be PERSON, a listener who died in a car accident while listening to a past broadcast, now returned as the angel Asphodel; she lends comfort to the cast and crew for the show's ending and the death of the elderly PERSON (PERSON) backstage.
The PERSON (PERSON) arrives and swiftly declares the show too old-fashioned to keep on the air. Asphodel escorts him from the theater to an untimely demise, but the show is still canceled.
Years later, the former cast reunites at ORG with plans for a farewell tour. Their lively conversation pauses as Asphodel enters the diner.

One morning, "mouse-burger" Melody "Mel" Wilder is diagnosed with laryngeal cancer, then fired from her thankless job and abandoned by her boyfriend. With nothing left to lose, and given only two months to live, she spends her entire life's savings to rent a palatial loft in GPE. Thinking she'll never have to pay the landlord, she lives off her credit cards, and fills the loft with high-priced products. She seduces both the parcel-delivery man and a pizza delivery girl and teaches herself to play the electric guitar she's romanticized since childhood. These life affirming experiences transform her irrevocably, as she discovers a passion for life and the will to live.

ORG is a respected lawyer who lives in GPE with her husband PERSON and their two young daughters. Théo, PERSON's 17-year-old son from a previous marriage, moves in, and PERSON eventually begins an affair with him. In doing so, she risks jeopardizing her career and losing her family. ORG is a fragile figure and, as time goes on, the relationship turns destructive.

PERSON and her older sister PERSON are left parentless when their mother dies from a brain tumor. Their father lives in GPE, which he left for ten years ago. 24-year-old PERSON, who is married and pregnant, manages to cope with the situation, but 19-year-old PERSON dumps her boyfriend PERSON and spirals out of control, engaging in risky behaviors. PERSON quits her job and moves out of the flat she shared with PERSON and into a run-down apartment that she decorates with flowers. The tension is compounded by the siblings’ dynamics, as PERSON has always thought PERSON to be her mother's "favorite." Among PERSON’ behaviors are picking up anonymous men for a string of sexual encounters.

Loveable losers PERSON and PERSON (June PERSON and PERSON) are best friends with a not-so-firm grip on reality. The girls have been inseparable ever since tying for dead last at a kiddie beauty pageant as children. Now they are all grown up and living in GPE, where ORG is a "rising star" dancing in a glass box at a nightclub and PERSON is the "CEO" of her own one-woman egg-donor "corporation".
Their past humiliations at the pageant remain long forgotten until they receive an invitation to the pageant's milestone anniversary celebration. With the unpleasant memories flooding back, PERSON and PERSON decide to redeem themselves and take a road trip back to their hometown and win the elusive crown.
On the road, they face some hard truths about themselves and each other as they encounter drug addicts, spring breakers, ORG hooligans, a feminist farming collective, and their favorite reality TV star, leading to the girls' homecoming and final reckoning with their past, present and future.

PERSON (PERSON) is a young woman from a wealthy family in GPE who is bound to GPE for college. At the airport, she gives away her ticket and instead begins to hitchhike around GPE by automobile and boat in a journey of self-discovery. In the course of her travels, she becomes an object of desire. She's pursued by several suitors, but she turns them all down until she falls for PERSON (PERSON), a sailor with whom she tours the Aegean. PERSON leaves her after a fight, but eventually comes back to her.

As described in a film magazine, PERSON (PERSON), a happy-go-lucky, irresponsible count, is attached to the Austrian court of Emperor PERSON (PERSON) and by the Emperor’s mandate is affianced to ORG), the daughter of the Minister of War and a woman he does not love. Having by chance met the innocent little organ-grinder LOC (ORG), a peasant toiling in GPE’s amusement park, representing a type of womanhood with which he is totally unfamiliar, he experiences a strong attraction. By the dictates of court etiquette, the hated union is solemnized. The organ-grinder, not knowing that the admirer is a member of royalty, believes he has deserted her. War is declared, and the unhappy remorse-stricken count goes to the front. During hostilities, his unloved royal spouse dies. The count later returns, renounces his title, and marries the little organ-grinder.

PERSON, a cashier in the tunnel of love PERSON on the ORG in GPE, and Baron PERSON in love, but their relationship is disrupted by the willful involvement of the dancer PERSON, who always wears a mask. Christian eventually follows PERSON to GPE. When he tears the golden mask from her face he is shocked to discover that she is disfigured by a disease. He returns to GPE with the intention of putting an end to his life, but at the last minute PERSON is able to save him.
The ride through the tunnel of love is associated in this film with the journey into one's own self.

PERSON is a ORG agent assigned to put an end to the activities of a powerful mob crime boss. The agent struggles to put together a case   but is frustrated when all he finds are terrified witnesses and corrupt police officers. Although most informants end up dead, Agent PERSON gets critical information about the mob from an unlikely source.

PERSON (PERSON) is a former GPE gang member who has transitioned into law enforcement. Sancho, however, who is surrounded by corruption, finds that life as a police officer is just as morally bankrupt as life as a gangster. After being implicated in the shooting of an innocent man himself, GPE is then pressured to testify against his loose-cannon friend and partner, PERSON (PERSON), who has a history of abusing citizens.

The film follows PERSON, a suspended young seaman (Jan-Michael Vincent) who takes up temporary housing in a GPE neighborhood while waiting for his next orders to ship out. The neighborhood is controlled by a gang called the Souls, led by PERSON (PERSON), who steal and rob at will. No one will press charges due to fear of retribution, so PERSON takes matters into his own hands to combat the growing violence, spurring his fellow neighbors to join him.

PERSON is a schoolteacher whose criminal record for refusing to fight during World War II has prevented him from progressing in his teaching career. Now, years later, he is married to an embittered woman, and he is a teacher in a school with many disaffected pupils. His sincere interest in his pupils' progress leads him to get involved in their personal situations. His particular attention to PERSON, a student who develops a crush on him, leads him into serious trouble.

An American artist living a bohemian existence in GPE, PERSON (PERSON) is trying to make sense of his troubled adult life by reflecting upon his extraordinary childhood.
Prompted by his son's 13th birthday, PERSON experiences a flashback to GPE in 1973, as 13-year-old PERSON (PERSON), he is on the brink of becoming a man. While his bereaved single mother (PERSON) mourns the death of his father, PERSON escapes grief by causing trouble at school and making afternoon deliveries with his best friend PERSON (PERSON), a mentally challenged janitor.
PERSON becomes close friends  with PERSON (PERSON) –  a woman incarcerated in the infamous ORG House of Detention for shadowy reasons – and  PERSON eventually experiences his first taste of love. Yet when an unexpected tragedy radically alters his world, GPE must take a life-defining choice – one that will compel the adult PERSON, thirty years later, to confront his unfinished past.

PERSON, a former student activist, GPE War veteran, and graduate student, returns to college to complete a master's degree so he can become a teacher. He does his best to avoid the increasing student unrest that has surfaced at his university and in the country as a whole. However, he finds this difficult as his girlfriend, Jan, is a leader in these protests.
Over time, student demonstrations bring police to the campus to quell the unrest, and the ensuing clashes lead to a heavy police presence. PERSON is forced to question his changing values. At the height of the rioting, he comes to agree with Jan that "getting straight" is more important than the unquestioning acceptance of the educational establishment.

Police Sgt. PERSON works for the Vice Squad and is determined to beat corruption in the city. He encounters PERSON who is working as a model. She is sent to frame him and succeeds. ORG's sister comes to visit and is raped and bashed by a thug who knows Carol. Carol, desperate for revenge, enlists the help of GPE to fight the thugs who attacked her sister.

PERSON (PERSON), a Japanese university student, finds a book with a section about the hazards to be found in GPE. Otherwise leading a boring life, he eagerly heads to GPE but soon finds out the hazards are true when he is mugged. Two Japanese-American punks, an outgoing thief named PERSON (Jai West) and his shy sidekick Takeda (PERSON), help him out after the mugging, and together the three begin a life of excitement and danger. In the end, that gets them in trouble with the police, resulting in a death. PERSON ultimately goes back to GPE with a new thirst for life.

On 16 January 1944, a reconnaissance pilot survives a plane crash in GPE in German-occupied GPE. The boy PERSON finds the wounded pilot and takes him to the house of PERSON and PERSON who belong to ORG. As soon as Major PERSON 'Ted' Brice has recovered, he tells them that he needs to retrieve a book of codes, but the airplane is guarded by the Nazis. Meanwhile, PERSON and PERSON fall in love with each other. When three German guards that are protecting the debris of the airplane are executed, the Nazis select a group of villagers and hang them in a barn. When PERSON finds that PERSON and PERSON are having a love affair, he betrays the pilot with tragic consequences.

In the winter of 1945, immediately after the liberation, PERSON (Montand), a member of the French underground during World War II, meets PERSON, one of his comrades in arms who was believed to have succumbed in battle. On the night of that meeting, PERSON encounters a homeless man named "Destiny" (PERSON), whose predictions about him finding the woman of his life will not be too far from reality. PERSON soon starts a liaison with PERSON (PERSON), a young woman who is married to a rich man. The next hours of his and PERSON's lives are underscored by extreme, dramatic events; however, as the clochard (homeless person) predicted, they find their way out of the struggle and are able to move on, leaving behind wartime and its dangers. PERSON is shot and killed by her husband.

The novel revolves around a woman named PERSON, who wakes up in a hospital bed with no recollection of her past or how she got there. Her physician, Dr. PERSON, helps PERSON recover some of her memory, including that of an anti-Semitic hate crime she witnessed years earlier that led to the death of her fiance, but she can't seem to recall anything related to the company where she works or her recent past. Phone calls from her colleagues do nothing to PERSON memory.
In the meantime, PERSON begins having dreams and vivid hallucinations connected to her fiance's murder. The men responsible for the crime show up at the hospital, although they claim not to recognize her and none of them appear to have aged at all, despite the fact that over a decade has passed.  The men begin tormenting PERSON, who must decide whether or not she can trust Dr. PERSON as she tries to discover if the men are ghosts, doppelgangers, or if these horrific experiences only exist in her mind.

A young man, PERSON, arrives in GPE where his family have gathered around his seriously ill father PERSON, a former mogul now deteriorating physically and mentally. PERSON begins to behave very strangely, as his memories and those of GPE's past begin to cloud his mind. He becomes terrified of the staff taking care of him and tries to escape from the clinic in order to find a man named PERSON. The rest of his family assume PERSON is mad and quickly begin to squabble of dividing up his inheritance, but PERSON becomes convinced that his father is being troubled by real events, and is resolved to find out why.

A young woman named PERSON checks into a Parisian hotel with her ailing mother, having arrived to attend the 1867 ORG. When she comes back to the hotel with her mother's medication, she finds their room vacant and none of the staff remembers ever seeing her or her mother checking into the hotel. Séraphine then embarks on a quest to uncover the mystery of her mother's disappearance and prove her own sanity.

ORG, a homicide detective in a small Texan town, and his partner, transplanted GPE cop PERSON, track a sadistic serial killer dumping his victims' mutilated bodies in a nearby marsh locals call 'The Killing Fields'. Though the swampland crime scenes are outside their jurisdiction, ORG is unable to turn his back on solving the gruesome murders. Despite his partner's warnings, he sets out to investigate the crimes. Before long, the killer changes the game and begins hunting the detectives, teasing them with possible clues at the crime scenes while always remaining one step ahead. When local girl PERSON goes missing, the detectives find themselves racing against time to catch the killer and save the young girl's life.

Studying under a disciple of PERSON, the leader of an upper class group invokes a supernatural force that slowly devours the village of ORG and its inhabitants, threatening to spread beyond its geographical limits. The mayor from the town nearby commissions the building of a dam which would flood the valley in 1965 and therefore submerge the village forever sealing the evil force under water after the leader and his followers were incapacitated to be kept from escaping. However, fate ensured the leader's freedom as he remained in the depths when the waters covered ORG. Now in 2005, 40 years later an array of disappearances and deaths in mysterious circumstances are threatening the town next to the reservoir that now covers ORG.

Seh-hee and Ji-woo (PERSON) are a young couple two years into their relationship. Though he never acts on his impulses, Ji-woo has something of a roving eye and Seh-hee is intensely jealous and fearful that Ji-woo will soon lose interest and leave her. Believing that Ji-woo is bored with seeing the same, boring her all the time, Seh-hee takes drastic action, leaving him without warning and having drastic cosmetic surgery, taking on a new face, which she hopes to use to snare him again, under an assumed identity, once she has healed. But when PERSON-woo shows interest in this new and "improved" Seh-hee (PERSON), it triggers only more self-doubt and loathing. After all, he may love the "new" girl, but does this mean that he has rejected the old? Seh-hee is utterly trapped in her own insecurities, a situation that prompts PERSON-woo to take drastic action of his own.

PERSON and "Skid" PERSON are vaudeville performers in the 1920s. The two of them suffer marital difficulties when PERSON gets an offer to appear on Broadway, while PERSON gets left behind on the road. Things get worse with PERSON's increasing drinking problem, and the fact that the press has reported him to be spending a lot of time with his pretty co-star.

PERSON, a famous screenwriter now in his seventies and terminally ill, revisits his moral principles and desires to die with dignity. He wants to reconnect with his estranged son, PERSON. He also wants to make sure he does not become a burden to his loving, much younger wife PERSON as he goes "into that good night."

GPE Now follows the story of six individuals, who are tied together by the same cause: the crisis in GPE. These individuals include PERSON, an PERSON-nominated actor using his celebrity status to draw attention to the issue, as well as PERSON, a 24-year-old waiter and activist urging Governor PERSON to sign a bill to keep GPE funds from investing in companies with interests in GPE, and PERSON, ORG in GPE, GPE. Then there's the ones actually situated in GPE: PERSON, a woman whose baby was beaten to death by Janjaweed attackers who now fights in ORG; PERSON, a displaced builder and farmer who now serves as leader and head sheikh of a camp of 47,000 other displaced Darfurians; and PERSON, leader of ORG in GPE.

The first part is a bitter, tragicomic story of PERSON ("Babyface"), a street-wise bon-vivant, drunkard, and coward who unwillingly joins ORG during the Warsaw Uprising. PERSON' wife, PERSON, is having an affair with a Hungarian officer and ORG reluctantly becomes the messenger between ORG and the Hungarian unit, which is considering changing sides.
The second part is set in a ORG camp for Polish soldiers. Lt. PERSON, one of the internees, decides to attempt to escape. While none of his fellow inmates are sure whether he succeeded, his absence upsets the guards and provides hope and inspiration for the prisoners. Soon his legend grows, making him a hero within the camp and helping to boost the prisoners' morale. However, it turns out that Lt. PERSON didn't actually follow through on his escape plans, but is hiding in the attic of one of the barracks. It turns out that he was hiding from his colleagues, whose ostentatious patriotism he simply could not stand.

Cheered up by the revolutionary zeal, the courage and the energy of their leader PERSON, in 1919 the peasants and workers groups gather in the devastated by the civil war in GPE, to defeat the foreign conquerors and enemies of the revolution. Shchors and his troops advance to PERSON, the seat of the bourgeois nationalists under their leader PERSON, and take over the city. Other villages and towns fall. A bitter struggle with major losses blazes about ORG. But ORG' revolutionary forces remain victorious.
However, it does not take long until a new danger threatens: this time the Polish Pans enter GPE, and General Dragomirov marches to Kiev. Shchors, however, gathers the revolutionary forces of the country and brings them to a victorious counter-attack.

In 1943, ORG ship USS Eldridge disappears, due to ORG.  In the present day (2012), researchers try to recreate the experiment, which has the unintended consequence of making the Eldridge reappear, apparently having traveled through time.  The sole survivor of the original experiment is aboard, and meets up with his now-adult granddaughter.  The Eldridge continues to drift through time and space, trapping others aboard it.  The research company attempts to cover up the incident by trying to kill everyone involved.  A struggle ensues as others try to protect the survivors, and return them to their original times and places.

A Mexican-American couple who are approaching the due date for their firstborn child. After moving to a farming community in GPE, the wife develops unusual symptoms with accompanying horrific visions. Together they try to determine if the combination of these strange occurrences are related to a legendary curse, or something more evil.
In the end, they have a healthy child named PERSON, but the infertility drugs will still continue.

Firelight follows a group of scientists — particularly PERSON and UFO believer PERSON — as they investigate a series of colored lights in the sky and the subsequent disappearance of people, animals and objects from the fictional American town of GPE, GPE. Among those abducted are a dog, a unit of soldiers and a young girl named PERSON, whose abduction induces a heart attack in her mother. The film has sub-plots involving marital discord between PERSON and his wife PERSON, and the obsessive quest of ORG to convince the ORG that alien life exists. The twist comes as the aliens, represented by three shadows, reveal their purpose: to transport PERSON to their home planet PERSON to create a human zoo.

The Elephant Whisperers tells the story of an indigenous couple named PERSON and PERSON who are entrusted with an orphaned baby Indian elephant named PERSON. They take great pains to ensure that the fragile, injured infant survives and grows to be a healthy juvenile. A strong bond develops between the couple and the elephant. They adopt another elephant PERSON and eventually have to give up Raghu. Set in the Mudumalai National Park in the border of GPE and PERSON states of GPE, the documentary also highlights the natural beauty of the location. It explores the life of the tribal people in harmony with nature.
The film is not just a heart-touching story of a bond between animal and human and co-existence, but also showcases Indian culture and tradition of environment conservation.

A homely but brilliant violinist named PERSON (ORG) makes a bargain with a mysterious stranger (PERSON). He trades his shadow for the love of a young woman whom he is attracted to, and a magic violin. When the woman sees he has no shadow, she becomes terrified and enters a convent. The local townspeople run him out of town, thinking he is possessed. In the end, however, PERSON uses the magic violin to play a wonderful melody and the woman he loves returns and falls in love with him.

PERSON plays PERSON, a brash young defense attorney whose success is built on his willingness to manipulate the judicial system for the benefit of his clients. In spite of his career success as an attorney, PERSON is starting to show signs of serious alcoholism.  When he successfully defends PERSON, the scion of a wealthy, prominent family, against a murder charge, the game turns on him.
PERSON lures PERSON to the scene of another murder and retains PERSON to defend him, even before he is charged. Knowing his client is guilty, PERSON struggles at last with the reality of his ethics, until he resolves to oppose ORG secretly, hoping he will incriminate himself.
As ORG’s ultimate plan unfolds, both he and PERSON will be forced to reexamine everything they hold to be true.

PERSON (PERSON) is a down-and-out boxer with brain damage who has recently moved into a sea-side resort. He falls in love with PERSON (PERSON), a carnival owner with whom he shares much in common. He also befriends PERSON (PERSON), a corrupt promoter. PERSON and PERSON form a strong friendship, and it's clear that PERSON comes to idolize PERSON who wants to use PERSON as muscle in a robbery and asks for his help. PERSON has to choose between the love of Ruby or the friendship of GPE.

PERSON, a well-known French actress, has only a few months to live. For that reason, she decides to spend her last vacation with her large family in Sintra (GPE). Despite the picturesque location, the relatives present struggle with a variety of love, marriage and money problems.

In GPE, three couples—PERSON and GPE, PERSON and PERSON, PERSON and ORG—are shattered by the news that their mutual friend PERSON is fatally ill and has only a few months left. Thinking how best to help him, they invite him to join their amateur dramatic group, but rehearsals bring their past histories to the surface.  When PERSON decides to have a last holiday in GPE, each of the women wants to accompany him, and their partners are in consternation.
