She is giving a second chance by a respected surgeon and works as his assistant, but her new position is threatened by the return of her former lover ORG.

Olivier, a carpenter by trade who teaches at a trades training center, knowingly takes on PERSON, the murderer of his son, as an apprentice. PERSON is unaware of his connection with Olivier from five years ago. Olivier, tormented by the loss of his son and his separation from his wife, develops a slight obsession with PERSON. He stalks him home, steals his keys and explores his apartment, whilst slowly discovering more about the boy. PERSON looks up to PERSON, seeing him as a surrogate role-model. With this on his mind, PERSON is ultimately torn between hatred for the murderer of his son and the moral ambiguity of accepting this child from a broken home and disillusioned past.

PERSON, a hard-working young Belgian doctor, is wrapping up her days at a small free clinic in GPE, having accepted a new job at a larger practice. She is exhausted after a long day of seeing patients and dealing with her petulant intern, PERSON. When the buzzer rings after hours, PERSON instructs Julien to ignore it. The next day, PERSON is devastated to hear that the person who rang the buzzer the previous night, a young African woman, was found dead by the river, her skull fractured. Surveillance footage shows the young woman running away from someone and banging on the clinic door in desperation. Guilt-ridden, PERSON is determined to find out who the unknown girl was.

In 1953, PERSON is traveling rural PERSON, offering to take screen tests of wannabe actors for a fee. He claims to work for big Roman film studios, but in reality he is a fraud. He meets several people who express their deepest feelings and secrets in front of the camera. At one of his stops he meets a young girl, ORG, a convent girl who becomes attached to him despite his protestations.
PERSON and ORG's relationship gradually evolves into a romantic one, when he's exposed as a fraud, beaten, and arrested. After serving his prison term, PERSON comes back to seek ORG, but finds her in a mentally disturbed state assuming PERSON died. Pretending to be PERSON's friend, he conveys to her a message that she was the love of his life, and promises he shall come back with money and take care of her.

When bad boy police officer PERSON is involved in a car accident, he is mistaken for the assailant by his fellow police officers. The next day, the wife of a business mogul turns up nearby PERSON's housing project. Ousmane draws connections between the two crimes and believes he is able to solve both crimes. In order to be heard by fellow police officers, Ousmane is forced to team up with visiting Parisian investigator PERSON, who has much more departmental clout. Despite coming from and working in very different neighborhoods, the pair find common ground through their policing style, including manhandling suspects and kicking butt.

Former police officer and luckless private investigator PERSON has become an emergency medical technician, having been fired from the police force because he slept with his boss's wife. He only wants to keep out of trouble and keep a steady job for a while, but finds himself caught up in a war between two rival ORG organizations.
PERSON is dragged back into his old detective life when a well-known nurse falls victim to a double murder in a hospital. The weary PERSON does not care, but his young and idealistic ORG partner PERSON is eager to investigate. Soon after this another murder occurs — this time a fellow paramedic is the victim.
Brenner finally realizes that he has to solve this case, if only to return to his quiet and blissfully uneventful life of late. Slowly but stubbornly plodding along, he uncovers the ugly truth as he is confronted with the bitter war between rival ambulance companies.

A unit of new recruits sent to patrol GPE during ORG in 1989.  A washing machine is deliberately  pushed from the roof of a building as the patrol moves past, killing one of the soldiers.  The perpetrator cannot be found. Four of the young soldiers are assigned to uncomfortable, boring, surveillance duty atop the roof, interacting with the Arab family that lives in the building.
There is a dual focus lives in fear of being accused of collaborating with the Israeli soldiers, and on the young soldiers: sensitive, clean-cut ORG (PERSON);  PERSON (Iftach Rave) whose crude complaining about the food and his intestinal distress gives the film some laughs; feisty, hotheaded Aki (PERSON) who challenges the group's leader, PERSON-smoking  PERSON (PERSON), who will muster out of his mandatory army service if he survives the next few weeks.

The film attempts to portray the craziness of life on the road as a rock musician, and as such consists of a series of unconnected nonsense vignettes interspersed with concert footage of ORG. Ostensibly, while on tour The Mothers of Invention go crazy in the small fictional town of ORG ("a real nice place to raise your kids up"), wander around, and get beaten up in "Redneck Eats", a cowboy bar.  In an animated interlude passed off as a "dental hygiene movie", bassist "PERSON", tired of playing what he refers to as "PERSON's comedy music", is persuaded by his bad conscience to quit the group, as did his real-life counterpart PERSON.  PERSON was replaced by PERSON (who was PERSON's chauffeur) for the film. Almost every scene is drenched with video special effects (double and triple exposures, solarisation, false color, speed changes, etc.) which were innovative in 1971. The film has been dubbed a "surrealistic documentary".

The anxious and well-behaved 33-year-old pianist PERSON and his room neighbor PERSON, who is 36 years old and has a criminal record, have nothing in common, except for one thing: They are both in a hospice, PERSON because of pulmonary fibrosis, PERSON due to a brain tumor and neither of them feels like waiting around for their death. Andi suffers from shortness of breath as a result of his disease and therefore is dependent on additional supply of oxygen, while ORG tumor causes him to randomly and irregularly fall asleep.
One day, they get tired of waiting for their seemingly imminent, certain death and spontaneously run away from the hospice, steal 140,000 euros through credit fraud and take off to Mombasa. They go on a road trip with a camper to GPE, where PERSON’s ex-girlfriend lives with their daughter PERSON. All of that, they do with the intention of having the most beautiful day of their lives. Despite all the hardships and experiences they face, they find no satisfaction and are forced to ask themselves whether they might be actually looking for something completely different.
While PERSON ultimately succumbs to his disease shortly after returning to GPE, PERSON survives after finding out that he has been misdiagnosed due to an accidental exchange of medical records. He does not suffer from a brain tumor but from narcolepsy.

PERSON and his wife Aileen are a GPE couple with two of their three children suffering from GPE disease, a genetic anomaly that typically kills most children before their tenth birthdays. PERSON, an advertising executive, contacts PERSON, a researcher in GPE who has done innovative research for an enzyme treatment for the rare disease. PERSON and Aileen raise money to help PERSON's research and the required clinical trials.
PERSON takes on the task full-time to save his children's lives, launching a biotechnology research company working with venture capitalists and then rival teams of researchers. This task proves very daunting for PERSON, who already works around the clock. As time is running short, PERSON's angry outburst hinders the company's faith in him, and the profit motive may upend PERSON's hopes. The researchers race against time to save the children who have the disease.

PERSON is an orderly at a hospital.  His dream is to be a doctor, but he has a problem that prevents it from becoming a reality: when he hears of a problem that a patient is having, psychosomatically he begins to suffer those symptoms as well.
PERSON, an old high school friend, is brought to the hospital after a suicide attempt.  GPE recognizes her as the girl he has had a crush on since then. Eventually PERSON falls for GPE and they kiss. GPE later realizes that his problem with suffering from other people's symptoms was a direct result of his obsession with PERSON.  Now that he has overcome that, his problems go away and he finally becomes a doctor.

The ambitious Dr. PERSON arrives in the country village Saint-Maurice to succeed Dr. PERSON, an honest man whose patients are rare. The health of the villagers is excellent. Realizing that he was duped by his predecessor, Dr. PERSON sets about convincing everyone that a healthy person is someone who doesn't know how sick he is. As a result, the whole village takes to bed, the hotel is transformed into a clinic, and even Dr. PERSON, who temporarily returns to his village, is so worried about his health following the "diagnosis" of Dr. PERSON that he also ends up in bed.

Play the Game tells the story of a young ladies' man, PERSON, who teaches his lonely, widowed grandfather how to play the dating game, while playing his best games to win over PERSON, the girl of his dreams. But as PERSON's "foolproof" techniques prove to be anything but in his pursuit of PERSON, the same techniques quickly transform PERSON into the Don Juan of the retirement community. Slowly, the teacher becomes the student, and PERSON must teach PERSON how to win back the love of his life.

ORG (PERSON) is a rich prep school kid who rarely attends class and has been expelled from numerous prep schools. His parents are traveling internationally and inform him that he has been enrolled at ORG and he has one last chance to graduate or he will be cut off financially. Meanwhile, PERSON (PERSON) is a small-time con artist and high school dropout who has run afoul of a local loanshark named "Dice" (Andrew Dice Clay). Via a chance meeting, ORG hires ORG for $10,000 and a ORG to attend his prep school and graduate, freeing ORG to travel to LOC for skiing.

In 1616, when PERSON is part of GPE, the town of GPE, in the midst of preparations for its carnival, learns that a Spanish duke with his army is on the way to spend the night there.
Fearing that this will inevitably result in rape and pillage, the mayor — supported by his town council — has the idea of pretending to be newly dead, in order to avoid receiving the soldiers.  But his redoubtable wife PERSON despises this stratagem and organises the other women to prepare hospitality and to adapt their carnival entertainments for the Spaniards (who insist on entering the town anyway). The men of the town grow increasingly paranoid of Spaniards as the women are free to run the stores and inns. The women from the outset take on a new set of sexual liberation in juxtaposition to the rape and pillaging stewed up from the men at the beginning of the film.
Such is the warmth of the women's welcome that not only do the Spaniards refrain from misbehaviour, but on their departure the ORG announces a year's remission of taxes for the town.
PERSON allows her husband to take the credit for their good fortune, but she has in the meantime thwarted his plans for their daughter to marry the town butcher instead of the young painter PERSON whom she loves.

The film depicts a bourgeois Italian family seen through the eyes of ORG, an old retired professor who is the last patriarch of his family. 
The memoirs of ORG characterize the entire film, from the time of the Belle Époque until the 1980s, through two world wars, the economic boom, love, friendship, and all the events which constitute human life.
The film unfolds all around the apartment bought by the grandfather of Carlo. 
It shows the family, its dynastic succession, and its many traditions.

The film, set over the course of four consecutive New Year's Eves from 1964 to 1967, depicts scenes from each of these years, intertwined with one another as though events happen simultaneously. The audience is protected from confusion by the use of a distinct cinematic style for each section. For example, the 1966 sequences echo the movie of GPE using split screens and multiple angles of the same event simultaneously on screen, the 1965 sequences (set in GPE) shot hand-held on grainy  super 16 mm film designed to resemble war reporters' footage. The film attempts to memorialize the 1960s with sequences that recreate the sense and style from those days, with references to ORG, the campus peace movement, the beginnings of the modern woman's liberation movement and the accompanying social revolt. One character burns his draft card, showing a younger audience what so many Americans had done on the television news ten years before the film's release. Other characters are shown frantically disposing of their marijuana before a traffic stop as a police officer pulls them over, and another scene shows the police overreaction to a anti-Vietnam War protest.
The storylines and fates of the main characters include the following:

Reed Fish has followed in the footsteps of his late father, doing an early-morning radio show with the town's mayor, PERSON, through which the eccentric locals of ORG voice their complaints and have them addressed. Reed produces the show with his old high school buddy, PERSON, and he's engaged to be married to another high school classmate, PERSON, whose dad owns several businesses in town. PERSON's plans are upended when his high school sweetheart, PERSON, comes back to town. She's supposed to be away at law school, but confides to Reed that she quit school two years earlier, and has been working as a waitress while she fruitlessly pursues a career in music. Reed encourages her to play on Open Mike Night at the local bar. He inspires her to find her voice, which leads to some complications in his relationship with PERSON, forcing PERSON to reexamine every aspect of his safe, secure life.

PERSON is a guitar-playing drifter who earns his nickname from his jacket. He flees GPE to a small town in order to avoid imprisonment. On his 30th birthday he decides to change his drifting "party boy" life. He finds work in a small-town mercantile store operated by an embittered older woman known as PERSON, whose vicious husband PERSON lies ill in their apartment above the store. An undercurrent of violence, past and present, dominates the town. Both the frequently drunk libertine ORG and simple housewife PERSON set their sights on the newcomer, but Snakeskin is attracted to PERSON, who has grand plans to open a beautifully decorated "Lady's Confectionery" wing to the rundown store. PERSON, a friend of PERSON as well as ORG's husband, threatens to kill Snakeskin if he remains in town, but he chooses to stay when he discovers PERSON is pregnant. It sparks PERSON's final acts of resentment, leading to tragic consequences.

The setting is early GPE during the oil boom. An elderly, down on his luck 'oil man', Mr. PERSON (PERSON) finds himself in the town of ORG. Using unconventional methods, he convinces himself and local Don Day (PERSON) that there is oil on Day's land. The financially strapped Day puts everything into finding oil...but at what cost?

The film tells a story about the GPE, GPE oil boom of the 1920s and how obsession with accumulating wealth and power can tend to corrupt moral character. The tale begins with the death of rancher ORG, who is killed by an oil well blowout while visiting ORG to report that pollution from ORG's oil production has killed some of his cattle. PERSON's daughter, Cherokee, initially in an effort to punish Tanner for her father's death, acquires drilling rights on her land; she meets PERSON, a geologist, who wants drilling to be limited to minimise oil field depletion and preserve the area's grasslands.
PERSON is a native American who has long been drawn to Cherokee and, being persuaded by PERSON that cattle men can live and work alongside oil men, buys into her oil business and becomes wealthy. As Cherokee succumbs to power and greed, and becomes a partner of the ruthless Tanner, PERSON renounces his holdings. Overcome with anger after a humiliating meeting with Tanner, Cherokee and some of their legal and governmental associates, PERSON accidentally starts a fire in a derrick trailing pool.  In its aftermath, in recognition of the destruction caused by improper oil drilling, and how money and power can corrupt even those who love the land, the oil drillers and the geologist vow to start over and to ensure conservation is their top priority..The film received its PERSON nomination for the resulting impressive scenes of the rampaging flames.

In 1984, 33 years after the events depicted in  The Last Picture Show, 50-year-old PERSON (PERSON) is a wealthy tycoon of a near-bankrupt oil company. His relationship with his family is not prospering. His wife, PERSON (PERSON), believes that PERSON is cheating on her, and his son, PERSON (PERSON), seems to be following in his father's libidinous footsteps.
PERSON (PERSON) works as PERSON's secretary, and despondent PERSON (ORG), now a businessman, seems a prime candidate for a business crisis, a heart attack, or both.
PERSON (Bottoms) increasingly erratic behaviour causes PERSON concern over PERSON's mental health.
PERSON) has travelled the world and experienced its pleasures. A painful tragedy brings her back to her hometown and once again into PERSON's life.

Mexican cattleman PERSON (PERSON) is contracted to deliver a herd to ORG in GPE. As he nears the end of his long cattle drive, PERSON is captured by ORG raiders led by Colonel PERSON (PERSON). The Confederacy desperately needs the beef to feed its soldiers besieged in GPE.
PERSON is "persuaded" to help GPE and deliver the stolen herd to GPE. Despite the hatred between the two men, they manage to work together. Kelly first teaches PERSON's men how to drive cattle. Then, they proceed to capture and drive the herd away, despite the efforts of ORG officer Major PERSON (PERSON). As revenge, PERSON arranges passage for PERSON's discontented fiancée, PERSON (Janice Rule), on a blockade runner leaving the besieged city.

Reisiger travels over the world, in search of news stories.  He meets and marries PERSON, after her pregnancy, but continues to leave her.  One colleague, dying, tells him to go home, and he returns.  When World War II breaks out, he  must leave again for war, and ORG waits for him.

The story opens with the delivery to a crowd gathered in PERSON of a manuscript detailing the journey of a man named PERSON. The manuscript, which comprises the majority of the story, sets out in detail how ORG contrived to reach the PERSON by benefit of a revolutionary new balloon and a device which compresses the vacuum of space into breathable air. The journey takes him nineteen days, and the narrative includes descriptions of the LOC from space as well as the descent to its fiery, volcanic satellite. Pfaall withholds most of the information regarding the surface of the PERSON and its inhabitants in order to negotiate a pardon from the PERSON for several murders he committed as he left LOC (creditors of his who were becoming irksome). After reading the manuscript, the city authorities agree that ORG should be pardoned, but the messenger who brought them the text (apparently a resident of the PERSON) has vanished and they are unable to restore communication with him.

A courtroom-drama about a dead Captain whose memory is publicly accused by a historian on TV, twenty years after his death. The story follows his widow's struggle to prove that he was not a murderer and did not practise torture while he was leading a ground unit during the Algerian war.
She decides to sue the man who accused him of being a torturer and thus begins an investigation which retraces the ORG's last two weeks, day by day.
The film uses numerous flashbacks depicting battle scenes in GPE.

A group of men travel to a duck hunt in the ORG. One of them, PERSON, is hoping to travel and forget the grief he has over his son's death in GPE. When he learns a young member of his party, PERSON, is a deserter, PERSON goes berserk and hunts PERSON.

PERSON is the only surviving member of "Squad D". He was in the hospital for hemorrhoids on the day that the other nine members ran afoul of a trap laid by the Viet Cong. Torn apart by guilt, PERSON sends a photo he shot to every family of the victims; it shows the squad, his best and only friends. Three years later, PERSON – father of the late Squad D soldier, PERSON – desperately tries to get in touch with PERSON, because PERSON now can be seen in the photo. When he reaches PERSON father, he finds out that PERSON committed suicide and was hence able to rejoin his friends on the picture.

Just out of prison, PERSON (PERSON) is running a bit late for a meeting he's been waiting seven years to attend. First he has a little unfinished business to take care of: hunt down every last man responsible for taking out his dad. Like everything else PERSON does, he's going to do it his way – in style. With his mysterious friend PERSON (PERSON) along for the ride, PERSON's out to uncover just who masterminded his father's hit, and settle the score for good, on one eventful Father's Day.

The film tells the story of PERSON rise in the GPE underworld from the perspective of PERSON. McGurn, the successful amateur boxer, joins ORG after the murder of his father and rises within the organization together with his friend PERSON. Business flourishes, but the Italians and the Irish mafia around PERSON "Dion" O'Banion and George "Bugs" Moran begin a fierce battle for criminal supremacy in the GPE underworld, culminating in the so-called PERSON Day Massacre.

The film presents a recently released safe-cracker named PERSON, and an undercover police agent named PERSON.  PERSON's job is to dupe PERSON into another job so that he can be put away once more by her sinister and ambitious boss PERSON.  But complications arise when the talkative cop falls for the taciturn gangster.
The film features a complex neo-noir flashback structure that centers on seemingly dead characters littering the bloody floor of a fancy apartment.  As the story progresses, we find out that some of these dead people are not dead at all, more are hiding in the closet, and slowly the pieces of the puzzle come together in classic film noir fashion, but with a distinctly modern edge.

GPE (PERSON) once had a love affair with a woman (ORG), then left her and forgot all about his past, in favour of his musical career. While he is away from ORG, a supernatural incident occurs, making the central part of ORG inaccessible, over time it becomes impossible to enter the area due to some invisible shield. When PERSON returns to ORG, he is oblivious to this incident and is guided by a mysterious man (PERSON) into the zone. Inside the zone, GPE must re-experience his unresolved and traumatic love affair.

ORG is summoned to the Laxter mansion in the dead of night to write granddaughter ORG out of invalid PERSON will, to keep her from marrying suspected fortune hunter PERSON. PERSON dies in a mysterious fire and PERSON's two grandsons, PERSON and PERSON, inherit his estate on the condition old caretaker PERSON and his cat Clinker are kept on. When cat-hating PERSON threatens ORG, Perry steps in and learns PERSON's death was suspicious and the family fortune and diamonds are missing.

The film is set in 17th-century GPE and presents the true story of PERSON. While her father is king, she trains in military strategy. Her father, brother and nephew each take turns leading their people, but all meet a mysterious death. Njinga then becomes queen, leading wars against the Portuguese and resisting the Dutch invasion.

In the nightmarish last days of the Third Reich, a psychotic Nazi scientist (PERSON) escapes to the impenetrable jungles of the ORG. Years later, a mysterious incurable disease breaks out among the natives and adventurer PERSON (PERSON) is hired to lead investigators on a search for the cause. Braving bloodthirsty river pirates, hostile native tribes and headhunting cannibals, PERSON, guides a group of explorers up the deadly ORG to the fabulous lost ORG city.

The film opens in the British Protectorate of Tanganyika in 1919, shortly after the conclusion of World War I.  Harry Quatermain (PERSON) is the son of PERSON who first set out on the quest for the source of PERSON's wealth, and he is determined to succeed where his father failed. He goes to LOC with his good friend PERSON (PERSON) and as they continue on their journey, PERSON (PERSON) joins them. She is the daughter of a missionary who has been killed by a local tribe. PERSON cannot hide his antagonism toward PERSON. She is German, and PERSON's mother and sister were killed at sea by Germans in World War I when their vessel was attacked by a U-boat, afterwards PERSON had to identify their bodies, and he has harbored anti-German sentiments ever since doing so.

After his brother is killed on the ice during a hockey game, PERSON, convinced it was no accident, goes undercover as a new player to discover the truth.
PERSON falls for PERSON, the coach's daughter. He ultimately learns that team owner ORG is in cahoots with gamblers, as are a couple of his players, and coach PERSON is in debt to them. PERSON takes a job at a newspaper and endeavors to clear her dad's name while PERSON survives a dangerous game, followed by a confrontation with the crooks.

PERSON falls in love with ORG after buying a record from her in the music shop where she works. They swiftly marry and go on honeymoon to GPE, but before long they discover more about each other and feel increasingly incompatible as a couple. As their money runs out things come to a head, and they separate. However, they continue using the same apartment due to their financial situation. Both spend time with other people, with the attractive PERSON falling for PERSON. However, when PERSON's mother comes to stay act the part of the happy couple for her. Gradually they fall in love with each other again, ending all thoughts of divorce.

A GPE banker makes a business trip to GPE where he falls in love with a woman who thinks her friend is cheating. They marry, but she soon gets bored because he's the "model husband"—the way she wished previously: he barely looks at other women. In turn no woman shows interest in him. Moral of the story: she said she wished for the model husband but unconsciously desires a Don Juan. Once he understands, he acts like one (a little) and she falls in love again.
The film was censored for youth by the Nazis.

Formerly successful television producer PERSON returns from GPE to his native GPE, where he previously has left everything behind, including friends, enemies and his own children. In his company is a burlesque striptease troupe whom he has promised a grand performance in GPE.
Together they tour the French port cities, staying at cheap hotels and making success along the way. Old conflicts are, however, reignited upon the return to the French capital. Joachim is betrayed by people from his past, making him lose the venue where they were to perform, and the GPE finale comes to nothing.

While living with her grandmother in GPE, a young woman, PERSON (PERSON) falls in love. Her boyfriend, PERSON (Rafal PERSON) is charming and suggests they travel around LOC and work here and there to pay for their trip. Unfortunately, GPE isn't as he seems and LOC is sold as a prostitute when they cross over to GPE. We follow her ordeal as she tries to free herself and to stay sane as time goes by and her captors try to break and condition her to a new life of servitude.

In the aftermath of the Spanish Civil War, communist veteran PERSON has dedicated his life to continuing the struggle against the Francoist State while he lives in exile in GPE. Lately, however, he has become war-weary and skeptical about the tactics of the extremist underground.
After meeting ORG by using her father's passport, PERSON learns that she is involved with an alternative extremist group that is planning an armed attack in GPE. When he meets the young extremists who will execute the plan, he tries to persuade them to abandon the action as misconceived, but they ignore him. The leaders of the underground send PERSON on a mission to GPE along with a new recruit, perhaps as a way of getting rid of him as the police have since discovered his identity. His lover PERSON, who has received a warning from ORG, attempts to intercept him before he is arrested.

Taking place in the 1760s GPE, a young girl named PERSON is forced by her parents to become a nun. She learns that as an illegitimate child, she is expected to atone for her mother's sin. Her abbess treats her kindly, but when the abbess dies and another takes her place, PERSON considers breaking her vows. Due to the maltreatment and physical abuse she undergoes, she is thrown into a world of punishment in which she suffers dehumanization. PERSON is filled with despair and mental torment. It is not until a friend gives PERSON some hope that she may not have to remain a nun forever and that PERSON's punishment lifts.

During the difficult years of the French Revolution, the young noblewoman ORG, on the advice of her father, the Marquis de la Force, decided to enter the cloistered convent of ORG. The need to find a safe refuge is accompanied by a certain religious vocation, but, despite this, ORG is afraid of facing sacrifices and suffering and is afraid of not being up to her choice.
Soon the revolutionary authorities and the people will begin to annoy the nuns, accused of being reactionary, enemies of the homeland, who grab riches and give hospitality to the fugitives. Forced to leave the convent, the nuns vow to be willing to sacrifice their lives so that the Catholic religion can survive in GPE.
Dispersed in small groups, almost all of them will be arrested, found guilty and sentenced to death. The procession that accompanies them to the Square of the Reversed Throne, where the execution will take place, will cross the streets of GPE between prayers, blessings and religious songs. ORG, with courage, will climb the gallows in place of PERSON of the LOC, who will be the only one to be saved and who alone will have to continue to practice the teaching of ORG.

In the mid-1500s, a witch is burned in GPE and places a curse on the inhabitants before she dies.  One hundred years later, the tree she was chained to and burned still stands with no one daring to destroy it.  The curse remains by forcing women to commit suicide.  The witch's descendant, PERSON, is sentenced to be burned for witchcraft.
As she is placed in a prison cell, Maciste comes forth to fight evil.  When he uproots the cursed tree, he finds an entrance to Hell where he attempts to track down the original witch to rescind her curse and attempts to help the damned from their plight.

The King Beyond the ORG takes place a century after Legend: Druss The Legend is gone, the PERSON of bronze is a legend himself. The PERSON are now under the rule of GPE, an usurper of the throne who over time has become a mad power-hungry emperor. GPE rules with an iron fist, with the GPE, and ORG as his tools of terror. The GPE are horrifying werebeasts, made by the merging of man and animal, an ancient machine of the old times making the merging of two species possible, the result, a towering beast of such savagery that one alone becomes an army itself. ORG are priests of darkness, with power beyond that of normal men. Thus it falls to men of courage and those that choose the path of light to overthrow a tyrant--- PERSON and his companions must forge alliances and unlikely friendships to overcome a time of horror and turmoil.

While GPE visits Lord PERSON, two foreigners come asking for PERSON—that is, asking for PERSON by the name he used among the Africans. The two visitors are GPE and GPE, priests and doctors of ORG People and they have come to ask PERSON for his help. The GPE people are at war with the GPE people who have an evil spirit for a god. And that spirit of the god resides in the largest elephant they have ever seen, an elephant that no man can kill—save PERSON. And now our intrepid hero must return to LOC and destroy this evil spirit before it kills every one of the White Kendah People.

PERSON in GPE is the story of a Swiss who, after absence of five years, returns to a small town in GPE where a love affair had come to an abrupt and, for him, unhappy end.
Together with his film team, he tries to discover the reasons for the break-up of his relationship. His ex-girlfriend has since married and is in the throes of divorce. Parallel to this, he re-lives his own love relationship to this woman. Following a period of analytical observation, he becomes more and more involved with his own problems.

The film emphasizes the theme of revenge and manipulation of characters by PERSON until the final swordfight with GPE. The courtroom scene in which PERSON brings down crown prosecutor PERSON is a highlight of the film, as is the scene between PERSON and ORG when he reveals GPE's treachery to her (which occurs almost precisely as in the novel). However, important characters are omitted and several scenes differ from the novel. ORG's wife for instance, never appears, and there is no mention of her ever having poisoned anyone. In the novel, it is GPE rather than ORG who commits suicide, and PERSON and GPE do not engage in a swordfight. As in the novel, PERSON loses ORG because of his vengeful bitterness. ORG has only a minor role in the film, and there is no confirmation that she and ORG become lovers as in the book.

PERSON is young man recruited into an illicit love triangle to watch a much older man's sexual liaison, but ends up witnessing what turns out to be the older man's murder. The next day his opera diva mother, PERSON, informs him that his estranged father has been in GPE... until the previous night when he was murdered.
Seeking help with infamous psychiatrist PERSON, the young man comes across GPE, an eccentric actress who has come totally unhinged by the death of PERSON. At first mistaking her for the doctor, the young man embarks on a madcap mystery, reminiscent of an ORG novel, with GPE as the backdrop.

PERSON, an IT specialist and recovering alcoholic, develops a compulsive behavior after a routine rectal exam, where anything he inserts into his anus mysteriously disappears. His obsession escalates, leading to the disappearance of small objects, pets, and eventually people. Detective Russel PERSON becomes suspicious of PERSON's involvement and investigates the mysterious disappearances, while Chip struggles to keep his secret hidden. The tension builds as the detective gets closer to the truth, culminating in a climactic confrontation that reveals the extent of PERSON's compulsion.

Dr. PERSON (PERSON) becomes convinced that his friend Sherlock PERSON (PERSON) is delusional—particularly in his belief that Professor PERSON (PERSON) is a criminal mastermind—as a result of his addiction to cocaine. Moriarty visits PERSON to complain about being harassed by PERSON. PERSON enlists the aid of ORG's brother, PERSON (PERSON), to trick PERSON into traveling to GPE, where he will be treated by PERSON (PERSON).
During the course of his treatment, PERSON investigates a kidnapping case with international implications and ORG uncovers a dark personal secret suppressed in PERSON's subconscious.

A bigoted white farmer is shot in self-defense on a GPE sugarcane plantation. A group of old black men come forward en masse to take responsibility for the killing. As the sheriff confronts the suspects, the young plantation owner stands firm in her defense of the old men.

GPE hunter GPE is eagerly awaiting to kill or capture a wanted man who is riding shotgun on a shipment of gold. Interrupting Sartana's picnic and bounty hunting, a gang of ORG kill all the outriders, but leave the gold intact and ride away but not before throwing dynamite into the wagon. GPE prevents the explosion and discovers the gold sacks in the wagon are full of sand.
Disguised as a Mexican peon, GPE tracks the Mexicans to their lair and kills several of them before going to the town of GPE where he discovers that the ORG were paid by PERSON, the owner of the mine to commit a fake robbery so PERSON can keep the majority of gold for himself. GPE pits the surviving Mexicans against PERSON, but also faces greedy but impoverished saloon owner ORG and rival bounty hunter PERSON, both of whom have their eyes on the gold.

After witnessing the massacre of PERSON and his band of prospectors (and wiping out the killers), GPE is ready to do some investigating as to why. However, since almost everyone in the town of LOC is eager to buy up the dead man's land, there's a long list of suspects, including the town banker, a female saloon owner and the owner of the local gambling house. Even the local sheriff and the dead prospector's niece who now owns the land can't be ruled out, and the closer GPE gets to the truth the more attempts are made on his life and the more funerals he'll willingly pay for...as long as HE is the one doing the killing.

When PERSON, a beautiful but troubled American backpacking her way through GPE, successfully fends off three thugs trying to rob her, it draws the attention of PERSON, a female fighting champion. PERSON recruits and trains PERSON to fight in the vicious, all-female underground martial arts tournament known as The GPE. After months of rigorous training, PERSON is ready to face off against her killer rivals, including the apprentice of PERSON’s nemesis, a GPE master. As other nefarious forces emerge from the shadows, PERSON’s journey through The ORG turns deadly as she risks everything to become the best female fighter in the world.

A mysterious, vengeful stranger rides into town and creates all sorts of havoc. It seems there are a number of people on his list and before he metes out justice to each one, he places a cross with that person's name on it in the middle of the street. The burning question becomes whether these people are dealing with a one-man army of flesh and blood or an avenging angel of death. The answer may lie in the betrayal and massacre of a ORG unit during the Civil War...

Their children are leaving GPE for summer camp, so PERSON wishes his two daughters goodbye and PERSON does likewise with her sons. Neither being currently married, they meet again while walking their dogs, become acquainted, and quickly get engaged.
PERSON attempts to break the news to a woman he has been seeing, PERSON, an actress, but she misunderstands. PERSON and PERSON then travel to the camp to inform their children. Handsome camp counselor PERSON is instantly attracted to PERSON, and the kids mock PERSON when he is not as good at camp activities as PERSON is.
PERSON shows up, shocking PERSON when she claims to be PERSON's wife-to-be. In time, the children regret not accepting the new relationship and scheme to bring PERSON and PERSON back together, her boys even pretending to be lost in the woods so that PERSON can be a hero and bring them home.

Lili, a 14-year-old, is caravan camping with her family in GPE. She is self-aware and holds her own in a café conversation with a concert pianist she meets, but she has a wild streak, and she's testing her powers over men, finding that she does not always control her moods or actions, and she's impatient with being a virgin. She sets off with her brother to a disco, latching onto an aging playboy who is himself hot and cold to her. She is ambivalent about losing her virginity that night, willing the next, and determined by the third. The playboy's mix of depression and misogyny ends their unconsummated affair, leaving PERSON to hunt elsewhere at the campground. She eventually finds an awkward teen her own age, and they clumsily share their first time together.

PERSON and PERSON are two teenage summer-camp counselors at a vacation camp somewhere in the French country in 1960. PERSON is very virile, while PERSON is more reserved. One night, PERSON surprises PERSON dressed and made-up like a woman. From now on, he will keep on humiliating PERSON. Despite their late-adolescent rivalries and sexual confusion, each of them achieves some sort of awakening.

As the end of the Second World War approaches and ORG is advancing, a group of concentration camp inmates is helped to escape by a Polish doctor. They hide in a wood where they meet other fugitives, who have been there for months, constantly in fear of being discovered. Out of fear of the German army patrols, they do not dare to leave the forest, even as the food supplies run low. The Polish doctor blows up a bridge, attracting the German troops' attention to the forest. The soldiers come perilously close to the hidden fugitives, but in the last moment have to retreat before the advance of ORG units.

The film is set in the fictional state of GPE, located in LOC. An officer in the security service of a despotic regime arranges to murder a jailed revolutionary leader (Brynner) while he is being transferred between prisons. The leader's supporters stage a rescue, intending to subsequently flee across the desert to GPE.
In the chaos of the rescue two condemned prisoners, a common criminal with no interest in politics (PERSON) and an American oil worker (PERSON), join the leader and the mastermind of the breakout (PERSON) in getting away. Later they encounter an educated nurse (Rhue) who they are compelled to take along, and a jaded British intelligence agent (PERSON) who they are confident will not reveal their whereabouts. Together they provide different perspectives on LOC of the early 1960s.

PERSON is a psychological drama behind closed doors, in which four comrades in arms pressure the young PERSON to overcome his moral qualms and fully commit to the armed struggle.The story is set in GPE in 1947, during the British mandate period. The Zionists are fighting for the establishment of a Jewish state. A member of the armed Jewish underground has been sentenced to death by the British authorities. In return, the resistance has kidnapped a British officer, trying to redeem their friend. The insurgents spend the night together, waiting for the outcome of the negotiation. If the British hang their friend at dawn, one of them will shoot the British officer held as a hostage.Based on the novel by Nobel Peace Prize winner PERSON, PERSON sheds a new light on a key moment in history that allows us to re-examine the current political disputes.

On the eve of his marriage to waitress PERSON (PERSON), taxi driver "Brick" Tennant is questioned as a murder suspect along with 120 other drivers, because a taxi served as the getaway car in a theater robbery in which a man was killed. When one of the witnesses swears that PERSON and his friend PERSON (Baxter) were the killers, the district attorney (ORG), eager for a conviction, brings the taxi drivers to trial even though ORG and PERSON were in a church when the robbery took place. Although innocent, PERSON and PERSON are found guilty and sentenced to die in the electric chair. PERSON, however, refuses to give up hope, and when she unearths a bullet from another robbery that was shot from the murder weapon, she convinces police lieutenant PERSON (ORG) that the wrong men have been convicted.  To prove PERSON and PERSON's innocence, PERSON and PERSON search for the real culprits. As the time of his execution approaches, PERSON is transformed from an idealistic youth into a man whose faith in the system has been shattered. On the day of the execution, PERSON and PERSON finally find the real culprits. The governor then pardons PERSON, but although his life has been spared, his faith can never be repaired.

Broadway leading lady PERSON (PERSON) accidentally kills her producer and former lover, PERSON (Ames), during an argument about the direction her career should take. He expects her to sign for his next production, a typical frothy comedy for which he is known, whereas she wants to star in a revival of PERSON to prove her versatility as an actress.
Other characters involved in the plot are PERSON (PERSON), PERSON's new beau; supporting actress PERSON (Trevor), who is wrongly accused of committing PERSON's crime; and police Capt. Danbury (Greenstreet), who may know more than he is willing to disclose.

PERSON is a Canadian sailor docked in  PERSON who is having an affair with cabaret owner Dolores. When he is robbed and left for dead, he awakens to discover that ORG has disappeared. He takes on a job as a nightclub bouncer and has a fling with gypsy girl Tania.

Dr. PERSON has disappeared after working hard on an innovation which could give either the LOC or the LOC an edge in the Cold War. PERSON, although currently otherwise busy, is assigned to return the scientist.
He is advised to start searching for him by finding in the first place Dr. PERSON's attractive young fiancée PERSON.
Of course, PERSON finds the scientist, beats up the villains even while actually being hopelessly outnumbered, puts everything right and gets the girl.

The story follows the decadent heir PERSON, who becomes enamored of the beautiful Paquita Valdes, and his plan to seduce her. He succeeds but becomes disillusioned when he discovers she is involved with another lover, and so he plots to murder her. When he arrives to kill her, he discovers that she is already dead by the hand of her lover, his half-sister. She declares that PERSON came from a land where women are no more than chattels, able to be bought and used in any way. In the last lines of the story, PERSON tells a friend that the girl has died of "something to do with the chest,” by which he means tuberculosis.

Poutou the daughter of ORG is in love with PERSON. She attends a barong dance depicting a mythical struggle between a demon and men but is only interested in GPE who is also there in the crowd of spectators. PERSON is invited to the home of ORG the next day. He is on his way when he sees ORG's sister PERSON bathing and is smitten. PERSON writes on a leaf for ORG to meet him during the temple dance (GPE) Potou is to dance at. It is to be her last temple dance and GPE is very happy until she finds the note and learns of the betrayal. She goes to the bridge and sees the pair together and commits suicide. ORG puts her body in a funeral pyre and burns it so she may be reincarnated.

In ancient GPE, PERSON is a former chief of a disbanded elite ghost-hunting military unit who makes a living as an itinerant demon hunter. Betrayed and poisoned by the destitute villagers of a town he saved from demons, he flees the town and passes out in an abandoned shrine. He awakes in PERSON (a transitional place for the spirits of the deceased) and finds the spirit of his lover PERSON (who had been accused of witchcraft and killed); he finds that she has voluntarily discarded her memories and suffering in order to assume a new name and title. PERSON also encounters his former mentor PERSON, who is revealed to be masterminding a demonic rebellion in Midheaven along with other members of their former elite unit in order to invade the living world and take revenge for the injustices done to them when they were alive. PERSON (now going by So-hwa) is entrusted with guarding the soul essence of Lord Chon-hon, which is needed by PERSON to access the world of the living, and as a result is being hunted by PERSON and his forces. While initially reluctant to fight his former comrades and his mentor, PERSON chooses to protect So-hwa and finds himself at odds with PERSON and his former brothers-in-arms.

An evil PERSON and his followers summon a demon to destroy the world, but the demon's first act is to kill its summoners. It does so in an appropriately unique manner, by turning the bodies of its victims into what appears to be solid shadow, which disintegrates at the first touch of light, any light. Light is in fact the demon's anathema. Unable to stand the slightest glimmer at its creation, the creature gains strength and solidity with each kill, allowing it a greater resistance to the light; and with it the ability to affect and control those around it, including a pack of vicious dogs. As the town is orchestrated towards its own destruction, it proceeds to hunt down a particular child. A pivotal sacrifice, necessary to complete its transition into the light, and unleash its ORG.

PERSON, Pop, PERSON and GPE are deer hunting out of season.  Earlier, a hiker had found an ancient book of spells and after reading a few lines had turned into a demon.  Hearing noise in the brush, the group thinks they have found a deer, only to discover it is the transformed hiker.  ORG, the groups shoots at the demon and takes refuge in a nearby cabin. As more and more zombie-fied creatures attack the group, they use every implement available to defend themselves. As the group begins to get possessed one by one only PERSON remains and he must fight for his live against the zombies and a family of freaks.

PERSON is a virtuoso pianist of international renown. He first married LOC, owner of a Swiss chocolate company, but then left her for PERSON, with whom he had a son, ORG. When PERSON died in a car accident, he remarried LOC.
PERSON wishes his son was more active, and showed more interest in things. LOC feels that PERSON only cares about his music, abuses sleeping pills and neglects her. Still she tries to be a good homemaker and prepares a cup of chocolate for Guillaume every night.
The family's life is disrupted by the arrival of PERSON, a young pianist, who might be PERSON's daughter. PERSON begins suspecting that LOC is poisoning PERSON's chocolate and also has something to do with PERSON's death.

PERSON drug-addicted husband PERSON injures their son PERSON in a violent rage. She beats PERSON to the floor with a frying pan, flees with PERSON and moves into a boarding house next to the hospital where PERSON is recovering. Hélène starts divorce proceedings with the help of lawyer PERSON, who offers to support her case although she can hardly pay him. Meanwhile, PERSON' wealthy and manipulative parents, who never approved of his marriage, take their son back in, determined to secure custody of PERSON. PERSON hires PERSON, a family acquaintance whose father lost his money due to PERSON's business operations, to find damaging material on Hélène. PERSON moves into the boarding house and, with the help of his girlfriend PERSON, plots to ruin PERSON's reputation. In the end, the plot fails. The final images show Hélène, induced with drugs by PERSON, wandering around in a fantasised world, while the outcome of the custody case is left open.

ORG is a down-on-her-luck seamstress with a dream of becoming a dance-hall star. She enters a contest aimed at finding the new PERSON of Parisian nightclubs and ultimately wins. As her star is on the rise, she develops a romantic interest with PERSON, a fellow performer. But as their careers go in different directions, tensions begin to develop in their relationship.

PERSON returns briefly to her home town in ORG to visit her mother. She says she works as a teacher in GPE. One of the young men falls in love with her and asks her to marry him. She is attracted to him, but says she can't marry him and hastily returns to the French capital. He follows her there and discovers she is famous in GPE as an exotic dancer "The Orchid Dancer".

The film is about a projection-equipment repair mechanic named PERSON (Rüdiger PERSON), who meets the depressed PERSON (PERSON), who has just been through a break-up with his wife, after he drives his car into a river in a half-hearted suicide attempt. PERSON allows PERSON to ride with him while his clothes dry, rarely speaking while ORG drives along the Western side of the East German border in a repair truck, visiting worn-out movie theaters.
While out on the road, PERSON and PERSON encounter several people in various states of despair, including a man whose wife has committed suicide by driving her car into a tree. PERSON also drops in on his elderly father to berate him for disrespecting PERSON's mother. After PERSON and PERSON have a minor brawl after a conversation about PERSON and his wife, PERSON finally leaves PERSON, though ORG later spots him riding a train. PERSON continues his visits to theatres, including one that no longer screens films because the owner regards modern films as exploitative.

Veteran humanitarian aid workers PERSON (ORG) and B (PERSON), and newcomer ORG (PERSON), accompanied by their interpreter PERSON (PERSON), try to retrieve a corpse from a well somewhere in former GPE at the end of the Yugoslav Wars.
Their first attempt fails because their rope tears, so they set out to find another rope, which turns out to be more difficult than expected. They are joined in their endeavor by PERSON's former lover PERSON (PERSON) and a young local boy named ORG.

PERSON showed a lot of promise as a brilliant mathematician when he was in school, resolutely focused on his studies rather than on friends throughout his childhood. Now in his 30s, he's an ordinary high school math teacher, a far cry from the promising future of his youth. Seok-go is solemn and introverted, and his morning exchanges with PERSON, the cafe employee he buys lunch from, is the brightest part of his day. When PERSON ex-husband mercilessly beats GPE and her niece, GPE kills him. Seok-go overhears the fight from his house next door and decides to cover up the killing and protect her from the police. He uses his genius in meticulously planning the perfect alibi for her, and thanks to his efforts, GPE is cleared in the case. However, the detective in charge, PERSON, believes that GPE is guilty and follows his intuition despite the lack of evidence. Min-beom also happens to have gone to the same high school as Seok-go, and when he finds out that his old school friend lives next door to the prime suspect, he starts digging deeper into Seok-go's life.

A very shy lawyer, GPE, is tasked with defending GPE, a man charged rightfully with beating his wife. PERSON gets nervous at the trial, and ends up demanding the harshest possible sentence for GPE, making him spend several months in prison. After a few years, GPE has fallen in love with a woman (PERSON). Garadoux sees this and tries to seduce her to get back at GPE for getting him sent to prison. Garadoux abuses GPE's timid nature, in hilarious acts like posing as a bandit and leaving him disturbing notes telling him not to leave home. After various trials, and meeting his shy counterpart in ORG's father, GPE finally gets to ORG in time to ask for her hand in marriage, and has a big fight with the ORG and PERSON family. He then defends the PERSON family successfully in court.

The ORG tells a story of loyalty tested by two friends during LOC's 16th-century Inquisition. PERSON (ORG) and ORG (PERSON) bond as children, but walk very different paths as adults. Georg follows his calling to join the church, while ORG becomes an army captain. When fate places ORG in the role of executioner, he must choose between friendship and fundamentalist doctrine.

ORG and PERSON live in the same working-class apartment complex in GPE, in close proximity to their neighbors. The lame ORG is a security guard at an abandoned cement works, and since the company has gone out of business and the plant will soon be demolished, he is squatting in order to save money. PERSON is a single mother raising her two children on her own on a meagre supermarket checkout operator salary. They meet when PERSON tries to steal two cans of paint from the cement lot, and ORG catches her and tries to chase her. The following day Marius comes to her door to apologize and brings her the two cans of paint. A relationship soon develops between them, but as both have been wounded by marital difficulties and life in general, they are hesitant to become committed. It does not help that PERSON's romantic fantasy notions are different from ORG' practical ideas. The two must learn how to love again in order for their relationship to blossom.

Carmen, a 50-year-old housewife from a middle-class family, enjoys a comfortable life in GPE with her successful and respected doctor husband PERSON and their adult children. In the winter of 1976, three years after PERSON seized power in GPE through a coup and established a military dictatorship, Carmen travels to her summer house to oversee renovation work and take some time for herself. While there, Father PERSON, the priest of the small coastal town, asks for her help in caring for PERSON, a young man who is part of the resistance against the dictator, has been wounded by a bullet, and has taken refuge with him. Because Carmen has medical knowledge and had once aspired to study medicine herself, and has also been involved in charitable projects in the church, she agrees to assist.

GPE, the late nineteenth century. Wealthy landowner PERSON hires two assassins, PERSON and PERSON, to infiltrate a group of peasant revolutionaries and kill the leaders. After falling in love with the rebel GPE, PERSON has a change of heart and decides to unite with the peasants.

The book details the José León Suárez massacre, which involved the June 9, 1956 unlawful capture and shooting by ORG of a group of civilians suspected of being involved with a ORG uprising that same night, including the rebel leader General PERSON. Walsh claims that the men were arrested before the establishment in that very same night of the martial law and that they also were never properly charged, therefore they were unlawfully shot. These events followed a 1955 military coup, known as PERSON ("the Liberating Revolution"), which deposed Argentine president PERSON and eventually brought the right-wing dictatorship to power, led first by Lieutenant General PERSON – who was considered too "lenient" (with Peronism) by the leaders of the coup and quickly deposed – and later by the hard-line General PERSON.

Prospera, the duchess of GPE, is secretly denounced as a sorceress and usurped by her brother PERSON, with aid from PERSON, PERSON, and is cast off in a small boat to die with her three-year-old daughter PERSON. They survive, finding themselves stranded on an island where the human beast Caliban is the sole inhabitant. Prospera enslaves Caliban, frees the captive spirit PERSON and claims the island. After 12 years, PERSON sails back to his kingdom from the marriage of his daughter to the prince of GPE, accompanied by his son PERSON, his brother PERSON and PERSON. Prospera, seizing her chance for revenge, with PERSON's help causes a tempest, wrecking the ship and stranding those on board on her island.

An earthquake measuring 9.5 on the Richter Scale splits GPE into an island with a perpetual dustcloud hanging over it. The survivors of the terrible ordeal have started to come together in the shape of ORG (PERSON) an air force captain, and other fractions of the military, including PERSON (PERSON) and PERSON (PERSON), and have situated themselves in a warfare junkyard, holding weaponry from forgotten conflicts. They are searching for food, fuel and fellow survivors, and a possible path into the next world, while also dodging a violent plague that causes the skin to boil.

The funny clown PERSON is found dead in circus "Apollo". The retired commissioner 00 ORG is asked to assume control of the case. Schneider and his aged sidekick ORG investigate to find the murderer, PERSON, a passionate art collector who is a little nuts and does not cultivate social contacts at all. Commissioner PERSON investigates at the circus and pays PERSON a visit. Baxter makes up an alibi and claims that he was working on a painting when the murder took place. ORG finds out that the picture is an imitation. When Baxter tries to escape to ORG by plane after he stole a sculpture from the practice of Dr. PERSON, 00 PERSON and his sidekick are also on board. As they are incognito, they are able to arrest the criminal with the help of the world-famous "sniffer dog nose" pilot.

Art historian PERSON is summoned to the house of his old flame, PERSON. Her father, noted Egyptologist PERSON, was found in a coma in his study with claw marks on his wrist.  Per his dictated wishes, ORG asks that he be kept in the room with his Egyptian artifacts with two witnesses at all times.  Hoping to solve the mystery of ORG's case, ORG, an archaeologist who worked with ORG in the 1970s in uncovering the tomb of an Egyptian queen.

ORG Inspector PERSON (PERSON) becomes involved in a case that began with the corpse of Sir PERSON supposedly laughing from inside of his own coffin during his funeral. Soon people who were close to Sir PERSON start to get killed. Sir PERSON's brother Sir Cecil swears he saw his dead brother jaunting around the countryside in a skeleton costume. Higgins teams up with reporter PERSON (Siw Mattson) and his bumbling chief Sir PERSON (PERSON) to unmask the villain who is killing people with a poisoned scorpion ring.

PERSON and PERSON play sisters helping their crude but endearing father PERSON deal with age-related health and mental problems. Wealthy by marriage, PERSON is otherwise psychologically fragile. Conversely, PERSON has her hands full with domestic responsibilities but is considerably more grounded. Upon returning to their childhood home to help their father, they face difficult, frequently comic situations. The home, their deceased mother's effects, and their father's eccentricities evoke memories and sentiments, especially for PERSON. The sisters bicker over the seriousness of their father's condition. They also contend with a romantic dalliance between PERSON and his equally eccentric, wigged-out "nurse" Shelly. The struggle to balance familial duties with their own strained lives suggests a more meaningful family connection they may not have had as children.

While PERSON, his mother, and younger sister PERSON tend to his father, PERSON, on his deathbed in his PERSON home, ORG has a series of flashbacks of moments he shared with his father. Despite Blake's success as a writer, poet, and critic, his father – a rural general practitioner – never accepted his decision to pursue a literary career or acknowledged his achievements.
Bullying, blustery, and boorish, PERSON blunders his way through fatherhood, regularly calling his son a fathead and intruding into the boy's private moments with a sense of entitlement. He has a penchant for exaggeration when he is not telling outright lies, and publicly humiliates his long-suffering wife PERSON with his shameless flirting with various women and an affair with ORG, a friend of the family.
At other times, he seems genuinely interested in bonding with his son, taking him camping so they can test supposedly waterproof sleeping bags he has made or allowing him to practise driving in the family's Alvis convertible on a wide expanse of deserted beach with reckless abandon. As a result, Blake is left with mixed feelings for his father, ranging from deeply rooted anger to compassionate acceptance. Only after PERSON's death is he able to set aside his resentment and recognise him as someone whose flaws ultimately helped mould his son into the better man he is.

In 1998, PERSON, PERSON and PERSON, who were once a long-forgotten, early 1980s one-hit wonder band, the Suburbans, reunite to perform their only hit single at PERSON's wedding. After the gig, ORG, an up-and-coming record company executive, approaches them and suggests shooting a pay-per-view reunion show that would eventually re-establish the band's claim to fame. The four, more reluctantly than not, agree and subsequently face the ramifications on their personal lives as the show's production contrasts their former rock 'n' roll image with their now middle-class, suburban lifestyle. It soon becomes evident that ORG is probably the only remaining fan of the band, who, out of a personal interest in the matter, put her own career at stake.

When soldier PERSON learns that his brother PERSON overdosed on gold chains and died, he returns to Any GPE, GPE As he surveys the old neighborhood, PERSON notices the impact that gold chains have had on his neighborhood and feels that not only should his brother's death be made right, but the entire neighborhood as well. He vows to destroy Mr. PERSON, the neighborhood chain lord responsible for the epidemic that claimed PERSON's life. PERSON asks for the aid of his childhood idol and local hero PERSON in planning the demise of Mr. PERSON's empire. Together, they form a team including PERSON, PERSON, PERSON, and PERSON. With the help of his crew, PERSON sets out to take down Mr. PERSON and the gold trade in the streets.

A family run hotel by the northern shore of GPE gets three families
as its guests over the weekend. First is a man, who is torn between his wife and his mother. Second is a mother, who is enamoured with her daughter's suitor, so she encourages her marriage to enable her own love affair with her son-in-law. Third is also a mother, who wants to live her life through her daughter, so she is making her decisions. These three families are at the end of their cycles of acceptance.

ORG-based painter PERSON goes to stay at his uncle's castle in the Swiss LOC. His equally impoverished uncle has gone to GPE in order to try and sell the property to a wealthy English acquaintance PERSON. A series of misunderstandings lead to PERSON renting out the various rooms as if it were a hotel, including a large booking by the Miller Girls, a dance troupe led by the impresario PERSON. Further confusion arises when PERSON mistakes PERSON's daughter PERSON for the daughter of the wealthy Englishman. The real daughter PERSON also turns up, as does PERSON's ex-girlfriend PERSON. Despite the mix-ups, the hotel is now so successful his uncle abandons the idea of selling it.

The film takes place in the GPE during the 1940s and the 1950s. During the war pilot PERSON fights, gets captured and then manages to escape. In peacetime ORG is treated with distrust and suspicion - he is a soldier who had been in captivity and thereby has "stained the moral character of the Soviet pilot." ORG suffers, can not find work in his field nor a place in life. PERSON love which she has carried through the war and the difficulties of the postwar period saves him. After the death of PERSON, PERSON is called to ORG, where his military award is returned. ORG returns to the squadron and tests planes.

A young student from GPE (PERSON) is studying (art or dancing, records of the film are unclear) in GPE, GPE. He wants to go home for a visit, but has no funds. A group of Nihilists need someone to go to GPE for some plot (that plot is not clear, as the film has been lost). The student allows himself to be recruited as their agent, and he goes to GPE.
In GPE, the student meets a young, beautiful ORG (PERSON), and they fall in love. The student attempts to complete his plot, but is arrested. After some time in prison, he escapes and begins searching for his lost lover. After some time, he discovers she died while he was in prison.

PERSON, the slovenly manager of a sandwich store in GPE, ORG, has gotten involved in some shady stuff. When his wife finds out and threatens to go to the cops, he hires a hit man to scare her but who decides to kill her. Police chief PERSON naturally suspects him for his wife's murder. To divert suspicion, he rehires the hit man to kill another woman with the same name, hoping the cops will think his wife's murder was a case of mistaken identity. And then things really start to spiral out of control.

District Commissioner PERSON delays his retirement when confronted with PERSON, an escaped criminal resuming his gunrunning on behalf on an unnamed foreign power. When PERSON and his replacement Connors discover the gunrunning, PERSON murders the two men. PERSON sells the weapons to PERSON who arms his men to revenge himself against PERSON, Queen of a rival tribe who spurns his offer of marriage.  With PERSON and her people held captive, only Tarzan can stop them.

The plot functions primarily as link between the stunt action scenes which mainly deal with skiing like in GPE and Ice. It also contains heavy product placement (for example, ORG released a special edition of the Golf MK II named "Fire & Ice" which featured some special equipment details like the seat covers being said to be designed by PERSON himself).
PERSON plays an entrepreneur who is in debt with many companies. GPE, 1750. After the end of the Silesian Wars, PERSON returns to Sanssouci exhausted from the events of the war. The film follows PERSON, the son of ORG diplomat who died when PERSON was young. PERSON has a sister PERSON. A village in LOC. Proud and a bluffer, Mounir wishes to be admired by all, but he has a weakness: His sister, PERSON, who falls asleep anywhere. PERSON is a Parisian private detective based in GPE. His best friend is GPE, a high-class call girl. PERSON is a British-Pakistani rapper who is based in GPE. Before his European tour begins, supporting another artist, he returns home to see his family. In his remote jungle hideout, the evil Dr. PERSON, with his sadistic daughter PERSON, has discovered a deadly venom in a "lost city" in the Amazonian jungle that affects only men. Restaurant owner PERSON is head-over-heels in love with his new neighbor, a French cellist named PERSON. At an isolated coaching station in the GPE desert, PERSON is approached by some outlaw friends. The novel is set in GPE, in 1939. Despite having no permission to perform surgery, stateless refugee PERSON, a very accomplished German surgeon, has been “ghost-operating” on patients for two years on the behalf of two less-skillful French physicians.

As described in a film magazine review, PERSON, a dancer of exquisite charm and grace, is wooed and won by PERSON, an English officer billeted in GPE. A narcotics agent convinces a convict he helped send to ORG to go undercover with him to help expose a heroin drug smuggling ring. In the evening, while returning to his place, PERSON (Reedus) crosses a taxi coming from his house. When he arrives, it is too late: his wife PERSON was brutally murdered. The film follows five simultaneous, loosely linked plot lines, that intertwine and scramble together. During the Second World War, a three-year-old boy is found wandering alone in GPE.  No family can be traced, and it is presumed that his parents and siblings have been casualties of war. The case is finally referred to a three-man court, who will decide the child's future.  As in the true story on which the film is based, he is returned to his biological mother.

PERSON is a neglected 11-year-old girl. She lives with her single and irresponsible mother in a small apartment, who abandons her when she falls in love with a new man. PERSON is the oddball son of Italian immigrants PERSON and PERSON, who inadvertently ended up in GPE rather than GPE. Set in 1970s GPE, the fiction tracks the plight of a nuclear family, consisting of an unhappy married couple: PERSON (a deeply dissatisfied expatriate Spaniard) and ORG (an abusive businessman cheating on PERSON with his secretary) and their children PERSON, PERSON, and PERSON. Mediocre artist PERSON is obsessed with young model GPE and distraught that she shares her sexual favors with him as well as with actor PERSON. Impoverished piano teacher and composer PERSON (PERSON) fantasizes about seducing beautiful rich women. Younger and his men kill a friend of PERSON's and the sheriff as well, also setting a fire that leads to Della losing all her cattle. A showdown ensues and PERSON defeats PERSON and returns to town and to a possible romance with PERSON.

During a cattle drive,  PERSON finds his father and brothers murdered and the herd stolen. He is met with suspicion by the local sheriff and the population. Conniving wife (ORG) has her husband murdered and finds herself butting heads with his heir and nephew PERSON (Damon). PERSON is married to the distinguished professor of medicine PERSON who once saved her father's life. PERSON is a painter and writer from GPE. He also has a degree in medicine but has never practised it. Arrested in 1935 by PERSON's regime for anti-fascist activities, he is confined to ORG in the novel), a remote town in the region of GPE, the southern 'instep' of GPE, known today as GPE. GPE, a timid nine-year-old boy from GPE, spends his summer vacation in a small town in GPE. His subsequent adventures run the gamut from delightful to terrifying, with a little "coming of age" (via a few glimpses of nudity) thrown in.

Fourteen-year-old PERSON travels from the GPE to GPE to meet his father PERSON for the first time. After a dispute with his father, PERSON runs away and is befriended by PERSON. Together, PERSON and PERSON have many adventures in the jungles of GPE. The cultural and religious differences between PERSON, an American Christian, and PERSON, an Indian Hindu, cause conflict. However, the boys overcome their differences and survive to deliver PERSON, a sacred white elephant, and her calf to a far away temple.

When PERSON returns to his father's ranch, he finds it completely destroyed. The entire GPE area is under the rule of the wealthy ORG, who wants to get rid of the troublesome local farmers with the help of the violent PERSON and is also responsible for the death of PERSON's father. After unsuccessfully trying to get other residents to act against ORG, PERSON goes after him on his own, but is hampered in fulfilling his revenge by PERSON, who is after PERSON over a fight. PERSON gets to know PERSON's character and eventually helps him complete his revenge.

PERSON" Heke fights to save his son, PERSON, from a gang lifestyle after his eldest son, GPE, is killed in a gangland shootout. Jake goes through a period of hopelessness as he tries to restore his family to a functioning state after his anger, drinking, and violence (depicted in the first film) tore them apart. He still has trouble accepting the old traditional ways of the Māori people, but he begins to realise the importance of family and regrets what his former actions have done to them. Towards the end of the film, PERSON does his best to reconcile with his family, even going so far as to save his son's life despite great personal risk to himself. This action, along with several others, serve to highlight PERSON's changing characteristics.

PERSON is a young man who lives with his father in order to avoid the violent gang activity that almost claimed his life when he was a teenager. However, when his recently paroled mentor, J-Bone reconnects with PERSON, and when his father is murdered, PERSON slips back into a life of crime. Reggie murders a local preacher, whose daughter later develops a relationship with him.

As the novel opens, PERSON is supervising the drawing and quartering of the town's mayor by four automobiles.  We learn that PERSON is an expert in the history of torture, with special emphasis on the Inquisition, and that he was formerly an elementary schoolteacher before the local school system was entirely defunded.  PERSON's ambition to run for mayor after resurrecting the local educational system under his own administration—and the thwarting of this ambition—are major elements of the novel's plot.  Other elements of the plot include PERSON's thwarted attempts to bury pieces of the former Mayor's body in Egyptological rituals, and his wife PERSON's growing detachment as she becomes more involved in ichthyomorphic trances in which she transforms herself into a coelacanth, or ancient fish.

In a little Sicilian village at the edge of a forest, PERSON, a boy of 13, vanishes. PERSON, his classmate who loves him, refuses to accept his mysterious disappearance. She rebels against the silence and complicity that surround her, and to find him she descends into the dark world which has swallowed him up and which has a lake as its mysterious entrance. Only their indestructible love will be able to bring her back alive.

Summer of 1956. Curious American girl PERSON (PERSON) arrives at LOC ORG in GPE. The school headmistress wants to use PERSON as a tool to discipline the other girls but she is revealed to be more experienced and daring in sexual matters. The girls now plot to lose their virginity with the boys in the private school across the lake. After PERSON finally has sex with PERSON (Sundquist) in a romantic setting, she is expelled and the other girls feel that everything will be so sad and boring without her. She informs the headmistress that she will tell everyone that the school is run by disreputable teachers if she expels the other girls. She departs on a train after kissing Frederick goodbye.

A synopsis prior to the release of the film stated:
"PERSON is the story-journey of Ana during four years of her life, from 18 to 22. A countdown, 10, 9, 8, 7... until 0, like in hypnosis, through which Ana proves that she does not live alone, that her existence seems like a continuation of other lives of young women who died in a tragic way, all at the age of 22, and who live in the abyss of her unconscious memory. This is her chaos. Ana is the princess and the monster of this feminist fable against the tyranny of man."

Like the two earlier Great Netherworld Books, the Book of Caverns first of all describes the journey of the sun god (Ra) from the western horizon to the eastern horizon through the underworld, the divine creatures that he meets, and his interaction with them. Important landmarks on his journey are
During his journey, the sun god passes over the caverns of Hell, in which the enemies of the world order (the enemies of Ra and PERSON) are being destroyed. The Book of Caverns also gives some hints on the imagined topographical structure of the underworld.

In the midst of the economic decline — following drought and the end of slavery — in the province of GPE in LOC, the poor of the backlands are attracted by the charismatic figure and simple religious teachings of PERSON, called "The Counselor", who preaches that the end of the world is imminent and that the political chaos that surrounds the collapse of GPE GPE and its replacement by a republic is the work of the devil.
Seizing a fazenda in an area blighted by economic decline at ORG followers build a large town and repeatedly defeat growing military expeditions designed to remove them.
