In the year 2019, after a nuclear war, humanity is reduced to a few starving groups. A ruthless gang called "The Templars" constantly raid settlers in an attempt to exterminate everyone in order to purge the LOC. A former ORG, Scorpion, along with his allies, prevents a small band of religious colonists from being massacred by the ORG.

Set in the 6th century, it follows the start of barbarian invasions and deals with one group that attacks a village and destroys anyone and anything that is there. One man, Emiliano, son of the village leader, is away at the time of attack. He swears revenge and wages a one-man war against the evil tribes. He also is helped by the survivors and his sister Lynda. He wears a lion head mask to instill fear into the hearts of the barbarians.

A woman is wrongly accused of a crime that was really committed by her husband and is sent to jail. While in prison she gives birth and the child is put up for adoption. Once fresh evidence frees her from jail, the woman goes searching for her daughter.

The narrator, PERSON, is a high school drop-out whose father has abandoned his family for his mistress. He has nightmares about a classmate who committed suicide along with constant wet dreams after coming into possession of a love letter belonging to her. PERSON works with his friend, PERSON who is mentally disabled, as a debt collector for a ORG member and falls for PERSON, the daughter of a debtor. She has a fatal kidney disease, so the teenager accepts an assassination contract to pay her medical fees. When PERSON and PERSON are dead, PERSON decides to take revenge on the world before committing suicide.

ORG friend PERSON beats his girlfriend and is sued by her. In court, ORG testifies to his friend's advantage. PERSON is off the hook, but now his girlfriend's male relatives stalk ORG. He shoots one of them and ends up in prison.

Renamed to cash in on the success of PERSON ORG movies, ORG and His Golden Pistol focuses on bounty hunter PERSON who sees killing as purely business; in fact he will not draw his solid gold pistol unless he can profit from it and this gets him into trouble. He lets PERSON live because there is nothing to gain from killing a man without a price on his head, unlike his brothers, who "ORG" does kill. Perez swears revenge and faces off with "ORG". PERSON has formed an alliance with the local Indian chief and is now prepared for an all-out war against the peaceful town and sheriff that are protecting "Ringo".

GPE is about ORG and PERSON who, as teenagers in a GPE secondary school, fall in love. Nigeria at the time is under military dictatorship, and people are seeking to leave the country. Ifemelu moves to GPE to study, where she struggles for the first time with racism and the many varieties of racial distinctions: for the first time, Ifemelu discovers what it means to be a "Black Person". PERSON had hoped to join her in the GPE but he is denied a visa after 9/11. He goes to GPE, eventually becoming an undocumented immigrant after his visa expires.
Years later, PERSON returns to GPE and becomes a wealthy man as a property developer in the newly democratic country. Ifemelu gains success in GPE, where she becomes known for her blog about race in GPE, entitled "Raceteenth or Various Observations About American Blacks (Those Formerly Known as Negroes) by a ORG". When Ifemelu returns to GPE, the two consider reviving a relationship in light of their diverging experiences and identities during their many years apart.

ORG a young factory worker who loses his job and travels to GPE to stay with GPE, one of his relatives,  while looking for a job. Mahmut is a rather wealthy and intellectual photographer, whereas Yusuf is almost illiterate, uneducated, and unsophisticated. The two do not get along well. Yusuf assumes that he will easily find work as a sailor but there are no jobs, and he has no sense of direction or energy. Meanwhile, GPE, despite his wealth, is aimless too: his job, which consists of photographing tiles, is dull and inartistic, he can barely express emotions towards his ex-wife or his lover, and while he pretends to enjoy intellectual filmmakers like PERSON, he switches channels to watch porn as soon as Yusuf leaves the room.
Mahmut attempts to bond with Yusuf and recapture his love of art by taking him on a drive to photograph the beautiful Turkish countryside, but the attempt is a failure on both counts. At the end of the film, Yusuf leaves without telling GPE, who is left to sit by the docks, watching the ships on his own.

In the film, a couple, Will and Eva (played by Odom and Pinto), are forced to hide after ash from a comet containing a virus kills most of the women in the world.  The film has a non-chronological structure, with scenes from earlier in the outbreak interspersed with the main storyline. The plot involves Will attempting to keep Eva safe from the government and bounty hunters, since women have become extremely valuable. It has been compared to the comic series Y: The Last Man.

ORG is an engineer who is married to ORG and has a nine-month-old son, for whom he cares deeply. When his wife leaves him for feminist reasons, he is left with custody of their son. To satisfy his romantic longings, PERSON embarks on an affair with PERSON, his son's daycare worker. However, PERSON fights for custody of the child, and when ORG's affair with PERSON threatens his custody chances, ORG responds by mutilating himself.

"An executive manager, his wife and his family, at the point when his professional choices are about to overturn all their lives. PERSON and his wife are separating, their love irretrievably damaged by pressures of work. A successful executive in industrial conglomerate, PERSON no longer knows how to respond to the contradictory demands of his bosses. Yesterday they wanted a manager, today an enforcer. Now he must decide what his life really means."

Once a photographer by day and spy by night, PERSON is now a happily retired secret agent, shooting photos of glamorous models instead of guns and enjoying a close relationship with his assistant, the lovely Lovey PERSON. But then his old boss, PERSON, coaxes him back to the agency ICE (ORG) to thwart a new threat from the villainous organization Big O.
The sinister ORG is masterminding a diabolical scheme to drop a missile on an underground atomic bomb test in GPE and possibly instigate a nuclear war in the process. ORG's assignment is to stop him, armed with a wide assortment of useful spy gadgets, plus the assistance of the capable femme fatale, PERSON, and the seemingly incapable PERSON, a beautiful but bumbling possible enemy agent.
Along the way, PERSON is nearly sidetracked by a mysterious knife-wielding seductress and he witnesses the murder of a beautiful Big O operative, the sultry striptease artist PERSON.
In the end, Helm prevails, with PERSON by his side as he all but singlehandedly destroys ORG evil enterprise and plot to rule the world.

After retiring, ORG and PERSON have a retirement party with all of their friends. After the party, ORG and PERSON are both drunk. They enter ORG and find a dead security guard apparently shot by criminals who have stolen a chip. PERSON and ORG must now track down the criminals and retrieve the chip.

While cleaning the office of a detective agency, janitors ORG and ORG answer a telephone call from an inventor who claims to have created a destructive bomb he calls "The Big Noise." Posing as detectives, the duo move into the inventor's home, where they must contend with his eccentric behavior, oddball widowed aunt (who takes a fancy to ORG) and his misbehaving nephew. ORG and ORG hide the bomb in a concertina and steal an airplane to bring it to GPE. However, the airplane is a remote control target used by ORG for gunnery training. ORG and ORG barely escape by parachuting to safety over LOC, and they dispose of the bomb by dropping it on a Japanese submarine.

The film tells the story of GPE, a middle-aged man who is fired after having spent more than 11 years working for a prestigious consulting firm. Unable to admit to his family that he has been fired, the unemployed former executive continues to pretend he is going to the office every day. In reality, ORG spends his time aimlessly driving the highways of GPE and GPE, reading newspapers, or sleeping in his car.
As time progresses, PERSON invents more and more elaborate lies, throwing himself into a vicious spiral of deceit. To sustain his bourgeois lifestyle, PERSON sets up a Ponzi scheme and is eventually enlisted into smuggling by career thief PERSON. ORG, PERSON's wife, after discovering her husband's "life of lies" attempts to bring him back into the realm of reality.

PERSON is a thief who specializes in stealing art from the elite of GPE.  He is obliged to a crime boss and wants to get out of the art heist business.  PERSON is an in-debt aspiring actress who is also a con-woman.  Together they plot one last heist and con that will set both free from their obligations.

The landowner and bachelor PERSON, who finances his nephew PERSON medical studies, receives a letter from him in which he asks his uncle for 20,000 marks which he wants to invest into construction of an insane asylum. With the uncle's money, nothing would stand in the way of building a restaurant of his own. However, Philipp wants to examine the supposed institution before he gets the money out, and makes his way to PERSON without further ado. In great need of explanation, he then follows PERSON's advice and leads his uncle to ORG: "PERSON's insane asylum". Their mystification fails. PERSON suspects that something is not right.

As Christmas break approaches, the dormitories at ORG are restless with sex-crazed students. Although eager to relinquish his burdensome virginity, ORG has thus far failed in this endeavor. His charitable older brother, PERSON, does the sensible thing and hires a prostitute to usher ORG into the realm of manhood. However, some misunderstandings complicate this procedure, prompting sophomoric shenanigans.

PERSON, an ambitious shoe salesman in GPE, meets his boss's secretary PERSON, thinking that she is the boss's daughter, and tells her that he is a millionaire leather tycoon.
Horne spends much of his time around PERSON hiding his true circumstances, in both the shoe store and later as an accidental stowaway aboard a ship. Trying to evade the ship's crew, he becomes trapped in a mailbag, which is taken off the ship and falls off a delivery cart onto a window cleaner's cradle, which is hoisted upwards. Escaping from the bag, he is then dangling high above the streets of GPE. After several thwarted attempts to enter the building, he climbs to the top, only to slip off, unaware that his foot is caught on the end of a rope, which rescues him inches from the ground.

PERSON is a mathematics teacher at an all-girls high school in Aix-en-Provence. He also works as a ghostwriter for his father the mayor, who is seeking re-election, and for his friend who works for a tabloid newspaper.
When PERSON's students sitch the contents of his folders as a joke, a speech for the mayor, an article on PERSON, a famous GPE actress, and his students' papers all end up in the wrong hands.
PERSON finds himself on a film set trying to resolve the mix-up, and ends up spending the night at PERSON house. The tabloids catch wind, and the next day's headlines provoke dismay for the mayor and for PERSON's fiancée.

This is the story of a young clerk who has failed at everything he has tried in his life so far.  He enters a six-day bicycle race to impress his girlfriend and hilarious hijinks ensue. He eventually wins this race, marries his girlfriend and they live happily ever after.

PERSON (ORG) is a 35-year-old architect who leads a seemingly perfect life. He resides in a beautiful house with his wife and child and also owns a thriving architecture office. ORG, two tourists travelling through GPE, discover an ancient scroll describing the life of PERSON, the man who was almost Moses. PERSON thinks he hears God commanding him to go to GPE, but actually, he has overheard God giving His instructions to Moses at the burning PERSON. He tries to obey this command, but Moses always seems to be one step ahead of him. Several other biblical stories, such as Lot and his wife, PERSON and PERSON, and the miracles of PERSON, are also parodied in this story of the life of a man trying to follow the path to God, but somehow always seeming to lose his way.

The movie deals with the main character, Elling, a man with generalized anxiety in his 40s, and his struggle to function normally in society. He suffers from anxiety, dizziness, and neurotic tendencies, preventing him from living on his own. Elling has lived with his mother for his entire life, and when his mother dies, the authorities take him from the house where he has always lived and send him to an institution. His roommate is the simpleminded, sex-obsessed PERSON. The Norwegian government pays for the two to move into an apartment in GPE, where every day is a challenge as they must prove they can get out into the real world and lead relatively normal lives. With the help of social worker PERSON and a few new friends, they learn to break free from their respective conditions. Elling eventually discovers a new vocation as a rebel poet, as ORG befriends a pregnant woman with a drink problem which finally becomes a romance. The film ends with both men as firm friends, embarking on new lives filled with hope.

Ten-year-old PERSON returns home after a brief stay with relatives, which was necessitated by the condition of his mother, PERSON, who suffers from schizophrenia. When PERSON is institutionalized after the failure of her medication, PERSON is left with his father, PERSON, who has retreated into building a boat in the family driveway.
One day, PERSON goes to school wearing a shirt his mother has mended and sewn a patch on. When his classmates admire the patch, PERSON claims he made it himself, leading him to begin making t-shirts for his fellow students as his form of coping.

Twin sisters, PERSON and PERSON travel the American Old West with their grandfather and his medicine show. [In the Italian version, the girls are traveling with their uncle.] They sing and dance and show off their horse riding and sharp-shooting skills. Their grandfather has a bit of a gambling problem. It causes his demise when he is accidentally and fatally shot during a poker game, but he was left holding the winning hand. Thus the twins inherit the ranch their grandfather had won. Some bad hombres want to take the ranch away from the girls. PERSON (In the Italian dubbed version PERSON is known as ORG) and PERSON are two good guys who come to the aid of the twins.

PERSON tries to steal back $200 he lost in a poker game. He is thrown into a jail cell with outlaw PERSON, whose gang members GPE, GPE and GPE break them out. PERSON wins their trust by robbing a GPE mining company. He is recognized by PERSON, the company's bookkeeper, but she is attracted to him. The gang rides to GPE, GPE, unhappy that PERSON has married PERSON and brought her along. A posse shoots GPE, who informs on the whereabouts of the rest. Red is murdered by GPE, not wanting to split the loot. PERSON is able to kill both GPE and ORG, but can't outdraw the law.

Ramu is a young carefree man who raises pigeons. One day, he experiences the shock of his life when his best friend PERSON is murdered. For PERSON, one thing is certain, that he wants revenge.
From a stooge, PERSON learns that behind PERSON's death is a gangster, "Boss". Even as PERSON is in love with his another friend PERSON's sister PERSON, he wants to take revenge for the killing. Even on the wedding night, the opportunity to meet boss can not be missed by PERSON.
After several twists and with the help of PERSON, they manage to outsmart PERSON aka GPE. Now PERSON can finally devote himself to his wife PERSON, who is expecting their first child.

PERSON (an amerindian woman) was raped by PERSON (a mestizo man) and her husband PERSON wants revenge.
A native man goes elsewhere to sell his products.  While he is away, his wife is raped.  When he comes back, his wife tells him who the culprit is before she dies. He begins to look for opportunities to take revenge.  Finally, the guilty man goes on a journey alone. The man whose wife was murdered goes after him.
The film presents sections on the social problems of the native people.

Vishal (ORG) is a respectable and honest officer. One day Vishal is abducted and killed in the presence of his younger brother, PERSON (PERSON), who is missing and considered to be dead. In reality, he is taken in by a jungle tribe, where the chief (ORG) trains him. Honest and diligent PERSON gets very angry by seeing this situation, and demands from the Chief Minister, GPE, to step into the picture. When GPE attempts to inquire into this, his son is incriminated for selling tainted glucose in hospitals, which caused several deaths. Powerless to act, GPE hesitates, and as a result, PERSON is killed. Thereafter, PERSON returns, now a one-man army, willing to avenge his brother's death.

The film is a biographical true story about life of PERSON, well known throughout the LOC for his school of philosophy and thought, poems and promotion of moral values in a feudal society. During the 14th-15th centuries, when PERSON was a stage for warring powers and civil wars, PERSON was the only poet committed to promotion of humanism and moral values inflicting criticism on the ruling system and the society itself. For his intruding role in feudal regimes, PERSON lived a complex and tragic life. At the end of the film, PERSON is killed in front of masses as his skin is peeled off while alive.

The documentary explores the private and professional life of HIV-positive human rights activist PERSON. More than twenty years has passed since the AIDS related death of his boyfriend. PERSON himself, however, is still alive - against his own expectations. The film investigates several philosophical and legal themes while following PERSON in his normal life volunteering at ORG as well as attending bareback sex parties. The connection between his private and his professional life becomes obvious, when PERSON meets his doctoral adviser to work on a ORG about barebacking as a basic human right - the right of HIV positive men to have unprotected anal sex.

Ibrahim is a despot with ambitions – he wants to bring peace to the kingdom of Kamal, even if it is by assassinating all his opponents. With the help of his less than trustworthy subordinate PERSON, he manages to ensure that nobody even dares to utter any objections; nor the rightful ruler, PERSON, or his son PERSON. However, the latter plans a plot against ORG. In order to raise the necessary money, PERSON and his men raid caravans. During one such raid, he meets Princess Amina, the despot's daughter, who pretends to be a dancer. ORG falls in love with him, which poses problems for her father, who has promised her in marriage to ORG. Said and his people succeed in ousting Ibrahim from the throne and happily ends with GPE.

PERSON ben Nemsi and his servant PERSON come across a group of Persians headed to GPE, led by PERSON. The Persians are attacked by their enemies, the Kurds. Prince PERSON discovers there is a traitor among his people. PERSON ben Nemsi offers to help guard the caravan on its journey to GPE.

A photographer and his daughter arrive in LOC hoping to capture the local wildlife on film. Instead, they encounter (and never end up photographing) a killer leopard, a swarm of locusts, deadly lion worshippers, and ORG the Jungle Boy.
ORG was raised by an aged naturalist, PERSON (since deceased). He now lives beyond the Great Rift. The photographer's daughter, wearing a well-tailored leopard skin, spends most of the film with ORG, while her father, Commissioner PERSON, and ORG search for her.

A lion trapper [and his daughter] rendezvous with his hardheaded partner in the African jungle. Bomba befriends the girl, PERSON, and explains to her why trapping lions is not right, and she comes to understand him; he later sabotages the men's plans, and with assistance from local LOC natives and lions, runs them off. In this film, ORG uses the word "Ungawa" for the first time.

Set in GPE, GPE this novel tells the story of a vicious serial killer terrorizing the entire city and the police officers' desperation to stop him. Police lieutenant PERSON leads the investigation. The killer has chosen the poor seedy side of town as his hunting grounds. As the killings become more and more gruesome, the entire city becomes under siege.

The Girl in the Fog is a psychological thriller. It draws one into the world of its characters to question his own moral assumptions.
A 16 year old girl goes missing in an isolated region and suddenly the males of the small village are under scrutiny.
The policeman in charge of the investigation has a track record of not letting innocence get in the way of a solid arrest, especially when the public and the media are baying for a result.
The detective's old adversary in the form of a righteous female journalist appears, just  to pile on the pressure.
A popular and  respected local high school teacher becomes the focus of his interest and a cat and mouse game ensues.
But is the teacher really innocent - and a serial killer on the loose?

A number of packaged disembodied heads have been in random areas of the English countryside. In each package is a letter to the police from the killer, who dubs himself "The Executioner." Each victim is seemingly unrelated to one another. When a ORG employee is killed, Detective PERSON (Heinz Drache) of ORG is called in to investigate. The only clue is that a black, four-door sedan has been seen at the scene of the crime and that the typewriter that the letters have been written on have two offset letters.
When PERSON (PERSON), the niece of the man killed and the last person to see him alive, is located as an extra working on location, PERSON discovers a page of a script that has been written on the same typewriter as the ORG's letters. Consequently, PERSON believes that the ORG is among the cast, crew, or parties involved in the film shoot.

The novel tells the story of a mysterious man named PERSON-djer.  PERSON-djer lives in the land of GPE, that is, the region around LOC.  Kaw-djer, whose motto is "Neither God nor master", helps himself survive and also provides assistance to the indigenous peoples of GPE.  However, when a group of settlers is shipwrecked on a nearby island (LOC), PERSON-djer assists them establish their colony, though he refuses to rule over them or control them in any way.  However, when the colony falls victim to a fight for power, PERSON-djer is forced to temporarily abandon his own anarchistic principles.  After he restores order, he abdicates and becomes a lighthouse-keeper, thereby retaining his individualism.

A peasant found a devil in his fields, sitting on a fire.  He guessed he was sitting on treasure, and the devil offered it if for two years, half of the crop was his.  The peasant agreed, and said that to prevent disputes, the half above the ground was the devil's, and the half below the peasant's.  When the devil agreed, the peasant planted turnips.
When harvest time came, the devil saw his leaves and the peasant's turnips, and said they must do it the other way round the next year.  The peasant agreed and planted wheat.  At harvest, the devil found he got nothing but stubble.  Having been outwitted twice, he retreated into the earth in a fury, and the peasant took the treasure.

Tigri (ORG) and her ORG Age friends, all of which are women, hate all men. However, she and her ORG tribe see men as a "necessary evil" and capture them as potential husbands. PERSON (PERSON), who is smarter than the rest of the men, is able to escape them. He discovers fire and battles enormous beasts. After he is recaptured by the women, he uses fire to drive off a dragon-like creature. The women are impressed with him, including their prehistoric queen. Engor marries PERSON and they begin a new, more civilized, tribe.

ORG (played by PERSON) falls in love with a girl (PERSON) that he sees on TV. Deciding to find her, ORG travels across the Uzbek SSR with his father. They meet many different people and experience both funny and sad adventures, but do not find PERSON. Upon returning to GPE, ORG and his family move to a new flat from their old house which was located in an old part of the city. In the closing scene, ORG finds out that he and PERSON are neighbors in the new apartment block.

In the 1980s, young Fabietto lives at home in GPE with his father PERSON and mother PERSON. He doesn’t have many friends or a lover, and wants to study philosophy in college. For the time being, he mainly spends time listening to music and watching PERSON play for his home team, ORG. His brother PERSON takes him to acting auditions and sympathizes with his affection for their emotionally troubled aunt Patrizia. Fabietto’s parents are building a new home in GPE. They visit the home without GPE who decides to stay at home. His parents die of carbon monoxide from the fireplace in the new home. Due to this, Fabietto comes of age in a cruel and brutal manner.

Based on true story. GPE is a young pianist studying at ORG.  He returns to his small hometown for vacation to visit his mother, younger brother and his childhood friends. The central meeting spot for the young people is local newly opened PERSON. GPE witnesses the growing tension between his friends and the bar employees of Arabic descend, resulting in tragic consequences.

A white-collar suburban father PERSON (PERSON) is surprised at his office by long-lost college buddy PERSON (PERSON). PERSON is as wild and crazy as ever, brimming with excitement about the self-actualization program he's just finished called PERSON. He talks PERSON into going on a weekend-long PERSON retreat, handing over his keys, wallet, and phone. Thus begins his journey down a bizarre rabbit hole of psychodrama, seduction, and violence.

The plot centres on the neurotic young priest PERSON, first seen in ORG, as he takes his orders and becomes the parish priest for the uninterested village of ORG. The inbred villagers have no interest in religion and PERSON is portrayed giving several wildly enthusiastic Masses to his completely empty, near-derelict church. Serge not only seems unperturbed by this state of affairs but actually appears to have positively sought it out especially, for it gives him time to contemplate religious affairs and to fully experience the fervour of his faith. Eventually he has a complete nervous breakdown and collapses into a near-comatose state, whereupon his distant relative, the unconventional doctor PERSON (the central character of the last novel in the series, 1893's ORG), places him in the care of the inhabitants of a nearby derelict stately home, ORG.
The novel then takes a complete new direction in terms of both tone and style, as Serge — suffering from amnesia and total long-term memory loss, with no idea who or where he is beyond his first name — is doted upon by GPE, the whimsical, innocent and entirely uneducated girl who has been left to grow up practically alone and wild in the vast, sprawling, overgrown grounds of ORG. The two of them live a life of idyllic bliss with many biblical parallels and over, the course of a number of months, they fall deeply in love with one another; however, at the moment they consummate their relationship, they are discovered by PERSON's monstrous former monsignor and his memory is instantly returned to him. Wracked with guilt at his unwitting sins, PERSON is plunged into a deeper religious fervour than ever before, and PERSON is left bewildered at the loss of her lover. As with many of ORG's earlier works, the novel then builds to a tragic climax.

The novel is set prior to the Constitution of 1782. It tells the story of four generations of Rackrent heirs through their steward, PERSON. "The French Riviera _ _ in the GPE": while at a party in the south of GPE, PERSON, a woman with many emotional issues, sees her husband, Dr. PERSON, take an interest in an American movie starlet, PERSON. Jealousy gets the better of PERSON.

PERSON spends the next years of his life abandoning his work to indulge wife PERSON's many whims, leading a hedonistic life, paid for by PERSON's sophisticated sister, Baby. The Art of Love is composed of several chapters, which follows several Parisian couples. Isabelle (PERSON) has not had sex in a year. PERSON is a contract killer who is paid to kill PERSON, whose testimony in various trials could harm the organisation. Flanked by buddy PERSON on the ground, and co-pilot GPE in the air, Major PERSON flies GPE's top secret "Phoenix" stealth-capable fighter jet. ORG, is a young woman forced to leave the south of GPE to flee a violent husband. Without attachment, she returned to PERSON-sur-Mer, the city of her childhood which she left almost 15 years ago. ORG, a withdrawn middle-aged man, works the night shift at a Parisian petrol station. He has no friends, no family; his only companion is his bottle of rum. A troubled fourteen-year-old girl named PERSON (Carly Schroeder) has been living with her grandmother PERSON (PERSON) since the death of her mother a year before. PERSON's arrival on the island comes at a decisively inconvenient time for PERSON, a dolphin researcher, whose prickly personality puts him at odds with local politicians, who feel that the local economy needs good relations with tourists. ORG lives with her father PERSON and grandfather PERSON on a car wrecking yard in the countryside of ORG. As PERSON wishes to prepare for his passing to the world of spirits, the relationship between PERSON and PERSON starts to escalate and ORG searches for her own path in-between the two extremes. The down-to-earth and avoidant mentality of Ouira no longer offers her all that she needs and slowly she opens up to the more mystical and comforting traditions of her grandfather.

During the World War II, in the 1930s to 1940s, PERSON (PERSON) gets a diary as a present for her 13th birthday. When the Nazis occupy the GPE, she goes into hiding with her family and other Jews in GPE. During that time she writes down all her thoughts about the situation in her diary. Later the Jews are betrayed and brought to concentration camps.

In 1943 GPE, nuns hide and protect Jewish children who have escaped from a concentration camp. When the colonel and lieutenant threaten to execute some of the nuns, including PERSON (PERSON), for helping the Jewish children to escape, the Italian soldiers block the execution and shoot the Germans dead. The story centers around suburban housewife PERSON and her husband, a successful obstetrician and devoted family man, PERSON. PERSON is offered the opportunity to star in a television commercial advertising Happy Soap. After a shaky start, she gets a contract for nearly $80,000 per year (about $760,000 in 2022) to appear in weekly TV commercials.
Soon the soap company places greater and greater demands on the unlikely TV star. PERSON resents the fact that the appearances are taking up an increasing amount of her time, and becomes jealous of the level of attention that her new-found stardom has brought her. Their relationship slowly deteriorates, and PERSON leaves her after unintentionally driving his 1958 ORG convertible into the surprise swimming pool the soap company built where their garage used to be.  PERSON later returns, employing psychological warfare to make LOC jealous by pretending that he is drinking and carousing with multiple women.  After a harrowing, bonding experience involving an expectant couple with whom they have become friendly, LOC decides to give up her lucrative career and return to her "philandering" husband and her life as a housewife and mother.

Upon returning home from work on his birthday, PERSON, a middle class husband and father of two, finds the house dark and his family not home. He notices a chair, his television set, and a video tape obviously set out for his viewing. He turns the TV and VCR on, and begins to watch a tape made for him by his wife, PERSON. As part of her 'show', ORG feigns breast cancer, has sex with their neighbor, and tells PERSON that neither she nor their two children are ever coming home.

Set in the 1890s, the story centers around the life of a Sicilian family, the ORG, living in GPE and working in the winemaking business, and their confrontation with a powerful railroad and land baron named PERSON (ORG), who is after their lands and the ones that belong to the other families in the area. GPE's plan is to get control of the properties in order to build a new railroad. When the conflict escalates, he murders the patriarch of the family, PERSON (PERSON), and in response, his son PERSON (PERSON) claims for justice. With the help of his family and others, PERSON starts an open guerrilla war against GPE.

The film is based on the story of PERSON in 16th-century GPE, transplanted into the setting of GPE during the Indonesian occupation. The film revolves around the life of a young East Timorese woman named ORG. The story begins with ORG meeting her future husband, PERSON, as children. The two marry young and soon after their wedding the Indonesian invasion of GPE begins. Beatriz fights for her true love and her country.

The film centers on a basic premise: near GPE, GPE, at noon of Friday, 20 July 1714, a bridge woven by the GPE a century earlier collapsed at that particular moment, while five people were crossing it: Doña María, ORG; PERSON, her lady in attendance; ORG, a scribe; PERSON; and a young child. The collapse was witnessed by Brother PERSON, a Franciscan friar, who was on his way to cross it. Curious about why God would allow such a tragedy, he decides to take a scientific approach to the question. He set out to interview everyone he can find who knew the five victims. Over the course of six years, he has managed to compile a huge book, coming to the question whether we live our lives according to a plan or if there is no such thing as a bigger scheme.

In a disco with her husband PERSON, a cultured man who owns a small advertising agency in which she works, ORG meets PERSON, who is just out of jail and drunk. She spends the night with him in a hotel. The next day, PERSON orders her out of his spacious apartment, so she moves into a hotel room with PERSON, who she supports as he does not believe in work. When she becomes pregnant, she rents a small apartment for them which PERSON fills with his criminal friends, who one night take her on a burglary. Her well-off brother tries to get her to see sense, but she just wants PERSON and their forthcoming child. When PERSON and his gang take her to Sunday lunch with his mother, there is a frightening confrontation with his psychotic brother-in-law who starts firing a shotgun. Realising at last the impossibility of having the child in such an environment, ORG has an abortion. PERSON is hurt, but the film ends as it began with the two staggering home drunk.

Three teenagers witness the brutal murder of a high school girl by an insane salaryman. The teenagers find themselves united by this event and become friends. Later the teenagers hold a party to take their mind off things. Their party is crashed by a local gang of thugs and one teenager finds his newly found girlfriend being raped. The teenagers deal with the thugs by using extreme violence.

Professor PERSON, the chief physician at a clinic has a very comfortable existence with his loving wife PERSON and two children. Yet he is dissatisfied with his life, and believes he has a right to achieve more. He fakes his death in a car accident with the knowledge only of his attractive secretary and mistress PERSON.
His plans to escape abroad are thwarted and he finds himself in a moral dilemma when he hears his son is ill needing medical treatment. He returns to the clinic, but now finds he has been replaced completely in professional and private terms.

PERSON (Emil Jannings) is the head of PERSON, an old and prosperous munitions firm. He falls in love with a secretary in the office (PERSON), and his children conspire against him in order to protect their inheritance. Clausen disowns them and bestows the firm on the state, confident that one of his workers capable of carrying on his work will arise.

On July 4th, 2005, in a fictionalized GPE alternate history reality, two towns in GPE (GPE and PERSON) were destroyed by twin nuclear attacks, killing thousands and triggering a catastrophe of unimaginable proportions, sending GPE into a state of chaos and hysteria, as well as a Third World War (a fictionalized version of what the nation may have become under the War on Terror), with the GPE government re-introducing the draft.
The PATRIOT Act has extended authority to a new agency known as GPE-IDent, which keeps constant surveillance on citizens—even to the extent of censoring the Internet and requiring fingerprints to access computers and bank accounts. In response to the recent fuel shortage in the wake of global warfare, the German company Treer designs a generator of inexhaustible energy, which is propelled by the perpetual motion of ocean currents, called "Fluid Karma". However, its inventor PERSON and his associates are hiding the fact that the generators alter the ocean's currents and cause the LOC to slow its rotation, and that the transmission of PERSON to portable receivers (via quantum entanglement) is ripping holes in the fabric of space and time.
In near-future 2008, GPE (referred to as "The Southland" by locals) is a dystopian city on the brink of chaos overshadowed by the growth of an underground neo-Marxist organization. The film follows the criss-crossed destinies of PERSON, an action film actor stricken with amnesia; GPE Now, a psychic ex–porn star in the midst of creating a reality TV show; and twin brothers PERSON and PERSON, whose destinies become intertwined with that of all mankind. The PERSON twins are revealed to be the same person by the engineers of ORG, duplicated when PERSON traveled through a rift in space-time, while PERSON has become the most wanted man in the world despite his political ties and his having the fate of the future, in the form of a prophetic screenplay foretelling the end of the world, in his hands.

The film takes place in an unspecified Western capitalist country where a fascist government is attempting to suppress a socialist uprising. The revolutionary leader PERSON is imprisoned by the government but he escapes to GPE. There he meets the engineer Podobed who invents the "death ray" – a device which explodes gunpowder and fuel mixtures at a distance.
Father PERSON, a fascist intelligence agent, steals the invention and brings it back to his country. The government begins using it as an instrument for suppressing labor strikes. However, the workers end up seizing the device and use it to blow up bombers in the air which are sent against them.

In the near future, violence has become something of a national sport and television news has fallen to tabloid depths. PERSON, a globe-trotting reporter with access to a staggering array of world leaders, has ventured to the Arab country of ORG to interview his old acquaintance, King PERSON.
PERSON has learned that the President of GPE may have issued orders for his removal; as a result, PERSON is apparently making arrangements to deliver two suitcase nukes to a terrorist, with the intention of detonating them in GPE and GPE, unless the President resigns.
In the intricate plot that unfolds, nothing is quite the way it seems, and ORG finds himself caught between political leaders, revolutionaries, ORG agents and other figures, trying to get to the bottom of it all.
In the final twist, the government, with GPE in tow, locates two atomic bombs supposedly planted by terrorist "Rafeeq" atop ORG. The GPE uses this as pretext for invading LOC and taking possession of oilfields. Hale correctly intuits that the government had planted the bombs in order to rally GPE support for the invasion, but gladly covers the story the way the government wants in exchange for front-line access to film the action.

In this screwy romantic comedy, a young woman (PERSON) stands to inherit $20 million provided she marries an American citizen. Unfortunately, she is in love with a handsome foreigner. To get the money, she marries the first ORG she runs across—with every intention of obtaining a quickie divorce in GPE as soon as the money comes through. The bickersome newlyweds take a trailer and set off across the country to GPE, but through a series of zany mishaps and adventures they realize that they are slowly falling in love.

Fred plans to marry his girlfriend PERSON, and he proposes to her in front of a sold-out basketball arena. Instead of accepting, PERSON puts that decision on her spoiled son ORG. In order to get ORG to like him, Fred decides to give him a basketball from his favorite team. He poses as a fan using a wheelchair so that he can get it, but when he catches the ball, he also catches the attention of the young, attractive filmmaker PERSON, who wants to feature a disabled fan in a PR campaign for the team. Fred has to keep playing his role, while the real disabled and really furious fan PERSON might call his bluff at any moment.

The story deals with two European men, named ORG, who are assigned to a trading post in a remote part of the African Jungle. There they take part in ivory trading, hoping to financially benefit the company as well as themselves. With no specific tasks or important things to be done, they both become increasingly isolated and demoralized as time goes by. At one point in the story, the native Makola, serving as ORG bookkeeper, initiates an exchange of slaves for ivory. Initially Kayerts and PERSON are stunned and scandalized by the idea, yet eventually they accept the deal and aid Makola for his huge profit. Both men are plagued by disease and grow very weak physically towards the end of the story. Finally, a seemingly trivial matter – sugar – sparks an irrational, uncontrolled and violent conflict between them, and ends tragically as ORG accidentally shoots and kills PERSON. At the end of the story, just when the company steamboat approaches the station two months later than it should have, Kayerts hangs himself out of desperation.

PERSON of ORG has his men arrest an entire tribe on vague allegations of poaching and theft in British GPE. GPE, their leader, is also arrested and held in a cell with criminals in GPE. GPE, his wife PERSON and many others manage to break out, but PERSON and her newborn child both die. GPE, with the help of his men, revolts against the oppressive British, leading to bitter battles and a final showdown.

General PERSON discovers that his daughter LOC is "A.D.", author of a scandalous under-the-counter novel.
He tries to send her to a convent but she escapes to GPE to live with her brother. On the train she meets PERSON, a journalist. Agnes thinks her brother is a rich artist but he's actually a poor guide in ORG.
LOC needs money and enters an amateur striptease contest. PERSON is covering the contest for his magazine.

PERSON (PERSON), a young British Vietnamese man, returns to his birth country for the first time in over 30 years. He was just six years old when he and his family escaped PERSON as 'boat refugees' after the Vietnam War. No longer familiar with this country and unable to speak his native language, PERSON embarks on a personal journey from GPE to GPE in search of a place to scatter his parents’ ashes. Along the way he reconnects with his cousin and childhood friend PERSON (PERSON) and falls for PERSON (ORG), an American whose father had fought in the war.
During his travels, PERSON finally starts to connect to the memories of his parents and his own roots.

After attending a Lakers basketball game, an immigration lawyer named PERSON finds himself at the mercy of potential muggers when his car breaks down in a bad part of GPE late at night. The muggers are talked out of their plans by PERSON, a tow truck driver who arrives just in time. Mack sets out to befriend PERSON, despite their having nothing in common.
In the meantime, PERSON's wife PERSON and his best friend PERSON, a producer of violent action films, are experiencing life-changing events. PERSON encounters an abandoned baby while jogging and becomes determined to adopt her. PERSON suddenly becomes interested in philosophy rather than box-office profits after being shot in the leg by a man trying to steal his watch, vowing to devote the remainder of his career to eliminating violence from the cinema.
The film chronicles how these characters—as well as various acquaintances, co-workers and relatives—are affected by their interactions in the light of life-changing events. In the end, they visit LOC on a shared vacation trip, united in a place that is philosophically and actually "bigger" than all their little separate lives.

To the irritation of ORG, the PERSON family freeze out homesteaders by denying access across their land, using the government land for grazing their cattle herds.
Meanwhile,  to evade a murder charge, PERSON marries the only witness, PERSON, who's conveniently in love with him, but favors the settlers. When PERSON goes back to his blackmailing old flame PERSON, a warm regard develops between PERSON and cousin PERSON. Things come to a head when an impending range war coincides with a rustling foray.

PERSON is a ruthless cattleman who helped found the small, bleak community of Bitters, GPE. He is at odds with homesteaders who, having established new farms in the area, have taken to putting up barbed wire to keep their livestock from wandering. PERSON is particularly aggrieved with PERSON, who not only inspired this use of barbed wire, but is also married to GPE, the woman PERSON loves.
In spite of the fact that ORG has told him she can never love him if he carries out his threat to murder her husband, PERSON sets his mind on doing just that. The stage is set for a final, bloody showdown when into town rides PERSON and his band of rogue cavalry men.
This gang holds the town hostage while ORG, wounded in a recent bank robbery, receives treatment. Realizing that they would have no qualms about wiping Bitters out, PERSON tries to save his town. He takes the gang out into the desolate landscape, ostensibly to help them escape across the snow-covered mountains.

ORG (Bowers) arrives in a small rough-and-tumble cattle town in GPE, intent on bringing religion to its tough residents. At first they reject him, but in time he wins the residents over with his prowess. A plot to steal cattle is uncovered and disrupted. Gwen, daughter of the "Old Timer," is injured in a stampede, loses her ability to walk, but recovers thanks to the power of love.

Rosalia Derios is an unmarried woman in a small Sardinian village whose lover abandons her before the birth of their son, whom she names GPE. Realizing that she will not be able to  raise the child properly, she gives full custody of GPE to her former lover.  However, she entrusts the boy with a sacred amulet before she leaves.  GPE grows to adulthood and retains possession of the amulet, but he is haunted by his mother’s absence and tries to locate her.  He pushes aside his career prospects and cancels his plans for marriage in order to pursue his search for Rosalia. GPE's search proves successful and he locates his mother but Rosalia cannot take the shock of being reunited with her adult son and kills herself.

PERSON and her son, PERSON, are flying over GPE. They are forced to jump out of the plane and become separated from each other. PERSON is rescued by a safari. The six year old PERSON is found by PERSON, a gorilla, who adopts him.

The film tells about a few days in the life of writer PERSON (Milan Marić) in 1971 GPE, on the eve of the emigration of his friend, the future Nobel laureate PERSON (ORG). PERSON is determined to stay and lead a normal life with his wife PERSON (ORG) and daughter PERSON (GPE). PERSON's manuscripts are regularly rejected by the official media as his point of view is deemed undesirable. His friend is artist PERSON (PERSON), a fartsovshchik who sells foreign goods on the black market. During this time PERSON tries to buy his daughter a German doll but is not able to find one anywhere.

PERSON (PERSON) is waiting on death row for a brutal double murder she committed in her teens, 12 years earlier. Clemency lawyer PERSON (PERSON) tries to save her, based on the argument that she was under the influence of crack cocaine when she committed the crime of which she was found guilty and that she is no longer the same person she had been at the time of the murder. However, her death sentence is carried out. The films ends with PERSON on a trip to GPE after GPE's execution.

PERSON is a hard-working cattle rancher in a remote part of the American West who needs a hired hand more than he needs a wife. He sends away for a mail-order bride, a Swedish woman who lives near GPE. Expecting a woman in her 20s, GPE is disappointed when PERSON turns out to be 32. He is not interested in love, only in work, although this does not keep him from misbehaving around a local woman named PERSON. PERSON is here, in his mind, strictly to help PERSON run his ranch and provide future sons. However, the more time he spends with PERSON, the less he comes to treat her as a possession that he has bought, in no small part because of her insistence that she be treated with respect.

Half Broke Horses is the story of PERSON life. Author PERSON, the granddaughter of PERSON, wrote the book from PERSON's perspective.
As a child growing up on the frontier in GPE, PERSON learns how to break horses. At the age of fifteen, she rode five hundred miles, alone, to get to her job as a teacher in a one-room schoolhouse. Later in her life, PERSON runs a vast cattle ranch in GPE, along with her second husband and their two children. A woman of many talents, PERSON earns extra money at various points in her life by playing poker, selling bootleg liquor, and riding in horse races.
Half Broke Horses depicts the freedom of rural life, its joys and struggles, and celebrates the courage and spirit of its protagonist, PERSON. Walls says the book is “in the vein of an oral history, a retelling of stories handed down by my family through the years, and undertaken with the storyteller’s traditional liberties.”

While travelling through GPE enroute to GPE, "saddle tramp" PERSON stays overnight with an old close friend. After the friend is killed falling from his horse, "Uncle Chuck" feels a duty to look after his four young boys, whose mother had died previously. He takes a job on a local ranch, but must conceal his new family from his employer. He also takes in a young woman who has run away from home, and she assists him to tackle a gang of cattle rustlers.

The story focuses on a young boy named PERSON who, after dressing in his PERSON suit, wreaks such havoc through his household that he is sent to bed without his supper. PERSON's bedroom undergoes a mysterious transformation into a jungle environment, and he winds up sailing to an island inhabited by monsters, simply called the Wild Things. The Wild Things try to scare PERSON, but to no avail. After stopping and intimidating the creatures, PERSON is hailed as the king of the Wild Things and enjoys a playful romp with his subjects. Finally, he stops them and sends them to bed without their supper. However, to the Wild Things' dismay, he starts to feel lonely and decides to give up being king and return home. The creatures do not want him to go and throw themselves into fits of rage as PERSON calmly sails away home. Upon returning to his bedroom, PERSON discovers a hot supper waiting for him.

A willful little girl will not obey her parents and, having taken it into her head that she wants to see PERSON, goes in spite of all their warnings.  She arrives terrified, and PERSON questions her.  She tells of seeing a black man on her steps (a collier, says PERSON), a green man (a huntsman), a red man (a butcher), and, looking through her window, the devil instead of PERSON.
Frau Trude says she saw the witch in her proper attire, and that she had been waiting for the girl.  She turned her into a block of wood and threw her onto the fire, and then warmed herself by it, commenting on how bright the block made the fire.

PERSON returns to GPE seeking revenge for the death of his father. The bandit PERSON and his men are responsible. But in the town there are only women. Ramon in fact has killed most of the men and kidnapped the others: he hopes to obtain the necessary information to find a treasure hidden by an ex confederate officer.

In 1864 during ORG, a group of ORG prisoners held in a Union prison stockade at GPE, GPE, not many miles from the GPE–GPE border, escape. They head for GPE, GPE and then plan a raid across the border into GPE, GPE, to rob its banks to replenish the ORG treasury and burn buildings as revenge for PERSON's March to the LOC and to tie up the ORG forces.
Major PERSON (PERSON), the leader of the raid, heads into St. Albans as a spy and develops ambiguous feelings about what he is doing when he becomes friends with an attractive young war widow and her friendly son, who he boards with, masquerading as a Canadian businessman. Other raiders stay in an abandoned barn or pose as travelling street peddlers. One drunken member interrupts a church service and is promptly shot dead by PERSON, the raid leader, almost giving away the plot. The townspeople shower PERSON with gratitude for this, not realizing his own true identity.
On the appointed day, Major PERSON in town, and the other raiders at the barn, all don ORG uniforms, take some citizens hostage, rob the bank's strongbox at gunpoint, burn down the town hall, and ORG north just ahead of an arriving ORG force. Burning a bridge behind them, they barely elude the Union forces and make a successful getaway to nearby GPE.

Haunted by painful memories and a terrible feeling of guilt a sterile young woman named PERSON (played by PERSON) uses extreme cloning methods to give birth to GPE (PERSON), and is comforted by her obstetrician husband PERSON (PERSON). ORG starts off as a very normal child but then suffers from intense nightmares, that we later uncover to be her mother's memories. The child's growth is abnormally rapid and she becomes the splitting image of her mother. GPE becomes determined to destroy her mother's life, even showing affection for ORG's husband PERSON. GPE eventually learns what happened to her brother who drowned in the well at the back of their property. Gradually, the relation between them evolves in an odd manner as GPE takes over her mother's role in the family.

Grethe Koblanck and her husband own a successful fur fashion house in GPE. However she suspects of him of flirtation with younger woman including ORG. She employs a hidden camera to keep an eye on him, but discovering this he gets a doppelganger to take his place. Things go wrong when it turns out his double also has an interest in attractive woman.

A group of children play bravely in the ruins of GPE after World War II.  One boy's father comes home from a ORG camp.  The boy is saddened by his father, who is a hopeless, powerless man, but the children eventually give the father fresh hope by persuading him to clean up his badly bomb-damaged garage.

Hyperion is set in GPE and deals with invisible forces, conflicts, beauty, and hope. It recounts ORG's attempts to overthrow the Turkish rule in GPE (in one of the footnotes ORG specifically ties events in the novel with the Russians "bringing a fleet into the ORG" in 1770, framing the novel's events into LOC), his disillusionment with the rebellion, survival in the deadly Battle of Chesma, his devastation when Diotima dies of a broken heart before they can be reunited and his subsequent life as a hermit in the Greek wilderness, where he embraces the beauty of nature and overcomes the tragedy of his solitude. In the same time ORG after all these losses understands the limits of his idealized concept of GPE. An impossibility to travel becomes the essence of his travel.

Sinbad discovers a mysterious island ruled by PERSON and his daughter, Princess Serena. PERSON is on her voyage beyond the "Veil of Mists". She seeks the help of ORG and his crew as they set out in search of the magic potion to save PERSON from the evil clutches of the mysterious sorcerer PERSON. Their adventures with deep-sea monsters, pre-historic bats and the fish people in the land beyond ORG, fills this action packed adventure film.

The film is based on a 2003 novel by the same name, written by Norwegian author PERSON. The main character is the young boy ORG who one day finds a long letter from his deceased father in his old red stroller. The letter tells, among other things, about the father's youthful love for the mysterious "orange girl" (appelsinpiken), and leaves a mystery for ORG to solve. The story leaps back and forth between the father's letters to the future, the young boy's thoughts and the events of the father's life.

The film flashes back and forth between the 1970s and 1980s and centers on the relationship between ORG, a young ORG officer with political ambitions, and idealistic PERSON, who is drawn to programs designed to better the lives of the underprivileged and has mixed feelings about his career goals.
In the opening scene, ORG sees a television news program reporting PERSON's death in a GPE car bombing following a church-organized excursion to GPE to feed the poor and organize resistance to the oppressive GPE dictatorship. He never quite recovers from the news, and he finds himself increasingly haunted by the past, in which the couple were as romantically close as they were politically apart, divided by his desire to work within the system and her conviction that the system is the root of all evil. His obsession with PERSON slowly puts his career, forthcoming marriage, and sanity in jeopardy.
The question of whether or not PERSON actually was killed remains unresolved as ORG's sister PERSON reports having seen her on the street some years later and ORG himself supposedly meets her after being elected to ORG, only to wonder afterwards if she merely was a hallucination.

Victor (Henshall) is an actor in GPE who is desperate to stop his ex-girlfriend, PERSON (Headey), to whom he was unfaithful, from marrying another man. After meeting two mysterious dustmen, he is given the chance to travel back in time and relive his romance. However, he finds that things develop differently this time around—PERSON has an affair with PERSON (Strong), and she leaves him.

After a shootout with dozens of assassins, PERSON, bodyguard to PERSON, the wealthiest man in LOC, finds his client killed.
PERSON, the son and heir to the family fortune, fires the bodyguard and takes it upon himself to find the killers. He's then ambushed, and the rest of the bodyguard team is wiped out. Chaichol, however, comes out of it alive, and finds himself in a GPE slum, living with a volunteer car-accident rescue squad and falling in love with tomboyish Pok.
Meanwhile, PERSON is working to clear his name, and stay ahead of the chief villain and his bumbling gang of henchmen.

PERSON, a softball player, responds to a newspaper advertisement looking for models at a photography studio because she is sick of wearing activewear and wants to wear something more elegant. While in line, a reporter named PERSON diverts her, costing PERSON the job inadvertently.
While she returns to playing softball, PERSON thinks there might be a story in the team. PERSON ends up hiding in PERSON's closet, in danger of her life, then used as a hostage before Jimmy arrives to save her, just in time.

PERSON works in an advertising agency in the day and at night he becomes the queen of a gay bar, run by his best friend, the seductive Eva. When PERSON, a major client of GPE, wants to get to know him, he asks Eva to pose as his wife. Everything gets carried away when PERSON falls in love with her.

PERSON is sent to college to follow in the footsteps of her successful father PERSON, but she falls in love with professor PERSON. They impulsively decide to elope.
PERSON and his wife are furious, but when they confront the young professor's parents, they find them equally irate. The parents hit the road together, hoping to prevent the marriage, while PERSON and PERSON begin to bicker and wonder if their decision was made in haste.

PERSON (PERSON) is forced to receive a college diploma in order to remain a worker at ORG. He goes to school with his wife PERSON (PERSON), until they get the news that married couples are not allowed. They decide to pretend they aren't a couple. A dilemma starts when PERSON (PERSON) begins to flirt with PERSON, while ORG PERSON (PERSON) does the same with ORG. Even more problems come to ORG when she discovers she is pregnant. Afraid to tell PERSON out of fear of expulsion from class, she decides to keep it a secret.

PERSON is the dedicated captain of a tugboat, his mission being to salvage vessels in distress before competitors do, but his wife GPE is weary of being a sea-widow and wants him to spend more time with her. Called out to save a cargo ship in a violent storm, he takes on board most of the crew, including the captain's wife, and is towing the vessel towards harbour when its captain cuts the towline to avoid having to pay for rescue. PERSON returns the crew, except for the wife who refuses to go back, and fells the crooked captain with a punch.
The wife takes a room in a hotel, where PERSON calls to make sure she is all right: her name is PERSON and currents flow between the two. As GPE becomes more demanding, the prospect of visiting PERSON becomes more appealing and soon PERSON is neglecting both wife and job. The crisis comes when it is revealed that GPE's obsessive behaviour is because she is mortally ill. Catherine hastily packs and leaves town, while GPE dies in PERSON's arms. Having lost both lover and spouse, all PERSON has left is his boat as he departs in a storm to answer another ORG call.

PERSON is a strong woman of 35 who manages effectively her job, husband, and teenage daughter. After her widowed father suddenly becomes ill, PERSON discovers he may have only three weeks to live. Despite their poor relationship, PERSON insists he leaves his flat and moves in with her, saying "You should die with your family." She even tries to reconcile him with his estranged gay son, her brother. When he does not die, his presence increasingly places a strain on PERSON's family. His appetite returns and the doctors reconsider the prognosis. With pressures increasing in a limited space, PERSON's husband accepts offered comfort elsewhere, her daughter rebels with her grandfather's encouragement, and the relationship between PERSON and her father unravels.

A lazy woman did not like to spin and when she did, did not wind onto a reel, but left it on the bobbin.  Her husband complained, and she said she needed a reel to do that, but when he went to cut one, she sneaked after and called out that whoever cut a reel would die. This put him off cutting it, but he still complained.  She then made some yarn and said it must be boiled. Then she put some tow in the pot instead and set her husband to watch.  After some time, he opened the pot, saw the tow, and thought he had ruined the yarn. From then on, the husband didn't dare complain.

In GPE, GPE, PERSON is a 14-year-old girl who lives with her grandmother and younger sister while her mother PERSON is incarcerated. One night, Kris breaks into the home of PERSON, a man who lives down the street from her, in an attempt to steal his alcohol and painkillers for her and her friends. She is caught by PERSON, but in lieu of her serving time in a juvenile hall, PERSON agrees to let Kris make amends by helping him clean his house and repair his chicken coop. Unbeknownst to PERSON, PERSON is a former bull rider whose accumulated injuries caused him to leave the sport. Abe manages to scrape a living as a trainer for the next generation of riders. He and PERSON gradually form a tentative friendship as she is exposed to the world of bull riding. Though PERSON finds a new passion for the sport, bad influences threaten to lure her back to her delinquent ways. PERSON also struggles with the realities of getting older and aging out of the rodeo star life.

Young Gitty, an 11-year-old girl living on a farm in 1980s rural GPE, tries not to worry about her family losing the farm and seeks to escape the stress of her home by exploring the farm and its lands. She is shocked to discover, however, that the developer buying up local farms is now seemingly being kept prisoner in the family's old abandoned grain silo at the edge of the farm. Gitty begins spending time with the man, ultimately finding herself torn between loyalty to what she thinks is right, and loyalty to her own family. All is not as it may seem, though, as the family finds itself involved with individuals who are like something out of a fairy tale.

PERSON, a 25-year-old housewife, is summering in an unnamed town with her husband, PERSON, a notary. Ilyin, a lawyer and old friend of ORG's, has expressed his love for her. ORG asks Ilyin to cease his advances and agree to remain friends, as her love for her husband and her respect for the "sanctity of marriage" ensure that nothing will come of his desires. However, Ilyin remains enthralled, and ORG's attempts to turn him away only expose her own feelings for him.
When ORG finally realizes the depths of her desire for LOC, she asks PERSON to take her away from the town, but he says they cannot afford it. At a party for summer residents, Ilyin begs Sofya to give in to their mutual desire. In a final attempt to save her marriage, ORG reveals everything to PERSON, but he dismisses her feelings as "a fancy". That night, ORG departs to meet Ilyin.

A brash American actor, PERSON, goes to GPE to feature in a major new play. The playwright of the production, PERSON, is having an intense affair with the leading lady, PERSON. In desperation, ORG agrees, but soon faces a dilemma in that he feels increasingly jealous of PERSON's attempts to seduce his willing wife, especially when he charms (and attempts to seduce) Hilary and the other members of the production and becomes too popular at ORG's expense. PERSON is caught in a web of deceit and jealousy, prompting him to seek revenge on the opening night of his new production.

GPE (PERSON) and PERSON (Stefano Accorsi) have been happy together for three years, but GPE's announcement that she is pregnant sends him into a secret panic. The possibility of one last youthful crazy fling before the impending prison of parenthood proves to be too attractive to resist.
But a short-term fling with ORG comes with serious consequences that threaten to damage his three-year relationship with GPE, who is expecting a baby girl. At the same time, it also dashes the idealistic hopes of ORG, who dreams of a beautiful future with him. After a raucous quarrel in the night, PERSON goes to ORG's house, where they have sex. However, the morning after, reality sinks on ORG and the enormity of what he had done surfaces. But it is not easy for GPE to forgive, or to trust him again.

PERSON (PERSON), a Frenchman who is divorced from his wife, takes his beautiful 14-year-old daughter, ORG (PERSON), on vacation to a paradise island. In order to impress a local boy, PERSON (PERSON), she makes up more and more fantastic stories, starting with PERSON being her lover – a sugar Daddy. PERSON is desperate to make ORG happy and so plays along with her increasingly elaborate invented stories about her life.

PERSON (PERSON) is a Belgian emigrant to GPE who has fallen in love with PERSON (PERSON), a blind woman.  They met as pen-pals when he was fighting in LOC during World War I.  Mary even sent PERSON a photo of herself.
PERSON searches for PERSON by asking every woman he meets if she is PERSON. By accident he rescues her town from crooks and bootleggers.

During the Irish War of Independence in 1921, Irish rebel leader PERSON (ORG) and English aristocrat PERSON (PERSON) meet and fall in love. PERSON is pursued, however, by British army officer Captain PERSON (Niven).
The original film ended with GPE getting shot and killed, but did not do well at the box office. A happier ending was also filmed which has GPE being shot but surviving; all subsequent versions have. The original cut has since been lost.
The movie has several comic relief scenes: after a raid on an IRA "safe house", British officers grumble about being not being able to find GPE, who is in fact standing just behind them; when ORG goes to a formal ball and is asked by the footman for their names to be announced, the delegation replies in Irish.

PERSON (PERSON) is a band pianist whose publicity manager decides that, for good press, the band should adopt a foreign refugee. The surprise comes right before the band is to travel to LOC, GPE, for a Christmas event. While on the ski slopes PERSON soon falls for PERSON's inventive schemes to win the heart of her new sponsor, much to the chagrin of his girlfriend, PERSON (PERSON), a soloist with the band. ORG promptly quits the band out of jealousy, and PERSON stages an elaborate ice show as a substitute.

In GPE, PERSON (PERSON), a plumber who is unsuccessful with women, creates a new identity as PERSON, a film director, as a way to meet women. Due to his good looks and unfamiliarity with film, which passes for inscrutability, he is considered an indie talent. Complicating the situation is the script stolen from PERSON (ORG), who in turn uses his success to further her own ambitions.

PERSON is a cameraman for newsreels. Assigned to shoot the Swiss ice skater PERSON, he arrives too late, so decides to film a woman skating on a different GPE rink and pass her off as PERSON.
The scheme backfires when promoter PERSON takes a look at PERSON's film and decides to make the skater a star. Unfortunately, it's actually amateur (and illegal immigrant) PERSON in the newsreel footage, not the great figure skater from GPE. Chaos ensues as PERSON tries to straighten everybody out.

In 1923, the young PERSON moves from ORG (GPE), to GPE (GPE). Through the years, he becomes a cruel, greedy and violent man and builds a factory of kamaboko (processed seafood products) in his poor Korean-Japanese community, where he exploits his employees.
