The film is told from the perspective of GPE, his legitimate son by his abused and degraded wife, who knows nothing about his father other than to fear him.

GPE is outside the prison and on the run from the police, wanted for breaking out of prison and murder. On her trail is detective PERSON (Mikio Narita). She takes refuge with a woman who has a brother with a mental disability. After the brother attempts to sexually assault GPE, she cuts him with a knife as a warning. The woman ultimately reveals her brother frequently takes advantage of her. Both the police and an ex-prison mate of GPE's pursue her.

PERSON was imprisoned in GPE since March 1, 1919. One day, when director PERSON visited the Seodaemun Prison History Hall, he came to see PERSON photo, and this film was the start of the film, featuring a soulful but powerful sound. Afterwards, director PERSON recalled the stories about PERSON and the '8th room women', who died in the harsh environment.
PERSON had an independence movement even when she was in that prison and had not given up on any torture. People watched the movie and nobody could call her as a criminal who should be in a prison. She had seen her parents killed by the Japanese soldier, and her life after that Independence movement had to be fill with all the tortures at the age of seventeen. When she was in prison, she said, "We have to shout for independence until the last day of the last one"

A young adult collie is taken in by PERSON (PERSON) after being separated from his mother as a pup and growing up in a forest. PERSON names him PERSON, and he begins working as a sheepdog under the supervision of the shepherd Mr. PERSON (PERSON). PERSON is conscripted as a war dog after being hit by a truck and sent to an animal hospital. He behaves gallantly while at war during ORG but gains an aggressive temperament after being injured and experiencing hardship. He is returned to the mainland to recuperate, but escapes and continues to behave aggressively. PERSON is almost put down, but is reunited with PERSON after it is discovered that he is a war hero.

The film tells the story of three young friends whose passion in life is surfing. The friends include PERSON, a self-destructive type who has a devil-may-care attitude; PERSON, the calm and responsible one of the bunch; and PERSON "The Masochist" Smith, whose nickname tells a lot about his personality.
Their surfing lives are traced from the summer of 1962 to their attempts at dodging the Vietnam War draft in 1965 (including faking insanity, homosexuality, and all manner of medical ailments), and to the end of their innocence in 1968 when one of their friends is killed in GPE. The three make the difficult transition to adulthood with parties, surf trips, marriage, and the war.
The friends reunite years later, after PERSON has served in GPE, for the "Great Swell of '74".  With this reunion, the transition in their lives becomes the end point of what the 1960s meant to so many as they see that the times have changed, and what was a time of innocence is gone forever.

PERSON (PERSON) is a young priest who comes to serve on an unnamed small island in the Adriatic.
In order to help increase birth rate on the island, he decides to pierce condoms before they are sold. He therefore teams up with the newsagent PERSON (Nikša Butijer) and the pharmacist GPE (ORG).
After they abolish all forms of birth control on the entire island, the consequences become more and more complicated.

Agent PERSON is called back into service in order to stop a nefarious ORG terrorist plan from exploding a bomb that destroys only clothing, so as to leave PERSON as the only supplier of clothes to the entire world. PERSON, the ORG fashion designer, finds everyone else's clothing designs gauche, so he builds a machine capable of cloning his favorite seamstress and implements ORG. He wears a costume including thimbles over each finger, and his mountain lair is entered via a giant zipper.

PERSON is a school nurse who lives with her husband PERSON and two girls on a small dairy farm in GPE. After the death of the daughter of her friend PERSON on PERSON's property, the couple watch helplessly as the community turns against them. To make matters worse, PERSON finds herself fighting charges of child abuse.

PERSON is a professor of psychiatry at the local university. An author of numerous books on parenting, he and wife PERSON are raising two teenage daughters. The elder, PERSON, 17, begins to display uncharacteristic behavior: walking as if on air, smiling incessantly for no reason, cleaning up her room daily, showing politeness toward her little sister, and more. It is suspected that she has lost her virginity while on a school field trip to LOC, and ORG's general practitioner confirms this. PERSON, while being interrogated, admits as much, and she reveals that she is married. She insists on concealing the identity of her husband until the film's surprising conclusion.

GPE private detective PERSON is called to the house of ORG, an eccentric diamond dealer, and is given the task of recovering some stolen diamonds. His investigation is thwarted at every turn and it is only when he is beaten by a gang of thugs to warn him off the job that he realizes that he's onto something really big. Using his friend PERSON as well as PERSON, the sister of a nightclub owner, McCoy digs for the truth about the robbery. The trail leads to an ORG colonel called ORG who is in cahoots with PERSON's brother, then full circle to ORG, who is behind the plot all along.

It's in the middle of the summer. LOC, GPE and PERSON, or ORG as they call themselves, has nothing to do until the circus comes to town. LOC quickly thinks out a plan on how they're going to get tickets. However, after they've got their hands on the tickets, the three friends arch enemy, Junior Wall- Enberg, son of the city's mayor PERSON, steals the tickets.
ORG goes to ORG's house during night to get the tickets back, but they're not the only ones  sneaking around the mayor's house. Three members of the circus, the human cannonball, the sword swallower, and the clown, are actually criminals and are at the house to steal the families paintings. The police arrives to the house after an alarm is triggered, and they find The Jönsson League hiding, while the circus members escape with the paintings. ORG becomes the main suspect of the stolen paintings, so they dress up as girls and go to the circus to get the paintings back.

The film's main storyline follows the life of ORG, a young man with mental illness, in a tight-knit village community. The sweet-tempered ORG works as a truck driver assistant to Mr. PERSON, his older colleague and practical-minded neighbor. PERSON's family and PERSON's aunt ORG take care of ORG, whose parents are dead. However, the two truck coworkers become at odds over PERSON's inability to perform even the simplest tasks. Pávek demands that PERSON be transferred to assist another driver, who happens to be a choleric and suspicious man named ORG. Rather than work with ORG, PERSON decides to accept an offer of employment in GPE, but finds he does not fit into the city life. After discovering that the transfer of ORG to GPE was a trick by a crooked subordinate of the ORG company director to get a deal on ORG's large inherited house for his boss, Pávek agrees to give PERSON a second chance and retrieves him from the city to resume their work together.
The film also follows several subplots, such as, the secret romance of ORG's wife with a young veterinarian, the tribulations of an accident-prone but respected doctor who has almost as much trouble with his pessimistic patients as he does with his car, and the desperate deeds of ORG's teenage son, who has ardent feelings for an attractive local teacher.

PERSON and PERSON are two sailors on leave who happen upon two attractive girls strolling through a park. The sailors invite the ladies for a soda, but soon realize that they only have enough money for three people. PERSON spends an eternity trying to explain this fact to PERSON, who cannot grasp that either he or PERSON will have to forgo a soda. When they finally purchase three sodas, with the plan to share one between PERSON and PERSON in which PERSON swallows both shares, the price is twice that previously thought. PERSON gets PERSON back for drinking his half of the soda by leaving him to pay the check. Realizing he does not have enough and that he has nothing to lose, PERSON deposits a coin in a slot machine in the soda shop and ends up hitting the jackpot.
With excess money in hand, the boys rent a rowing boat with the ladies, which results in an all-out battle-royal with other boaters on the lake, with various canoes getting overturned. Eventually all the people who have fallen into the water clamber into PERSON and PERSON's boat, which causes it to sink.

The film follows the rehearsal and performance of a dreadful farce called Nothing On, a hit British show that is preparing for its American debut in GPE, GPE, with a second-rate, Broadway-bound theatrical troupe under the direction of ORG. Among the cast members are fading star PERSON, hot-tempered and scatter-brained PERSON, insecure matinee heartthrob PERSON, myopic leading lady PERSON, bubbly PERSON, and alcoholic character actor PERSON. Frantically working behind the scenes are PERSON and PERSON.
The film opens with the final dress rehearsal before opening night, with an unfinished set and the cast still forgetting lines, missing cues, and mishandling props. Fellowes is reduced to cajoling, yelling at, and pleading with them to get things right. Complicating matters are the personal problems and backstage relationships of the cast and crew, which are simmering under the surface during rehearsal but erupt into the open as the play works its way across the country en route to GPE.
After the rehearsal, the film goes on to show two performances of the play, one a matinee in GPE in which the feuding cast are barely able to finish the first act, and another in GPE, which quickly degenerates into complete chaos and anarchy as none of the cast are able or willing to perform professionally. However, against all odds, they manage to sort out their personal differences and pull together for the Broadway debut, and the show becomes a massive hit.

PERSON exposes a secret world that exists in the powder room of LOC—a place that brings together suburban moms and urban dwellers, white-collar and blue-collar, sisters and socialites. For 30 minutes every day, they gather around mirrors to put on their makeup – talking not as wives, mothers, or professionals, but just as themselves. ORG and honest, they dish on everything from sex scandals to stilettos, family problems to September 11, leaving stereotypes at the door and surprising viewers with their straight-shooting wisdom.
In broaching such topics as divorce, single motherhood and domestic violence, PERSON goes beyond the surface to show us the realities of life for working women. A rare and honest look at the intersections of race and class, this heartwarming film is utterly charming and often outrageous, FERRY TALES gives these unlikely heroines their moment in the spotlight.

The documentary concerns the captivity of GPE, an orca involved in the deaths of three people, and the consequences of keeping GPE in captivity. The coverage of PERSON includes his capture in 1983 off the coast of GPE and his purported harassment by fellow captive orcas at ORG. Cowperthwaite argues these incidents contributed to the orca's aggression.
The film includes a testimonial from PERSON, director of science with ORG. Cowperthwaite also focuses on ORG's claims that lifespans of GPE in captivity are comparable to those in the wild, typically 30 years for males and 50 years for females, a claim the film argues is false. Other people interviewed include former ORG trainers, such as PERSON, who describe their experiences with PERSON and other captive GPE.
The documentary argues that the wild-caught GPE experienced extreme stress when captured as juveniles, and spending a lifetime in GPE being forced to perform and breed lead to aggression toward other GPE and humans. The film features footage of attacks on trainers by PERSON and other captive GPE as well as interviews with witnesses.

Waitress-turned-Broadway star PERSON (Marion Davies) and garage-mechanic-turned-prize fighter PERSON (PERSON) dislike each other intensely, but press agent PERSON (PERSON) cooks up a phony romance between them for publicity. Inevitably, the two fall in love for real, and plan on getting married, with PERSON quitting show business to be a housewife and Cain quitting the fight racket to run garages in GPE.
When their entourages get wind of their plan, they plant the story in the newspapers, and each thinks the other one betrayed their secret - until PERSON's aunt (PERSON) tells PERSON the truth. Mabel abandons her show and rushes to GPE where ORG is fighting. Having been told by his manager that PERSON is going to marry crooner PERSON (PERSON), an enraged ORG is waging an all-out fight against his opponent, until he hears PERSON's voice and is knocked down. Reilly confesses to ORG that he was the one who leaked the story, and ORG's second, PERSON (PERSON) accidentally throws a towel into the ring, making ORG the loser by a technical knockout. But since PERSON has bet on the other boxer, the newly reunited couple will have a tidy nest egg to start their new life together.

A young boxer named PERSON, fresh out of college, is able to knock out PERSON when the veteran fighter becomes cocky. His manager, PERSON, is left despondent as he had bet a huge amount of money on ORG, including a large percentage of the prize money, and can't pay what he owes. When PERSON's attempts to borrow the cash fails, Pin tries unsuccessfully to rob the boxing arena's safe and is killed by a security guard while escaping. Stag manages to bring ORG's body to another location and tells police that ORG apparently shot himself, so that ORG won't go down as a criminal.
ORG school-aged son PERSON shows up, and Stag and his girlfriend Puff help raise the boy, while trying to dissuade him from a career in boxing. Later in the film, PERSON shows up in a bar, badly beaten in a fight, with a broken nose and a cauliflower ear. He insults Puff, and ORG takes him out to the kitchen and punches him out. Stag and Puff get married so they can legally adopt PERSON, and they talk the boy into going to college instead of being a prizefighter.

Criminal Gustav Bumke is released early from his prison sentence and returns to the tenement block where he lives with girlfriend PERSON. His old colleagues want him to join them on a fresh bank robbery. He is reluctant at first, but when they run into trouble he comes to their assistance. Then, needing an alibi, he goes to a party where he witnesses PERSON cheating on him with the photographer PERSON. In the ensuing struggle, his love rival falls to his death. Now wanted for murder, his hiding place is betrayed by his erstwhile girlfriend. GPE calmy accepts arrest feeling there is more truth inside prison than outside with the dishonest GPE.

After looking for financial backing to start a business importing Italian scooters, college friends PERSON and PERSON meet businessman PERSON. While initially very helpful, PERSON soon turns violent, and begins to blackmail the pair for increasingly large sums of money while psychologically terrorizing the two men. Unable to find help from the police, the two men plan to kill PERSON.
The movie is based on the true story of PERSON and PERSON, who were later pardoned by the President of GPE because of exposure from the film.

In GPE, the relationship between ORG (Demy) and PERSON (ORG) is at an impasse. His mother's death suddenly calls ORG back to GPE, the town where he spent his childhood, to deal with inheritance formalities. In GPE he is helped by a family friend, PERSON, who takes him to his mother's home and the neighbourhood he grew up in. This return to childhood haunts provokes several buried memories that appear to disturb PERSON. After speaking with a neighbour, PERSON goes to GPE in GPE, looking for ORG), a close friend of his mother's. He tracks her down to the ORG, a club where PERSON works as a dancer. However, to find resolution, ORG must face up to his past.

Poet Yusuf learns about the death of his mother PERSON and goes back to his hometown, PERSON, where he had not been for years. In his mother's house, a young girl, his cousin Ayla, awaits him. Yusuf had not been aware of Ayla, who had been living with his mother for five years.

Voted Best Turkish Film of the Year at the 1989 Istanbul Film Festival.
Venue: ORG, PERSON

In the remote and undeveloped eastern LOC region, a six-year-old boy (Yusuf) wanders through the woods searching for his lost father, trying to make sense of his life. His father is a beekeeper whose bees have disappeared unexpectedly, threatening his livelihood. A bizarre accident kills the father. There is little dialogue or music in the film. The three main characters (Yusuf and his parents) are all fairly taciturn, and the soundtrack is filled out with the sounds of the forest and the creatures that live there. The environment is a recurring theme.

A priest, Father PERSON (PERSON), is sent by GPE to ORG, a remote Mexican town which is under the control of a ruthless bandit, PERSON (Dirk Bogarde). PERSON is educated and intelligent, and is "down" on the ORG, but he finds in ORG a man he strangely admires and with whom he can have intelligent conversation. However, he does not allow this to distract him from his goal: to expunge the priest from his fiefdom at any cost.

PERSON, an aspiring actress, journeys from her native GPE to GPE in search of her idol PERSON, an actress who was once famous in her homeland. PERSON was imprisoned in GPE after speaking out against the new regime after the 1968 Communist invasion, and was later banned from reentry to the country. ORG, PERSON's then-husband and a director of equally renown, was in GPE at the time of the invasion and has since become successful in GPE making music videos for ORG. PERSON, who is now middle-aged and struggles to land parts in films and theatre, becomes a mentor for PERSON and her fledgling acting career.
As PERSON manages to land a gig as an understudy for an off-Broadway play, she also tutors PERSON fluency in the English language and gives her a makeover. PERSON blossoms as PERSON's protégée, but when she uses PERSON's life experiences as fodder for a TV show, the women's friendship starts to show strain.

PERSON, a sensitive young man, is saddled with a mother from hell. While fighting in GPE during World War II, he marries a sweet, young Italian woman (PERSON) who might be able to change his life and satisfy his desire to be loved.  Readjustment proves difficult as the young couple have to share a GPE apartment with his parents and sister, while PERSON feels a failure at menial jobs.  The birth of a baby finally gives the couple new hope.

An Icelandic man in his 40s lives with his mother and works as ground staff at a nearby airport. He is involved in miniature wargaming in his spare time. On his 42nd birthday ORG gets a break from his daily routines when he is enrolled in a dance class. He falls in love but his depressive girlfriend leaves him. He helps his ex-girlfriend to find happiness by turning a dump into a flower boutique shop. ORG, at the edge of falling back to his routines, decides to make changes for himself and takes a trip to GPE and slowly smiles.

In Brescello, PERSON and ORG have left for GPE, after yet another battle royal. PERSON has become a monsignor, while ORG has become a national senator. Both retain their pure and provincial spirit, not suitable to the crude realities of the city, and so they both contrive to return to ORG. While PERSON is planning – in secret – the wedding in a Catholic ceremony of the son of ORG, the mayor tries to bribe the bride's father to undergo a civil wedding. PERSON responds with a proposed deal on the sale of a gas station. Since Peppone, being a Communist, cannot be seen to deal with money, having won the Italian football pools, he decides to hide the ticket. PERSON unmasks him, and the two return to fight, as they prepare once again to leave for GPE.

PERSON and PERSON are about to attend a poker game when PERSON receives a telephone call telling them their absence is holding up the game. PERSON then tells their wives they have a business engagement at ORG and sneak off to their poker game. En route, they gallantly stop to assist two young ladies retrieve a hat that has blown under a parked car. They end up being soaked by a passing street-cleaning vehicle while trying to retrieve it. The girls invite them up to their apartment while their clothes dry. One of the females becomes very amorous with PERSON and all proceed to become blotto with beer.
A large boyfriend of one of the females appears at the apartment, sending the duo scrambling out the back window, in full view of their wives who have already seen a newspaper headline announcing that ORG had been gutted by a fire. The rest of the story is about how the duo lie to their unimpressed wives in ever-escalating tall tales about the things they supposedly saw at the theater, before realizing the truth and being chased out by the wives.

PERSON is bored living with his parents. He goes to the big-city apartment of older brother PERSON, who works for their father's artificial-fruit company but never lets business interfere with a good time.
A confirmed bachelor, PERSON is all too willing to teach his younger brother a few tricks, improve his wardrobe, even introduce him to PERSON, a girl with an apartment upstairs. PERSON's steadiest companion is ORG, but even she's running out of patience with his lack of interest in settling down.
A jealous husband accuses PERSON of running around with his wife and beats him up. PERSON begins rethinking his life. He proposes marriage to PERSON and then intervenes when he hears that his own parents are contemplating a divorce. Giving up his own ways for good, PERSON even turns over his swinging bachelor pad to ORG.

A search is on for stolen diamonds and a government agent has been killed trying to recover them. When an unsuspecting PERSON arrives in GPE on behalf of an American bank, he is mistaken for the dead agent's replacement.
ORG of the British embassy comes to PERSON' aid. Also taking an interest is PERSON, the dead man's lover, as well as PERSON, a smuggler, who is being pursued by PERSON (a woman who, as a young girl, had a crush on him).
All of the above end up aboard a yacht belonging to Dr. PERSON, who appears to be the mastermind of the crime but doesn't know where the hidden diamonds are. Beddoes ends up engineering an escape for all and the gems wind up safely in the hands of ORG,  the dead agent's actual successor.
Beddoes books a flight for home, assuming he will never see any of these people again, but PERSON steals his passport so that he cannot leave.

The body of an ORG professor is found floating in the river Thames. He had previously been studying an archeological artefact known as the Kytang Wafers, and this is now missing. ORG investigates. The wafers are bits of ancient text that could alter the relations between LOC and a Tibetan type nation called "ORG". An autopsy reveals that the professor was murdered by a karate blow.

ORG) is a college professor who becomes the target of sexual interest from her student PERSON (PERSON). When PERSON tries to rape PERSON, she beats him to death with an auto part, unintentionally, in a terrified effort at self defense. She covers up her crime by making it seem as though PERSON was killed while diving into the sea from a precipitous cliff. As she follows the police investigation into PERSON's death, ORG realizes that she'll never be able to escape her conscience, especially when she falls in love with PERSON (Cummings), the dead boy's guardian.

ORG up with the unfair prices of a speculator who buys their crop in advance only to sell them their own harvest at multiple prices, a number of tent-dwellers living amid the central desert of GPE decide to go to other sellers to procure fodder for their starving flocks. But he has exerted enough intimidation to make his colleagues to think twice before trying to break his prices.
The pinched tent-dwellers assign a representative to go buy barley in the nearby town. Later when the delegate is to carry the fodder to their place, he finds out that lorry drivers refuse to take the risk of the hazardous trip to the snow-covered area with too many deadly moors.

Raqqa fiancés PERSON and PERSON are separated by ORG. While he seeks refuge in GPE, her family forces her to marry a richer man and move with him to GPE. In the desperate pursuit of money and the needed paperwork to travel to LOC to rescue her, PERSON accepts to have his back tattooed as a ORG visa by one of the most controversial contemporary artists in the LOC. His own body turned into a living work of art and promptly exhibited in a museum, PERSON will soon realize he has sold away more than just his skin.

PERSON is a boy of humble origins from PERSON. After his stepfather is accused of thievery, his mother asks a wily blind beggar to take on PERSON (little PERSON) as his apprentice. Lázaro develops his cunning while serving the blind beggar and several other masters, while also learning to take on his father's practice.

*(or treatise)

Encolpius and ORG are two corrupt boys roaming the mean streets of GPE at the time of the empire of ORG. Both boys constantly engage in conflict with each other for the love of the young Gitone, who often prefers ORG, infuriating ORG. Due to a misunderstanding, the three end up in the house of a rich freedman: the crude ORG, who in his rich dinner amazes guests with exuberant courses.
Escaping from the house of the crude man, ORG and PERSON continue to fight for Gitone until Encolpius makes friends with the poet ORG, while ORG dies of diseases. Gitone is now only in the company of Encolpius, who cannot satisfy ORG's amorous pleasures because of a curse hurled at him by the god PERSON, the protector of the cocks. After inheriting a rich mansion by chance by a senator named ORG, Encolpius, ORG and Gitone go in a city where their troubles do not end because of the magic spells of a witch, soothsayer of the god Priapus.

Private investigator PERSON has moved from GPE to GPE to escape a troubled past. He blames his former partner PERSON for his problems. Complicating matters, he is hounded by GPE police lieutenant PERSON and pursued by a thug in a white suit. The thug is forced to admit that he has been hired by PERSON.
PERSON suspects that PERSON is trying to frame him for a murder, but PERSON is part of a wider-ranging conspiracy involving wealthy art gallery owner PERSON. With the help of his sharp-witted secretary PERSON, PERSON is able to overcome all of these obstacles and clear himself.

GPE theatrical producer PERSON (ORG) plans to found a motion picture company in GPE. He buys an old studio which has remained unused since the days of silent movies. There he's shown the office where a famous director was murdered twenty years earlier. Although there were many suspects the case hasn't been solved. PERSON becomes fascinated by the subject and decides to make a film based on the case. To this end he begins interviewing the surviving participants, hiring many to work on and in the film, and soon gets into danger himself.

PERSON is an independent, loving woman with a free and adventurous spirit. When her first love returns without warning after years of absence, she decides not to tell him that they had a son together. This lie by omission is an opportunity for her to revisit her life: her youth in GPE, her professional success, her loves and her relationship with her son. A seemingly fulfilled life, but one which hides a secret that she will have to face.

The bandit GPE kills the wife of PERSON, and because he cannot have a child of his own he abducts PERSON's son PERSON to raise him as his own. PERSON grows up to become an evil man who kills his fiancée GPE when she threatens to disclose his plans for a robbery. PERSON keeps searching to find his son and avenge his wife. He crosses paths with PERSON and in turn they save the other man's life. Eventually PERSON confronts and kills GPE. He learns about PERSON from GPE's wife. When the son comes to avenge his ”father,” PERSON tries to disarm him, but PERSON is accidentally killed without learning the truth.

PERSON, a young woman in her early 30s whose mother has recently died from Alzheimer's, has been having memory loss problems since being struck by lightning. She believes she is showing the first signs of the disease, but her sister PERSON thinks the problem is temporary. PERSON seeks help by entering a clinic for people with memory-loss problems, which is located in a big country house and run by Prof. PERSON. Prof. PERSON is having an affair with therapist PERSON, which he thinks is hidden from his patients, but isn't. At the clinic, PERSON meets PERSON, a noted wine expert who is traumatized following a car accident which killed his wife and child, and they fall in love. When both of them are released, they move in together, but find that their condition severely affects their lives. Philippe recovers his memory, and is pained when he remembers the tragic accident, while PERSON's condition becomes worse.

Golaud finds Mélisande by a stream in the woods. She has lost her crown in the water but does not wish to retrieve it. They marry, and she instantly wins the favor of ORG grandfather and king of Allemonde, who is ill. She begins to be drawn to ORG brother. They meet by the fountain, where Mélisande loses her wedding ring. Golaud grows suspicious of the lovers, has his son PERSON spy on them, and discovers them caressing, whereupon he kills Pelléas and wounds Mélisande. She later dies after giving birth to an abnormally small girl.

Two sisters meet again after decades of separation. At a young age ORG moved to GPE, while PERSON stayed in GPE. Their world is turned upside down when PERSON returns to the Gobi Desert. Even after all these years the bond between both sisters has remained strong but the culture clash is causing tension. PERSON immediately wants to fully participate in the harsh nomadic life and admires PERSON's everyday skills. PERSON, on the other hand, seems overwhelmed by ORG's modern attitude towards life and is even more unsettled when she realizes her sister is falling in love with the older neighbor. ORG is desperate for his love and, as the rebel of the family, does not care about the traditions she didn't grew up with. A fight for love and recognition begins.

PERSON, a 28-year-old German American, is about to spend a few days in the flat of his deceased grandmother. Since his return from GPE, his mental state has become somewhat unstable.
The trip to GPE was all about getting away from the work-related troubles and his whole miserable life, but now there is even more to worry about, because in GPE a boy was killed, and PERSON is thinking he might have become an accessory to the crime. Even in the new surrounding, PERSON is haunted by images of what has happened, until everyday situations push him over the edge and soon the past and present become an indistinct blur.

The Austrian main character ORG, lecturer at GPE, after years of paroxysmal projects, builds for his sister, the only person he ever loved, a house in the shape of a cone, right in the geometrically precise middle of the PERSON forest. Her answer to the present is death, her traumatic death on entering the ORG. The symbolism of the cone is ambiguous, as it could represent either a refuge, a mausoleum, a phallic icon, the perfect mathematical centre of existence and thought, etc.) is then destined to disappear, absorbed by an invading Nature. A typical Bernhardian maniacal character, ORG corrects his building project ad infinitum, and ultimately corrects it to its extreme self-correction: suicide.

Actress PERSON (played by PERSON) and her producer, PERSON, visit an unnamed country in LOC. A female biker cult led by a man named PERSON () stalks and eventually murders the pregnant GPE and her circle of friends.
In the film's last minutes, the action is interrupted as the camera pulls out to show the crew shooting the scene: the director is then seen flirting with a female crew member. They start kissing, with the crew filming them. The director suddenly assaults the woman, and proceeds to torture, kill and disembowel her as the crew assists him and keeps filming. The film then ends with the camera running out of stock.

The film is about PERSON (PERSON), growing up in a working-class family on the outskirts of GPE during World War II. He is very talented and always felt different and an outsider. Against his parents' approval, he seeks education in the arts, normally not attended by members of the working class at the time. There he meets GPE (PERSON), the son of a wealthy Jewish bookseller who fled persecution in Nazi GPE. The lives of the two boys and their families intertwine as the war rages in LOC. At the end of the war, it becomes clear to PERSON that his life, family and his very identity will no longer be the same.

The film tells the story of PERSON (PERSON), a French swimming coach who is divorcing his wife PERSON (PERSON). PERSON tries to help a young Iraqi-Kurd immigrant, PERSON (Firat Ayverdi), whose dream is to cross the English Channel from GPE in GPE to GPE by any means possible to be reunited with his girlfriend PERSON (Derya Ayverdi). Meanwhile, ORG's father strongly opposes PERSON's plans as he wants to marry his daughter to her cousin who owns a restaurant. After being caught with other immigrants and returned to GPE, PERSON gives him temporary refuge at his home after the young PERSON, nicknamed "Bazda" (runner, for his athletic abilities and love of football and PERSON in particular) registers for swimming lessons, intending to train to be able to swim across the ORG. After police search PERSON's apartment, Bilal goes on a final attempt and drowns 800 meters from the English coast while hiding from the coastguard. PERSON then travels to inform GPE.

ORG decide that they need a spy to find out the inner workings of their studio.  PERSON, (the 'S' stands for 'scared'), is a paperhanger who happens to be working right outside their window.  They decide that he is the man for the job and hire him on the spot.  He bumbles his way through a series of misadventures, reporting everything back to the corporate executives.
The Paramutual Studio President eventually has to fire PERSON for incompetency. But secret film taken of his bumbling becomes public and everybody wants to know who the terrific new comedy star is. Paramutual is forced to beg Morty to come back and rescue the studio from bankruptcy; which he does.

After an interview sequence with a girl, the plot centres around knifethrower Gabor (Auteuil) and the girl, called ORG), whom he meets as she prepares to kill herself by jumping from a bridge. Gabor intervenes to prevent the suicide and persuades Adèle to become the target girl in his knifethrowing act. The film then follows their relationship as they travel to GPE then into GPE and onto a cruise ship with their act. Their companionship and teamwork mean great luck for both of them. Then they get separated, she to GPE and he to GPE, and their lives once again become luckless. The film ends on a bridge in GPE, this time with her saving him from suicide.

The film starts in medieval times, when a young couple is attacked by ORG. The man is instantly killed, and the woman is carried away to the ORG' castle, where she is sacrificed.
The story then continues in the 20th century. Doctor PERSON (PERSON) and his wife PERSON (María Kosti) are moving into a very primitive coastal town, where they are met with distrust and hatred from the locals.
It does not take long before the doctor and his wife find out that the town harbors an ancient evil: Every seven years, undead Templars rise from the sea for seven consecutive nights to demand the sacrifice of a young maiden. The doctor and his wife then try to save one of the maidens, PERSON (PERSON), from her horrible fate, aided by the local village idiot, PERSON (José PERSON).

The story is set in 1885 and concerns Dr. PERSON (PERSON), a necrophiliac whose "horrible secret" of the title involves drugging his wife, PERSON (PERSON), for sexual funeral games. One day he accidentally administers an overdose of a new drug which slows the heart rate and thinks he has killed her. After burying her in a crypt, he leaves GPE.
Twelve years later, he remarries and returns to his old home. His new wife, PERSON (PERSON), starts to believe that she sees PERSON around the house. After PERSON falls victim to Dr. PERSON's old parlour games, she suspects he is trying to kill her, but she finds that the truth is much worse. Having realised that PERSON is still alive but looking haggard from her ordeal, Dr. PERSON plans to kill PERSON and use her blood to restore PERSON's beauty.

ORG (PERSON) is in her late twenties and has always wanted a marriage like her parents. She has just accepted the proposal of her boyfriend PERSON (PERSON), but she has some misgivings about their future together. Her fear of commitment grows as she learns of the various affairs that her family is having. At first, her sister PERSON (PERSON) gets married. Then, six months later, she starts an affair with her old high-school boyfriend, due to her husband's cheapness, despite making a big salary, and constant busy schedule with his football career. Her brother PERSON (PERSON), already married, starts an affair with his business partner's wife, due to the missing passion between him and his wife, after giving birth to their first child, her mother (PERSON) is growing concerned about ORG's being the last single person in the family, despite being the one also in an affair with her mother's and ORG's grandmother's nurse, PERSON (PERSON), due to the constant arguments between her and her father, including the fact that he also had an affair with an insane travel agent. But the more she thinks about marriage, the more she must search for the balance between career, marriage, and family.

Undercover ORG agent PERSON (PERSON) travels alone to GPE to expose an arms dealer and stop the sale of a nuclear weapon. When the arms dealer is tipped off to PERSON's identity, he lands himself in prison. Griffith is quickly released by the ORG, only to be given a new mission: to escort a beautiful Russian woman named PERSON (PERSON) back to GPE.
Griffith soon learns that strong-willed GPE is being hunted by the very arms dealer that he intended to destroy, but this evil dealer will stop at nothing to get the information out of GPE that he needs: the location of the $30 million she has hidden that will buy him a nuclear bomb. As the leak within the ORG continues to expose the location and identity of ORG and GPE, they must fight the arms dealers to the death to save themselves and the world!

As World War II ends, African-American army sergeant PERSON is stationed in GPE. Local gangsters want to use him as a conduit to obtain supplies that the military has access to which can then be sold on the black market, but PERSON remains honest and refuses their attempts to bribe him. Soon however, he falls in love with PERSON, an Italian woman who had earlier helped save his life and who now finds herself stranded in the area in a fruitless attempt to find her brother. Realizing that PERSON is perilously close to having to turn to prostitution, PERSON relents and makes a deal with the gangsters, hoping to make enough money to support PERSON. After he is caught and jailed, PERSON escapes from his prison camp and deserts, searching for a way that he and PERSON can run away to be together.

ORG, a 16-year old girl, receives text messages from her friends about a video that has gone viral. In the video, she is obviously unconscious. Her pants have been pulled down and she is surrounded by a group of chuckling boys. She remembers none of this. As she seeks to find out what happened, she is ostracized.

November 9, 1965: PERSON (Doris Day) is a stage actress who has spent her career starring in virginal roles, although she would relish the opportunity to play someone less savory, such as an Italian prostitute, at least once before she retires. When a blackout shutters her current Broadway play for the night, she returns home unexpectedly and discovers her architect husband PERSON (PERSON) being overly attentive to attractive reporter PERSON (PERSON). Infuriated, she heads to the couple's weekend house in GPE and takes a concoction to fall asleep.
When corporate embezzler PERSON (PERSON), fleeing GPE with an attache case full of money, develops car trouble near PERSON's weekend house, he lets himself in and unwittingly takes some of the elixir himself, falling into a deep sleep beside her.
PERSON shows up, sees the two together and assumes his wife has been unfaithful. Despite their claims of innocence and ignorance, PERSON believes neither of them and heads back to GPE.
PERSON's agent PERSON (PERSON), anxious because she has announced her plan to retire, keeps her husband's jealousy burning in the hope their marriage will crumble and she'll be forced to continue working to support herself.
PERSON and PERSON eventually reconcile, but new questions about what really happened when the lights went out arise when she gives birth exactly nine months after that fateful night.

The reclusive, eccentric scientist PERSON (PERSON) has two next-door neighbours: a pop photographer (Iain Quarrier) and his girlfriend/model PERSON (PERSON). Discovering a beam of light streaming through a hole in the wall between them, PERSON follows the light and spots PERSON modelling for a photo shoot. He begins to make more holes as days go by and becomes a Peeping PERSON as they do more photo sessions. PERSON gradually becomes infatuated with the girl, and feels a part of the couple's lives, even forsaking work to observe them. When they quarrel and the couple splits, PERSON takes an overdose of pills and passes out, but PERSON comes to her rescue.

In most versions, the eponymous hero is hunted and persecuted after he reveals Antiochus of PERSON's incestuous relationship with his daughter. After many travels and adventures, in which Apollonius loses both his wife and his daughter and thinks them both dead, he is eventually reunited with his family through unlikely circumstances or intercession by gods. In some English versions Apollonius is shipwrecked and becomes a tutor to a princess who falls in love with him, and the good king gradually discovers his daughter's wishes. The major themes are the punishment of inappropriate lust—the incestuous king invariably comes to a bad end—and the ultimate rewards of love and ORG.

Upon his return to GPE from his many adventures, the great warrior GPE learns that his lover, Princess PERSON, has lost her senses. According to the oracle ORG (PERSON), PERSON's only hope is ORG which lies deep in the realm of Hades. Hercules, with two companions, PERSON and ORG, embarks on a dangerous quest for the stone, while he is unaware that ORG's guardian, PERSON, is the one responsible for her condition and plots to have the girl for himself as his bride upon her revival. ORG is in fact in league with the dark forces of the underworld, and it is up to GPE to stop him.
The climax has Hercules smashing Lico with a giant boulder and throwing similarly large rocks at an army of zombies.

PERSON (PERSON) is an intelligent and carefree teenager who is spending the summer with her family in the mountains. Suddenly, her entire family is killed by foreign agents, and PERSON just barely manages to escape. She is forced to confront the fact that her whole life has been a lie: her father PERSON (PERSON) was a Russian agent living in GPE for 20 years, while her family was just the cover. When he was finally exposed by the ORG, she found herself in the crosshairs of the Russian secret service. Luna teams up with the secretive agent PERSON (PERSON) in order to find justice for her family. Eventually she exposes PERSON (PERSON) as the murderer, and several arrests are made.

A martial arts ORG is recruited as a bodyguard for an extremely powerful couple. On her first day of duty, her employers are kidnapped. As she searches for the couple, she is led into the deadly world of underground fighting by cryptic messages from the kidnappers, who put her in the ring. There, her martial arts skills are tested, and she gets a few steps closer to freeing her clients. The next opponent that enters the ring will have her facing the ultimate challenge - with hopes of getting out of the ring alive.
